loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice O. is a hard-working woman. She sells provisions such as toothpaste, detergent, bath soap, etc. Eunice is married and she lives in Benin City with her family. She buys her provisions from new Benin market. The demand for her provisions is high. She hopes for the loan amount of US$ 875 to buy more provisions for re-sale. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for re-sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Osaro

texts.en: Osaro A. is a hard worker who sells provisions like toothpaste, detergent, bathing soap, and similar items. Osaro is married and lives in Benin City with her family. She buys her provisions from the New Benin market. With demand for her provisions high, she hopes to satisfy the demands of her customers by stocking her shop with provisions. She is seeking a a loan in the amount of 875 USD to buy more provisions. She says thank you to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Hands Together Group

texts.en: This group is called Hands Together. Its members are Hawa F. and Kadiatu T.. They are petty-traders in Makeni City. These entrepreneurs have received previous loans from Kiva through SMT. Those loans have created significant impacts on the businesses and lives of these people.  Nevertheless, they want a new loan of Le 1,600,000.00 to further enhance their businesses. Hawa is the leader of this group. She is 30 years old, married with 5 children.

loans.use: Expand their businesses

loans.name: Mastura

texts.ru:
Саидова Мастура, ей 27 лет. Занимается она  продажей женской и детской обуви и имеет 8 летний опыт. Местом деятельности Мастуры является  оптовый рынок «Корвон» г. Душанбе. Товары закупает у поставщиков из Китая и на оптовом рынке «Корвон», иногда заказывает поставщикам из Турции. 
Ассортимент продаваемых ею товаров очень разнообразен, особенно по ее словам клиенты дают предпочтение на удобные повседневные обуви. В разгар сезона продажи осенней обуви она хочет участвовать в программе Кива и получить займ в сумме 2000 сомони для закупа сезонных товаров.
texts.en:
Mastura S. is 27 years old. She sells women’s and children’s shoes at the Corvon wholesale market in Dushanbe. She has an 8-year experience in this business. Mastura buys her goods from suppliers in China and at the Corvon wholesale market, and sometimes from suppliers in Turkey. She sells a wide assortment of goods; her clients especially prefer everyday-wear comfort shoes. During the fall shoe season, Mastura wants to participate in the Kiva program and obtain a $600 loan to purchase seasonal goods.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seasonal shoes

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Sabenty Group

texts.en: Aminata J. is the leader of the Sabenty microfinance borrowing group, which has successfully repaid two loans to Kiva in the past.  Aminata is 30 years old, married, and has three children.  She regularly sells rice, slippers, and other basic provisions in her local market, along with the other members of the Sabenty borrowing group.  Because previous loans helped them expand their businesses and improve the quality of life for them and their families, they are now requesting a new loan of $1400.

loans.use: Add more items to their current businesses

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Ol-Tite Group

texts.en: Mustapha K. is the leader of OL-Tite, a microfinance borrowing group, which is now applying for its third loan.  Mustapha is 28 years old, married, and has three children.  He has worked for years selling clothes, and plans on utilizing OL-Tite's next loan by working alongside his group members, who are Unisa K. and Mary S., to purchase a wider variety of clothes and also an assortment of food items, which they will travel around to acquire in order to secure the best price.  Because previous loans have helped OL-Tite's members improve their business situations in the past, they are now requesting a loan of $1050.

loans.use: Add more goods to strengthen their current businesses

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru:
Джамшед, 1982 года рождения. Он  женат и имеет 1 ребенка.  Начал свою деятельность в продаже ювелирных изделий как помощник своему родственнику, который торговал этим видом товара. Затем они с братом решили открыть собственный бизнес – продажа ювелирных изделий. Местом его деятельности является оптовый рынок «Корвон», магазин «Мир Золото» города Душанбе. Джамшед в этой сфере работает 5 лет. В его ассортименте товара можно увидеть разнообразные золотые серьги и кольца, браслеты и цепочки и кулоны производства России, Турции и Индии. Он закупает товар у поставщиков из Дубая, России и Узбекистана. 
Джамшед услышав о программе Кива захотел участвовать. Он хочет получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони.
texts.en:
Born in 1982, Jamshed is married and has a child. He began his entrepreneurial activity by helping his relative sell jewelry. Then, his brother and he decided to open their own jewelry business. He sells jewelry at the Corvon wholesale market and Mir Zoloto store in Dushanbe. Jamshed has been in this business for 5 years now. Assortment of his goods includes a variety of gold earrings and rings, bracelets, necklaces and pendants made in Russia, Turkey and India. He buys his goods from suppliers in Dubai, Russia and Uzbekistan. Having learnt about the Kiva program, Jamshed wanted to participate and obtain a loan for a sum of $1200.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pendants

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Fatuma Namale's Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is the leader of a 4-member group. She is 29 years old and married with 3 children aged between 15 and 4. All of her children go to school. She also takes care of three orphans, children of her late sister. She owns and resides in a four-roomed house living with eight people There is electricity but the house has no piped water. The family gets two meals a day.

Fatuma resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Fatuma goes to Kampala for shopping three times a week. She rents her business premises at 40,000/= per month and works seven days. She deals in second-hand clothes and sells to all categories of people.

Fatuma sells to an average of 20 people per day. She buys her products from Owino Market, one of the busiest markets in Kampala City, and she uses public transport back to her business. Fatuma has been in this business for over eleven years and doesn't have any other business.

Her main challenges include limited capital and high transport costs to and from her place of work. She has been working with MCDT for over 11 years and is servicing her eighteenth loan, working all this long period with the same group-mates. She wants to use this loan to increase the inventory in her business. She aspires to build her own rental rooms. .

loans.use: To increase the inventory of her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Micro Credit Development Trust SACCO (MCDT) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Muhamad

texts.ru:
Хатамов Мухамад 1982 года рождения. Молодой предприниматель четыре года как занимается продажей мужской одеждой. Местом его деятельности является рынок «Шохмансур» города Душанбе. В его ассортименте большой выбор мужских летних и демисезонных футболок и накидок из хлопчатобумажных и маячных материалов производство Китая и Турции. 
Он закупает товар в оптовом рынке «Корвон» и у поставщиков из Китая. Хочет увеличить ассортимент, разновидность джинсов и спортивной одежды. Узнав о программе «Кива» хочет получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони для закупа джинсовых брюк.
texts.en:
Muhamad H. was born in 1982. The young entrepreneur has been in the business of men’s clothes sales for four years now. He has a retail outlet at the Shohmansur market in Dushanbe. His goods assortment includes a large variety of men’s summer and multi-season cotton T-shirts and hooded sweatshirts made in China and Turkey. Muhamad purchases his goods at the Corvon wholesale market and from suppliers in China and Turkey. He wants to widen his goods assortment by including jeans and sportswear. Having learnt about the Kiva program, Muhamad wants to obtain a $1200 loan to buy jeans.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase jeans

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Oysha

texts.ru:
Хусаинова Ойша родилась 1956 году. Она занимается торговлей подарочных товаров 8 лет. На данный момент она арендует магазин на рынке «Шохмансур» города Душанбе. В ее ассортименте большое количество подарочных наборов, подарочные ножи, картины, часы, музыкальные инструменты, настенные часы. А также хозяйственные товары, кастрюли, какзаны и т.д. Большую часть своей выручки Ойша пускает в оборот увеличивая ассортимент товаров. В ассортимент продаваемых ею товаров добавились женские халаты. Большую часть своих товаров она закупает у поставщиков из Китая и на оптовом рынке «Корвон». Ножи ей приносят постоянные поставщики из Истаравшана.
С целью расширения ассортимента и оборота своего бизнеса она хочет получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони.
texts.en:
Oysha H. was born in 1956. She has been selling gifts for eight years. Presently, she rents a shop in the Shokhmansur market in Dushanbe. In her inventory, she has a considerable assortment of gift sets, gift knifes, pictures, watches, musical instruments, and clocks. She also carries household goods, pans, cauldrons, etc. Most of the profit Oysha puts back into her business to increase her product assortment. She has recently added women’s dressing gowns to her product line. She buys most of her goods from Chinese suppliers and in the wholesale market Korvon. She buys her knives from her regular suppliers from Istaravshana. To further expand her inventory and to put money into her business, she wants to take out a loan for 4,100 somoni.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing souvenirs

loans.name: Asael

texts.es:
Mr. Asael R. works as both a deliveryman and bill collector for a private company. He and his wife, Mrs. Amanda Ramirez, have three children together. They are requesting this loan in order to purchase a computer because their children are at that point in their student lives where they need a computer in order to complete their work. They would like to offer their children a better future in society.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Asael trabaja en una empresa como repartidor y realizando la cobranza, el y su esposa la señora Amanda Ramirez quienes juntos tienen tres hijos, estan solicitando este prestamo para comprar una computadora ya que sus hijos la requieren porque estan en edad de escuela para realizar las tareas que se les pidan y brindarles un mejor futuro dentro de la sociedad.

loans.use: Purchase a computer

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Gaméli

texts.fr: Gaméli K. est un artisan cordonnier âgé de 35 ans, mariée et père de 2 enfants.  Pour gagner de l’argent, il fabrique et revend des chaussures en plus des réparations. Avec ce deuxième crédit et grâce à la chance de Kiva, il désire acheter des matières premières et s’équiper en outils de fabrication afin de relever les défis de la technologie et faire face au besoin de sa clientèle. Avec cette opportunité, monsieur Gaméli espère bien gagner sa vie et prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Gaméli K., 35, is a shoemaker. He is married and the father of two children. To earn money, he makes and sells shoes as well as doing repairs. With this, his second loan, and thanks to the chance offered by Kiva, he would like to purchase raw materials and outfit himself with tools for shoe-making, so as to make better use of technology and be responsive to the needs of his clientele. With this opportunity, Gaméli hopes to earn a good living and care for his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing raw materials and outfitting himself with tools for shoe-making

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FECECAV - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Mr. Roberto P. works as a customs broker, and his wife works for an agency. They have 3 children. They are requesting this loan in order to build a protective wall in the front and back of their home. They also need to install safety bars on their windows and doors for their family’s protection because there is a lot of vandalism in their neighborhood. They would like to offer their children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Roberto labora para una agencia aduanal, su esposa tambien trabaja para una agencia ellos tienen tres hijos, estan solicitando este prestamo para construir una barda al frente de su casa asi como otra en la parte de atras tambien necesitan colocar protecciones en ventanas y puertas para proteccion de su familia ya que en la colonia donde viven hay mucho bandalismo, ellos les quieren brindar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: Build a protective wall in the front and back of their house and install security bars

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Gueren

texts.fr: Gueren Kanté, 47 ans est marié avec 05 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Médina Diambéré depuis 2 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des tissus teintés (thioub) et des tissus très légers appelés khartoum.Gueren veut renforcer son commerce.<b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.<b/>
texts.en:
Gueren Kanté, 47, is married with 5 children to raise. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Médina Diambéré for 2 years. Her business consists in buying and re-selling artisanally dyed cloth ("thioub") and the very light cloth called "khartom." Gueren wants to bolster her business. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of six months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of cloth

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata C., 30 ans, mariée avec 02 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Médina Diambéré depuis 2 ans. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter des graines d’arachide, les transformer en pâte d’arachide et vendre. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales. <b>Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.<b/>
texts.en:
Fatoumata C., 30, married with two children to raise, has been a member of the Village Bank of Médina Diambéré for two years. She wants a loan to buy peanuts (groundnuts) to transform into peanut butter and re-sell. Her income allows her to participate in supporting her family. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of six months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing peanuts to produce peanut butter for re-sale

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia B. is a 35-year-old mother of two kids who are currently in school. She is very supportive of her husband in taking care of the kids in school. She has operated a sewing workshop for the past twenty years. She is training seven young ladies in sewing to pass on to them her skills and experience for their future careers.

Felicia sews all sorts of women's wear with various styles such as kaba and slit, wedding dress, funeral clothes etc. Besides sewing, Felicia also sells grocery products. She wants to use this loan to buy more sewing materials such as linen, thread, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency.

Felicia hopes to increase her savings to support her kids in school. She is a member of the community group called "Nyame na aye" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy more sewing materials such as linen, thread, thimbles, etc.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary K. Y., a 51 year old woman, is married and has four children. She runs a grocery shop in her neighborhood and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, and evaporated milk. She needs this loan to enable her to re-stock her shop with more goods so she can expand her sales.

Mary hopes that she will be able to raise enough income to pay for her children's education. She would be thankful for that support.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and sugar and cartons of evaporated milk and vegetable oil.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Halid

texts.en:
Halid I. is a twenty-five-year-old businessman. He is single and very focused. Halid has been a beef seller for eight years now. He buys his supplies from Techiman, a 50 km distant town, and retails the meat to his customers.

With his meager working capital, he is not able to buy larger quantities to make enough income. With this loan, he wants to buy beef in bulk so as to serve his customers with good quality beef for their meals. He believes the loan will allow him to have the resources to expand his business. He belongs to the community group called Butchers' Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to facilitate repayment of the loans.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of beef for re-sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris T. is a 28-year-old woman. She is single with a child who is currently in school. She is an agro-chemical seller selling various kinds of chemicals like weedicides, fertilizers, pesticides, and spraying machines to the local farmers. Goaso, where she lives, is a farming community and because of that many local farmers patronize her shop to buy products for the current farming season where most farmers are actively preparing their farmlands.

With the loan, Doris wants to purchase more supplies of weedicides, fertilizers, pesticides and spraying machines to serve the needs of her customers. She hopes to raise enough income to sponsor her kid's education. She would be very appreciative of your assistance

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of weedicides, fertilizers, pesticides, and spraying machines for re-sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed I. is a 30-year-old businessman. He is a husband and the father of two kids who are currently in school. He trades in goats. He buys the goats from the northern part of the country and supplies them to restaurant operators as meat for their meals. Goat meat is enjoyed by many Ghanaian homes because the flavor is good and it is quite affordable.

His business progress is slow because of inadequate funds to buy the goats from the farmers. With the loan, he wants to buy more goats to serve his customers with good quality meat for their meals. He believes the loan gives him more resources to meet the demands of his customers. He also hopes to save more to support his kids in school.

He belongs to the community group called Proverb Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more goats

loans.name: Emma

texts.es:
Doña Emma is 63 years old. She is a widow with 4 children who are grown and independent. She lives in the neighborhood of Villa Reconciliación. Her business is the sale of clothes and various other products. She began at an early age and has had a position in a market of Managua for 21 years where she offers a variety of products. At present she has a lot of competition, since this market grows each day and there are more merchants. Her family has motivated her to do well. She began selling clothes in her house, but then, with some savings that she had, she bought the position in the market and she has maintained this with loans requested from AFODENIC. Now she is investing in the improvement of her home. The loan that is requested is for infrastructure in the purchase of building materials to add a room in her dwelling, since one of her children is needing a home and she is going to help him.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Emma tiene 63 años de edad, es viuda con cuatro hijos mayores e independientes, habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación. Su negocio es la venta de ropa y otras variedades de productos, pues comenzó desde muy joven, tiene 21 años de tener un tramo en un mercado de Managua en donde ofrece variedad de productos, actualmente cuenta con mucha competencia ya que este mercado crece cada día y hay más números de comerciantes. Le ha tocado salir adelante por su familia, ella inició vendiendo en su casa ropa pero luego con unos ahorros que tenía pudo comprar el tramo y lo ha mantenido con créditos solicitados a AFODENIC. Ahora está invirtiendo en la mejora de su hogar, el préstamo que está solicitando es para infraestructura en la compra de materiales de construcción para hacer una habitación en su vivienda, ya que uno de sus hijos está necesitando de un hogar y ella lo va a ayudar.

loans.use: To buy building materials to add a room to her house.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Maria Salomé

texts.es:
Doña Maria lives in the neighborhood of Villa Reconciliación. She is single, 43 years old and has 4 children: two married and two younger who attend secondary school. She sells fried foods in the afternoons from her house everyday. She began 5 years ago with her first loan that she requested from AFODENIC and with time she has moved ahead and has been able to invest in her business. With the requested loan she will invest in the purchase of commodities for making her foods, since where Doña Maria lives is a busy street and she takes advantage of that location to sell more and to offer her rich dishes. The next step of Doña Maria will be to invest in the physical location of her business in order to be able to offer better service to the clients that visit it.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Maria habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, es soltera y tiene 43 años de edad y cuatros hijos, dos casados y dos jóvenes que están cursando la secundaria. Ella vende fritanga por las tardes en su casa todos los días, ella inició hace cinco años con un primer crédito que le brindo AFODENIC y a través del tiempo ha salido adelante y ha podido invertir en su negocio, con la solicitud que esta haciendo es para invertir en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sus comidas, ya que donde Doña Maria vive es una calle principal y aprovecha esa ubicación para vender más y ofrecer sus ricos platos de comidas. El siguiente paso de Doña Maria será invertir en el local de su negocio para así poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a los clientes que la visitan.

loans.use: To buy materials for making fried foods for sale.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Francis Raquel

texts.es:
Francis lives in the neighborhood of Riguero de Managua. With her own efforts and the support of her family, she was able to start a store in her house. She has already had her small business for five years. She has had difficulty with low sales, but has managed to do well. Her husband is a merchant and he is the head of the family. At 34 years of age, she only has a girl of 1 ½ years of age. The loan is needed to invest in the store. She will buy basic grains, delicacies, and cleaning products for the home, in order to have an assortment and thus to be able to satisfy the demands of her clientele. She works very hard daily to be able to obtain income that will help with the maintenance of the family, as well as the daily fight of having to keep the business always working, in spite of the difficulties that the Nicaraguans suffer these days.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Francis habita en el barrio Riguero de Managua, con esfuerzos propios y apoyo de su familia logró para poner una pulpería en su casa ya tiene cinco años de tener su pequeño negocio, ha tenido dificultad con las ventas bajas, pero ha logrado salir adelante. Su esposo es comerciante y está pendiente de la familia, a sus 34 años de edad, solo tiene una niña de 1 ½ de edad. El préstamo lo necesita para invertir en la pulpería, comprará granos básicos, golosinas, productos de limpieza para el hogar, con el fin de tener surtido y así poder satisfacer la demanda de su clientela. Diariamente trabaja muy duro para poder obtener ingresos que le ayuden a la manutención de la familia, así como la lucha diaria de tener el negocio siempre trabajando, a pesar de las dificultades que sufren en estos días los nicaragüenses.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, cleaning products and sweets for sale.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sonia is 29 years old, married and has 3 children, ages 8, 6 and 1 ½ years. Her husband was dedicated to the sale of garlic when he was still single. Upon marrying Sonia the business was administered by the couple, Sonia being also dedicated full time to the sale of garlic. Already they have 13 years of experience in this business, although Sonia has less time, but has acquired sufficient knowledge for the development of this process. These days there are more difficulties in selling this product since the prices are more expensive and the clients do not demand garlic so much as before. At present they have little inventory of this product. That is why they will buy boxes of garlic with the loan, in order to continue with the business and to reinforce sales. Sonia hopes that their business will always be stable, and will also work hard to bring in more clients.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Sonia tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 8, 6 y 1 ½ años. El esposo de Sonia se dedicaba a la venta de ajo cuando aún era soltero, al casarse con Sonia el negocio es administrado por la pareja, estando también Sonia dedicada de lleno a las ventas de ajos. Ya son 13 años de experiencia en este negocio, aunque Sonia tiene menos tiempo, pero ha adquirido el suficiente conocimiento para el desarrollo de este proceso, aunque ahora presenta más dificultades para la venta de este producto ya que los precios están más caros y los clientes no los demandan tanto como antes. Actualmente cuentan con poco inventario de este producto, es por eso que con el crédito comprará cajas de ajos, para así seguir con el negocio y reforzar las ventas, Sonia espera que su negocio siempre se mantenga estable, y también trabajará duro para captar más clientes.

loans.use: To buy boxes of garlic for resale.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Orlando José

texts.es:
Don Orlando, at his 40 years of age, has managed to have his own transportation business. He has his own taxi, which he obtained with a loan from an car agency of the cooperative that he inhabits in the Central America colony. He and his wife have two beautiful children of 6 and 3 years of age, which already go to school. His wife is a housewife. With the loan request that he is making, he will buy wheels for the taxi and thus prevent the taxi from deteriorating and also give good service to the client. Long-term he hopes to obtain another taxi in order to have a better income, since he would work one and rent the other. He also hopes to always have his health and the money to be able to give the necessary education to his children.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Orlando a sus 40 años de edad ha logrado tener su propio negocio que es de transporte, él tiene su propio taxi, lo cual obtuvo con crédito en una agencia de vehiculo por parte de la cooperativa, el habita en la colonia Centroamérica, su esposa le tiene dos hermosos hijos de 6 y 3 años de edad, los cuales ya van a clases, su esposa es ama de casa. Con la solicitud que esta haciendo es para comprar llantas al taxi y así permitir que éste no se deteriore, y también darle un buen servicio al cliente. A largo plazo es obtener otro taxi para así tener mejores ingresos, ya que uno lo trabajaría el y el otro lo alquilará. Poder tener siempre la salud y el dinero para poder dar los estudios necesarios a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy wheels to maintain his taxi.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Alicia, socia del Banco comunal  “Nuestra Señora de la Paz”, vive en el  Departamento y Provincia de San Martín, Distrito de Tarapoto, se dedica a la Venta de todo tipo de condimentos envasados en sobre y licuados, vende en su puesto que tiene en el Jr.  Tawantinsuyo C- 07,  Mercado Nº  02  de la ciudad.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual lo pagará en 6 meses, comprará  sillao, vinagre, cominos en kilos, orégano, ajinomoto, ajos en kilos para licuar y vender, diferentes tipos de ajíes para venderlos licuados y otros condimentos como palillo,  pimentón, etc., que ella compra en gran cantidad para luego venderlos al menudeo.

Tiene 45 años de edad, vive con su esposo y con uno de sus  hijos, el cual aún está a su cargo y en un futuro quiere verlo todo un profesional. Tiene como meta adquirir un local para tener más seguridad con sus productos y surtir más su negocio, porque sus productos tiene bastante salida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alicia, a member of the communal bank "Nuestra Señora de la Paz" (Our Lady of Peace), lives in the Department and Province of San Martín in the Tarapoto District. She makes a living selling all kinds of packaged and liquid condiments. She sells them from a stand she has in the Jr. Tawantinsuyo C-07, Market #2 in the city.

With this loan for $525, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy soy sauce, vinegar, cumin by the kilo, oregano, Ajinomoto brand MSG, garlic by the kilo to liquify and sell, various kinds of chilis to liquefy and sell, and other accessories, such as toothpicks, paprika, etc, that she purchases in bulk to later sell retail.

She is 45 years old, and lives with her husband and one of her children, who is still in her care and who she hopes to one day see become a professional. Her goal is to acquire a location where she'll have more security for her products and stock her store even more, because her products sell quite well.


Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as vinegar, cumin, garlic, etc.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Alicia socia del Banco Comunal “Las Moralinas”, vive en el Departamento y Provincia de San Martín, Distrito de Morales. Se dedica a la venta de zapatos, sobretodo trabaja con pedidos. Tanto su esposo como su hija  promocionan los productos con sus amistades y familiares, que en estos últimos tempos las ventas que se han mantenido como en las mejores épocas son los escolares y las fiestas de promoción. 

Se inició en el negocio con la venta de lencería y por razones de la variada competencia tuvo que cambiar de producto, ahora se dedica a la venta de zapatos. Ya tiene 2 años en esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Con el préstamo de S/. 2 500, el cual pagará en 06 meses, invertirá  en la compra de zapatos de diversas tallas, modelos y colores para entregar a sus clientes que ya les hicieron sus pedidos, además quiere comprar una máquina de coser porque también le gusta coser.

La señora Alicia tiene 31 años, es una mujer optimista, trabajadora y hábil para el negocio, su meta es ampliar su casa y tener una zapatería en su propio domicilio.
texts.en:
Ms. Alicia, a member of the communal bank "Las Moralinas," lives in the department and province of San Martín, in the Morales district. She sells shoes for a living, primarily on order. Her husband and her daughter promote her products among friends and family. Lately, she has been experiencing sales like she used to in better times, mostly from students for graduation parties.

She began in her business selling lingerie, but because of the stiff competition, she had to change products. She now sells shoes, as she has been for the last two years, and it's going very well. With this loan for $850, which she will repay in 6 months, she will invest in buying shoes of various sizes, styles, and colors to deliver to clients who have already placed their orders. She also wants to buy a sewing machine, as she likes to sew. Alicia is 31 years old, and an optimistic, hard-working woman, well-suited for her work. Her goal is to expand her house, and open a shoe store in her own home.


Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de zapatos de diversas tallas, modelos y colores y la compra de un máquina de coser

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La señora Ana María, socia del Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora de la Paz”, vive en el Departamento y Provincia de San Martín,  Distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de Mantequilla de maní, mermelada de frutas, chupetes, hielos y productos de belleza. El negocio está ubicado en su domicilio, Jr. Leoncio Prado Nº 1325. Sus clientes son vecinos de su barrio y familiares. Trabaja con pedidos.
 
Con el préstamo de S/. 800, el cual se pagará en 6 meses, comprará maní en saco, sal, frutas naturales de la estación, azúcar en saco, bolsas de chupetes entre otros. También comprará productos de belleza en oferta de la marca Esika, Unique, Avon, para surtir el negocio y de esa manera pueda tener mayor ganancia y volver a invertir nuevamente.

Ana María tiene 43 años, 03 hijos, quienes todavía dependen de ella. Siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer decidida, trabajadora y buena administradora. Su meta es ampliar el negocio, poner una vitrina para mostrar sus productos de belleza y tener una empresa agroindustrial.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana María is a member of the communal bank “Our Lady of Peace,” and lives in the Department and Province of San Martín, district of Tarapoto. She sells peanut butter, fruit jam, lollipops, ices and beauty products. The business is located in her home, Jr. Leonicio Prado No 1325. Her customers are neighbors and relatives. She works on a per-order basis. With a loan of 800 soles (US $275), which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy a sack of peanuts, salt, seasonal fruits, a sack of sugar, and bags of lollipops, among other things. She will also buy beauty products by the brands Esika, Unique and Avon to take to her business and she will be able to have higher profit and to re-invest again. Ana María is 43 years old and has three children who still depend on her. She has always stood out as a woman who is determined, hardworking and a good manager. Her goal is to expand her business, to install a showcase to display her beauty products and have an agribusiness company.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sack of peanuts, salt, seasonal fruits, sugar, bags of lollipops, etc.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La señora Ángela es socia del Banco Comunal “Jerusalén II”, vive en el Departamento y Provincia de San Martín, Distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la  confección y venta de bijouteria (joyas), también vende zapatos, ropas y los materiales que se necesita en este trabajo. Ella trabaja en base a pedidos, confecciona en su domicilio y luego sale a repartir a sus clientes y en busca de otros clientes y de esa manera asegurar sus ventas.    

Se inició en esta actividad hace 2 años ante la necesidad de generar sus ingresos para atender los requerimientos de sus hijos. Frente a la separación con su esposo, empezó a vender ropa y zapatos, ahora también vende bijuteria (joyas).

Con el préstamo de S/. 1 000, el cual pagará en 06 meses, comprará ropa para niños(as), adultos (varón y mujer) de diferentes marcas y modelos y también comprará materiales para su bijuteria y de esa manera sus clientes podrán tener mayor opción para escoger.

Angela tiene 59 años, es una mujer capaz de dirigir y administrar el negocio, su   meta es seguir creciendo en el negocio y apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios para que en el futuro verlos profesionales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Angela is a member of the communal bank “Jerusalem II.” She lives in the department and province of San Martin, District of Tarapoto. She is dedicated to the creation and sale of jewelry and she also sells shoes, clothes, and the materials needed for her work. She works on the basis of orders and makes items in her home and then distributes to her customers and looks for new clients, thus ensuring her sales. She began two years ago before needing to generate income to provide for the needs of her children. Faced with the separation from her husband, she began selling clothes and shows and now she also sells jewelry. With a loan of 1,000 soles (US $350), which will be paid off in 6 months, she will buy clothes for children, adults (male and female) of various brands and models and will also buy materials for jewelry so that her customers will have more options to choose from. Angela is 59 years old and is woman who is capable of directing and administering her business; her goal is to continue growing her business and to support her children in their studies so that they can become professionals in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing for children and adults of different brands and models

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
La Señora Anita, es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Moralinas”, vive en la Región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Morales, desde hace 10 años se dedica  al Diseño de Modas y costura, el taller está ubicado en la casa de sus  padres, en Jr. Francisco Pizarro Nº 165. Anita trabaja en base a pedidos y contratos de diferentes instituciones y personas particulares.

Las ventas han aumentado gracias a su responsabilidad, puntualidad y buen acabado de los productos, con ello espera mejorar su condición económica y disponibilidad de capital. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual pagará en 06 meses, comprará hilos de diferentes colores, telas de diversas variedades, colores y acabados, y una maquina de coser, para contar con lo necesario cuando tiene que realizar sus trabajos que es la confección de uniformes de las entidades de la ciudad, y todo tipo de prendas de vestir que le solicitan sus clientes, las cuales muchas veces solo le piden el modelo para que ella los confeccione y los venda.

Ana es soltera, tiene 31 años,  es una mujer positiva y emprendedora, su meta  es tener una boutique y vender ropa para novias.
texts.en:
Anita is a member of "Las Moralinas" Community Bank. She lives in San Martin region and province, in the Morales district. For 10 years she has been a fashion designer and seamstress and has a workshop in her parents' house at 165 Jr. Francisco Pizarro. Anita takes custom orders and has contracts with various private groups and individuals. Anita's sales have increased because she is accountable and on time, and because she provides a fine finish to her products. She hopes this will help her improve her quality of life and availability of capital. She plans to use the loan of 1,200 soles (about $425) -- which will be paid back in 6 months -- to purchase thread in various colors; fabrics of various types, colors and finishes; and a sewing machine. Having these materials on hand will allow her to finish her work making uniforms for city offices, as well as all sorts of garments requested by her female clients (who often order only the model so she can make and sell them). Anita is single and 31 years old. She is a positive and enterprising woman whose goal in life is to own a boutique and sell bridal wear.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of thread, fabric and sewing machine

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina tiene 33 años, está separada, vive con su hijo Carlos de 3 años.
Se dedica a la venta de gas de forma ambulatoria, en la ciudad de Juliaca, actividad que viene realizando desde hace tres años, en un local alquilado, para mantenerse y mantener a su pequeña hija de tan solo tres años, Dina sabe que su pequeño irá creciendo día a día y que cada vez necesitará mayores atenciones, es por eso que le gusta esta actividad, ya que le permite pasar tiempo con él, lo difícil está en la  inesperada subida del costro de este hidrocarburo, eso desestabiliza su negocio.     
Con el dinero que pide comprara más balones de gas para hacer más rentable su negocio, el cual espera que crezca y de mayores ingresos económicos a su familia.
texts.en:
Dina is 33 years old and is separated from her husband. She lives with her 3-year-old son Carlos. For the last three years, Dina has been a street vendor selling gas from a rented space in Juliaca city. She does this to take care of herself and her young 3-year-old son. Dina knows that Carlos will grow up quickly and soon will demand more of her attention. That's why she likes her current business -- because it allows her to spend time with him. However, the unexpected increase in the cost of gas has made it difficult for Dina and destabilized her business. Dina plans to use the requested loan to purchase additional gas tanks (cylinders) to make her business more profitable. She hopes her business will grow and earn greater income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the number of gas tanks (cylinders) for her business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 40 años, es divorciada, en la actualidad vive con su hija de 3 años llamada Yanet.
¿Qué hace?	Se dedica a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria, en su triciclo donde ofrece sus ricos potajes. Al separarse de su esposo y viendo como mantener a su hija optó por poner un negocio, con lo que mejor sabe hacer, cocinar, es así que tras mucho esfuerzo y con muchas ganas puso su negocio de venta de comida, el cual le da buenos frutos o al menos los necesarios para mantener a su pequeña hija.A Rosa le encanta cocinar, ella disfruta elaborar cada plato, al cual le pone mucho empeño y su buena sazón, esto hace que su pequeño negocio tenga muy buena acogida, la parte difícil es cuando no puede abastecerse para atender a toda la clientela.
Rosa trabaja por esa luz de esperanza que es su hijita Yaneth, a la cual quiere brindarle lo mejor.
Con el dinero del préstamo comprará más ingredientes para cocinar y poder abastecer a toda su clientela, en el futuro le gustaría alquilar un pequeño local y abrir un restaurante.
texts.en:
Rose is 40 years of age, divorced, and currently lives with her three year-old daughter named Yanet.

What does she do? She sells food on the streets from her cart, where she offers her delicious stews. Upon divorcing her husband and seeing how to support her child, she opted to start a business with what she knows how to do best, cooking. This is how, with much effort and great desire, she started her business selling food, a business that gives her good profits or at the least what is needed to support her little girl. Rosa loves to cook, she enjoys making each dish, she puts her efforts into it and uses good flavors which is what has made her little business so well-received. The hard part is when she is not able to stock up so that she can serve all of her customers.

Rosa works for the ray of hope that is her little girl, Yanet, the one who she wants to provide for in the best way.

With the money of the loan, she will buy more ingredients for cooking and will be able to stock up for all of her customers. In the future, she would like to rent a small space and open a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her food sales business with ingredients and supplies for the preparation of different dishes.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Roger tiene 26 años, es soltero, vive en la casa de sus padres. Es un joven trabajador que se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir (pantalones, poleras, etc.) en su pequeño taller, en la casa de sus padres, actividad que es su principal fuente de ingresos económicos.Roger aprendió de su madre, quien hace años tuvo un negocio parecido, aún se le hace difícil el dar los acabados a las prendas, pero sus dos años de experiencia han hecho que se adapte y sea hábil en el negocio, el cual realiza con mucha dedicación.Elaborar una prenda toma tiempo, así que debe trabajar durante todo el día para confeccionar las prendas necesarias para la venta.
Roger quiere forjarse un mejor futuro con mas estabilidad económica.
Con el dinero que se le facilite podrá comprar más material, telas de todo tipo para aumentar su producción y que en el futuro su taller crezca, teniendo empleados y llegar a tener una gran fábrica de ropa.
texts.en:
Roger is 26 years old, is single, and lives in his parents' house. He is a young worker who makes articles of clothing (pants, t-shirts, etc.) in his little shop in his parents' house. This is his principle source of income. Roger learned from his mother who has had a similar business for years. Even though it is difficult to finish the garments, his two years of experience have made it so that he adapts and is skillful in business, something he has achieved with great dedication. Making a garment takes time that is why he needs to work all day to make the garments needed for sale.

Roger would like to forge a better future with more economic stability.

With the money he will be able to buy more material, fabrics of all kinds, to increase his production so that, in the future, his store grows, having employees and eventually having a great clothing factory.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the raw materials for his clothing-making shop

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Chirly

texts.es:
Chirly tiene 19 años, es soltera y vive en casa de su madre.
Es una muchacha muy joven, que se dedica a tejer prendas de vestir en la máquina que heredó de su madre, realiza esta actividad aproximadamente desde hace 3 años, ya que a ella siempre le ha gustado tejer.Con lana y creatividad Chirly elabora diversas prendas; como medias, guantes, chompas, etc., lo único difícil, es el tiempo que no le alcanza para producir las cantidades que la clientela le demanda, pero le va bien en el negocio y espera seguir trabajando para concretar todos sus sueños.
Chirly espera convertir su pequeño taller en una gran empresa, para asegurar su futuro económico.
Con el dinero facilitado comprará material para la elaboración de sus prendas, las cuales espera ver distribuidas en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Chirly is 19 years old, single, and lives in her mother’s home. She is a young woman dedicated to knitting clothing by machine, which she inherited from her mother. She has been doing this activity for approximately 3 years, as she has always liked to knit. With wool and creativity Chirly makes a variety of clothing like socks, gloves, sweaters, etc.. The only challenge is that she doesn’t have enough time to produce the quantities her customers demand, but her business is going well and she hopes to continue working in order to make all her dreams reality. Chirly hopes to convert her small workshop into a large business to ensure her economic future. With the money from the loan she will buy material to make her items, which will be distributed to different city markets.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to make knitted clothing

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith tiene 27 años, es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres con su familia.
Es una joven con estudios superiores en el área de salud, atiende en su pequeña botica, la cual puso con mucho esfuerzo, con la ayuda de su familia, gracias a Dios, nos dice, hoy en día el negocio es rentable, ya que es muy concurrido por las personas del lugar.Judith se dedica a atender su botica a lo largo de todo el día, lo cual le resulta agotador, pero el poder a ayudar a la gente a mitigar sus dolores, es una gran fuente de aliento para ella, su botica tiene tan solo 6 meses, tiempo en el cual ha generado un gran amor por su trabajo.
Judith quiere asegurar su futuro con su pequeño negocio, para tener un mejor porvenir.
Con el dinero del préstamo podrá implementar su botica, para que a la larga se convierta en una gran farmacia de renombre y prestigio.
texts.en:
Judith is 27 years old, single, and lives in her parent’s home with her family. She is a young woman who has completed post-secondary studies in the field of health, and she has a small pharmacy which she started with much effort with the help of her family, thanks be to God, she tells us, today the business is profitable, and it is a very popular business. Judith works in her pharmacy all day, which is exhausting, but being able to help people alleviate their illnesses and pains is a great source of strength for her. Her pharmacy has been open only 6 months, in which time she has developed a great love for her work. Judith wants to ensure her future with her small business in order to have a better future. With the money from the loan she will be able to expand her pharmacy so that in the long run it will become a well known and prestigious pharmacy.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her small pharmacy so that in the future it becomes a famous pharmacy.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 19 años, es soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres. Su juventud no es impedimento para que quiera ser exitosa, Juana atiende en unas cabinas de Internet, que con ayuda de sus padres, puso alquilando un local en una calle muy transitada de la ciudad de Juliaca.Atiende su negocio desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 u 11 de la noche, según se quede la clientela.Lo que más le gusta a Juana es poder utilizar el servicio de Internet investigando y navegando en la red, lo difícil es tener que permanecer durante todo el día y a veces hasta altas horas de la noche atendiendo su negocio.
Al terminar la secundaría y no poder continuar estudiando, quiere asegurar su futuro con el negocio.
Con el dinero que le podamos facilitar podrá emplearlo en comprar más accesorios para sus cabinas, como audífonos, cámaras web, entre otros, para mejorar la atención y en el futuro comprar más computadoras, le gustaría tener una sucursal en otra calle de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Juana is 19 years old and lives in her parents' house. Her youth is no obstacle for her desire to succeed. Juana tends to some internet booths which she set up in a commercial space on a high traffic street in the city of Juliaca with the help of her parents. She tends to the business from 8 in the morning until 10 or 11 at night, depending on her customers. What she likes the best is being able to use the internet service, researching and browsing the web; the hard part is being there all day and sometimes even until late at night, tending to her business.

Having finished highschool, and without the ability to keep studying, she wants to secure her future with the business.

She will use he money we can offer her to buy more accessories for her booths, such as earphones, web cameras, among other things, in order to improve the service and in the future buy more computers. She would like to have another location on a different street in the city.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying different computer accessories for her public internet booths. (Compra de diferentes accesorios de computadora para sus cabinas públicas de Internet.)

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 33 años, es soltera y vive en la casa de su familia. Desde hace 10 años se viene dedicando a la venta de carne de forma ambulante en el mercado, vende sobre todo, cabezas de res, la cuales se emplean para hacer ricas sopas y platos típicos de la región.Vende durante toda la mañana y recoge su mercadería a las 5 o 6 de la tarde, horas en donde ya no hay mucha venta.A Rosa ya se le hizo costumbre su trabajo, así que no le encuentra dificultad, es más, le gusta lo que hace y lo realiza con mucha alegría y buen humor. 
Está interesada en su futuro, es así, que desea trabajar mucho para forjarse mayores oportunidades.
Ahora, espera comprar más carne y así mejorar su negocio, con el tiempo le gustaría tener su propio emporio, con mayor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Rosa is 33 years old, she is single and lives in her family's home. For 10 years now she has worked selling meat as a street vendor in the market. She mostly sells beef heads, which are used to make delicious soups and dishes typical of the region. She sells all morning and picks up her merchandise between 5 and 6 in the afternoon, a time where her sales go down. Rosa is accustomed to her work, so she does not find it hard. On the contrary, she enjoys what she does and she does it with joy and good humor.

She is interested in her future, and so it is that she wishes to work hard to create greater opportunities for herself. Now she hopes to buy more meat in order to improve her business. With time she would like to have her own commercial center, with greater financial stability.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing investment capital to improve and grow her business of selling meat. (Incremento del capital de inversión para la mejora y crecimiento de su negocio de venta de carne.)

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 29 años, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Es una joven que trabaja muy duro por sus ideales, se dedica desde hace 5 años a vender combustible en el mercado Cerro Colorado de la ciudad de Juliaca, donde la venta es muy buena.Le gusta su negocio, ya que le permite sentirse independiente, sin preocupación de tener una pareja, solo para que la mantenga, por otro, lado el olor a combustible a veces suele marearla, pero con los años, se ha acostumbrado a esos pequeños y molestos detalles. 
Francisca quiere utilizar la suma solicitada para la comprar más galones de gasolina y así incrementar sus ventas, en el futuro quiere tener otro negocio, tal como una tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Francisca, 29, is single and lives with her parents. She's a young woman who works very hard for her dreams. For 5 years, she's operated a business selling fuels in the Cerro Colorado market in the city of Juliaca and her sales have been very good. She likes her business because it allows her to feel independent, without having to worry about having a partner, just making her own living. On the other hand, the smell of the fuels sometimes makes her sick but, over the years, she's grown used to these small and troublesome details.

Francisca wants to use the loan to buy more gallons of gasoline so that she can increase her sales. In the future, she wants to have another business, perhaps a store selling fuels.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy gasoline for fuels business.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja tiene 32 años, es soltera, vive con su hija Susan de 12 años.
Es una mujer independiente, que pese a los maltratos de la vida, ha sabido superar con fortaleza cada golpe, ella tiene una carpintería en su casa, en la cual trabaja fabricando muebles.Este pequeño negocio viene funcionando desde hace 20 años y Maruja le pone mucho empeño en que siga produciendo y creciendo cada vez más, usualmente trabaja por las mañanas y parte de las tardes, lo cual se le hace difícil, ya que también tiene que velar por su hija Susan que está estudiando. Lo que le gusta de su negocio es que es muy concurrido y la venta es muy buena.
Maruja quiere ver a su hija profesional y que no dependa de nadie para salir adelante.
Con el dinero que obtendrá comprará material (madera y otros) para producir más muebles y en el futuro tener un gran taller de fabricación de muebles con sucursales en toda la región.
texts.en:
Maruja, 32, is single. She lives with her 12-year old daughter, Susan. She is an independent woman who, despite many hardships, has overcome every blow with great fortitude. She has a carpentry shop in her house where she works making furniture. Maruja has operated the business for 20 years and she makes great efforts to maintain the business and grow it bit by bit. She usually works mornings and parts of afternoons, something that's difficult for her because she also has to care for her daughter, Susan, who is still in school.

What Maruja most wants for her business is many customers and big revenues. She wants to see her daughter settled in a professional career so that she doesn't have to depend on anyone else to get ahead. With the money that she will borrow, she will buy materials (wood and other materials) to make more furniture. In the future, she'd like to have a large furniture workshop with outlets around the area.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for furniture making business.

loans.name: Arleni

texts.es:
La señora Arleni R., socia del banco comunal “Mujeres Decididas”,  vive en el departamento y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de artículos de mercería como ungüentos, frotaciones de diferentes marcas, desodorantes, hilos de coser, tijeras, etc., ella vende en el puesto que tiene en el mercado Nº 02 de la ciudad de Tarapoto, sus clientes son las personas que acuden al mercado, porque es uno de los mercados más concurridos de la ciudad.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1 000.00 , el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará artículos para surtir mas su puesto de venta como desodorantes en cajas, hilos, esmaltes de diferentes colores, cajas de fósforos, crema dental de diferentes tamaños y marcas, etc., y otros productos que tienen mayor rotación. Quiere  tener bien surtido su negocio, porque quiere que sus clientes encuentren lo que buscan.    

La señora Arleni tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo, quienes la apoyan en las actividades de la casa, porque ella tiene que dejar su casa para ir a vender. Esta contenta con lo que hace, su meta  es crecer con su negocio, surtirlo más y mejorarlo para asegurar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Señora Arleni R., a member of the community bank "Dedicated Women," lives in the department and province of San Martín in the district of Tarapoto. She focuses of the sale of merchandise such as unguents, different kinds of medicinal rubs, deodorants, sewing thread, scissors, etc. She sells out of a stall she has in the second largest market in the city of Tarapoto. Her chosen clientele are the market goers, because it is one of the busiest markets in the city.

With a loan of $350, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy articles to better outfit her stall such as deodorant, sewing thread, different nail polishes, boxes of matches, toothpastes of different sizes and brands, etc. as well as other products that have a higher turnover. She wants her business well supplied, because she wants her clientele to be able to find what they are looking for.

Señora Arleni is 41 years old and lives with her husband and son, who help her with the household upkeep she has to set aside in order to run her business. She is happy with what she does. Her aim is to grow with her business, to better supply it, and to improve it in order to to better secure her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of deodorants, sewing threads, nail polishes, etc.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel tiene 31 años de edad, habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, es casado y tiene dos hermosos hijos de 6 y 9 años de edad, su esposa trabaja en en ventas en un mercado de Managua. Manuel tiene un carretón de caballo que lo utiliza en servicios de acarreo, pasa todo el día en un mercado esperando por clientes que soliciten el servicio de acarreo tiene diez años de experiencia, inició vendiendo leña en el carretón y con ahorro compró su caballo. La solicitud que esta haciendo es para construcción de la sala de su casa ya que es pequeña y quiere aumentar para tener más espacio y poder estar más cómodo, para lo cual debe comprar arena, cemento, piedra, entre otros. A largo plazo es poder ofrecer siempre el servicio a sus clientes con mejoras a su carretón ya que en el mercado son de mucha utilidad para los que llegan a comprar, así como seguir haciendo mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Manuel is 31 years old and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. He is married and has two beautiful sons who are 6 and 9 years old. His wife works in sales at a market in Managua. Manuel has a horse cart which he uses to provide transportation services. He spends all day at the market waiting for customers. He has ten years of experience, and started out selling fire wood using his cart. He was then able to buy his horse with his savings. The request he is making is to build a room on his small house, as he would like to expand to have more space and to be able to live more comfortably. He needs to buy sand, cement and stone, among other items, for this renovation. Long term, he wants to make improvements to his cart to continue providing his services at the market as they are very useful to those who come to the market to make purchases. He would also like to continue making improvements to his house.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish construction on his house.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma tiene 29 años, es madre soltera de dos niños, María de 7 años y Robiño de 4. Se dedica al negocio de la venta de popcorn (Palomitas de Maíz) de forma ambulatoria por las calles de la ciudad de Juliaca, negocio que es la fuente principal de los ingresos de su familia, ya que tiene que mantener sola a sus dos hijos.Siempre ha sido una mujer muy alegre y perseverante, a pesar de las pequeñas dificultades que se le presentan, siempre ha sabido superarlas, haciendo que su trabajo sea fácil de hacer. Un día común en el trabajo de Norma empieza a las 12 del día para terminar a las 8 de la noche, que es donde hay más venta, por el frío que hace en la ciudad de Juliaca.
Esta madre, sola, quiere sacar a sus hijos adelante y demostrarles que pueden tener un gran futuro a pesar de las penurias económicas que a ella le tocó vivir.
Con el dinero Norma quiere comprar algunos accesorios que le faltan a su triciclo, para mejorar la preparación del popcorn, haciendo que sea más consumido. En un corto tiempo, le gustaría comprar otro triciclo para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Norma is 29 years old. She is a single mother of two children: 7 year old María and 4 year old Robiño. She focuses herself on the business of selling popcorn (Palomitas de Maíz) on foot through the streets of the city of Juliaca. The business is the principle source of income for her family, since she only has to look after her two sons. She has always been a happy and persevering woman. Despite the small troubles she is faced with, she has managed to overcome so that her work should be easier to do. Norma's typical day starts at noon and ends at eight in the evening, which is when there are greater sales because of the cold in Juliaca. This single mother wants to move her children forward and demonstrate to them that they can have a good future despite the kind of economic hardships she has lived through. With this loan Norma wants to purchase several accessories she is missing for her tricycle so she can improve her production of popcorn so that it will be in greater demand. In a short while, she would like to buy another tricycle to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refurbishment and remodel of a tricycle used for selling popcorn on the go

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Martha Del Socorro

texts.es: Martha tiene 49 años de edad, habita en el barrio Hialeah, es casada y tiene dos hijos una niño de 6 años y otro de 13 años de edad, su esposo trabaja en la construcción como albañil. Martha vende comida los días sábados y domingos ella inició con fondos de un crédito para poder ayudar a su familia con los gastos del hogar ya que la vida está más cara, lleva cinco años de vender fritanga la dificultad que ha tenido para crecer es la falta de financiamiento. Ahora está pensando en la mejora de su vivienda, el crédito será usado para la compra de puertas para instalársela a las habitaciones y así tener más comodidad y privacidad ella y sus hijos
texts.en:
Martha is 49 years old and lives in the Hialeah neighborhood. She is married and has two children; one is six years old and the other one is thirteen years of age. Her husband works in construction. Martha sells food on Saturdays and Sundays. She started with funds from a loan, in order to be able to help with the family’s expenses given that the cost of living is higher. She has been selling fried foods for five years, but has had difficulty growing the business due to a lack of funds. She is now thinking about making improvements to her house. Her loan will be used to purchase doors to be installed in the bedrooms, and in this way she will be able to provide more comfort and privacy for herself and her children.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase doors for the bedrooms of her house.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina es soltera, tiene 35 años, vive con sus hijos de 12 y 6 años. Ella es natural del distrito de Moho, es una mujer muy trabajadora, madre soltera desde hace 20 años se dedica Palomitas de maíz de forma ambulante en su triciclo, esta actividad la realiza para poder mantenerse económicamente.A Martina le gusta su negocio, ya que comprando una bolsita de maíz puede multiplicar su inversión, trabajando desde la una de la tarde, hasta entrada la noche, lo difícil de su trabajo es tener que dejar el maiz en su punto; ni muy tostado, ni muy pequeño, para que sea de gusto de los compradores, los años le han enseñado que con mucha paciencia y alegría las cosas salen mejor, es así que hoy en día quiere y respeta su trabajo. 
Martina se esfuerza por brindarles a sus niños una buena educación y por ende un gran futuro.
Con el dinero facilitado comprará una cocinita a gas para preparar mucho más rápido el popcorn, y con el tiempo tener un negocio adicional.
texts.en:
Martina is single, 35 years of age and lives with her 12 and 6 year old children. She hails from Moho District and is a hard working single mom. Over the past 20 years she has been selling popcorn from her mobile popcorn stand. She has been doing this work to be able to sustain her family.

Martina enjoys her business as she can multiply her investment in a bag of corn working hard from 1 PM until late. The hardest part of her business is popping the kernels just right (not too toasted, nor too small) to ensure her clients get a quality product. Over the years she has learned that with a lot of patience and a lot of enthusiasm things work out a lot better in the long run. She enjoys and respects her work.

Martina is making an effort to provide her children with a good education to help them on the road to a great future.

With the microloan she will purchase a small gas cooker to speed up the popcorn preparation and in time hopes to have another business.


Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Add a small gas cooker to her mobile popcorn stand.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 35 años, es soltero, vive solo en un cuarto que alquiló en la casa de su prima.
Es un hombre de gran fuerza y valor, terminando sus estudios de secundaria y al no poder seguir estudiando se dedicó a trabajar, es así que hace dos años su negocio es la compra y venta de ganado que oferta en el mercado dominical, hasta donde transporta a sus animales.El campo siempre le ha gustado, estar cerca de la naturaleza, es muy gratificante para él, la dificultad radica en el transporte del ganado, pero Juan no se amilana y trabaja muy duro para cumplir sus sueños.
Quiere estabilidad económica, para prosperar y en un futuro conformar una familia.
Con este préstamo espera comprar más cabezas de ganado para comercializarlas y generarse más ingresos, para así poner un negocio adicional, que aún está analizando el rubro para éste.
texts.en:
Juan is 35 years old, single, and lives in a rented room in his cousin’s house.

He is a strong and brave man who finished secondary school but who, at not being able to continue with his education, dedicated himself to working. This is how, for two years now, his business has been the purchase and sale of livestock which he offers at the Sunday market which is where he takes his animals. He has always liked the countryside, and being close to nature is very gratifying for him. The difficulty arises in transporting his livestock, but Juan isn’t discouraged by this and works very hard to fulfill his dreams.

He wants financial stability so he can prosper and, sometime in the future, start a family.

With this loan he hopes to acquire more heads of cattle to help generate additional income, as he would like to start another business which he is still analyzing and deciding on.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the number of cattle that he owns.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 30 años, está separada de su pareja, vive con su tres hijos Yudith, Luzdelia de 3 y Johan de 1. Tiene un taller en su casa para la fabricación de pequeños estantes, los cuales elabora en base a fierros forrados con plástico.Juana trabaja todos los días en la fabricación de estos muebles, los cuales son bien cotizados por el público juliaqueño, al día produce de 2 a 4 muebles para comercializar, con ayuda de su primo, quien la ayuda en el trabajo. Por otro lado, también tiene deberes con sus hijos pequeños, a los cuales debe atender cumpliendo el doble rol de madre y comerciante, el cual la deja exhausta, pero saca fuerzas de flaqueza para seguir trabajando y alcanzar sus metas.
Juana trabaja para que sus hijos sean felices, para darles las comodidades que ella no tuvo y que logren ser profesionales.
Con el dinero solicitado comprará materia prima para elaborar sus estantes y vender mucho más, para que en el futuro su pequeño negocio de mejores frutos y tener un taller más grande, con muchos más trabajadores.
texts.en:
Juana is 30 years old and separated from her partner, and lives with her three children, Yudith, Luzdela, 3, and Johan, 1. She has a workshop in her house where she makes small shelves from iron covered with plastic. Juana works every day making this furniture, which is highly valued by the Juliacan public. Every day she makes between 2 and 4 pieces to sell with the help of her cousin, who helps her with this work. On the other hand, she also has a duty to her young children, whom she needs to attend to while playing the dual role of mother and businesswoman. This leaves her exhausted, but she finds strength out of weakness to keep working and reach her goals. Juana works so her children can be happy, in order to give them the comforts that she never had, and so they can be professionals. With the requested loan she will buy raw materials to make her shelves and sell many more, so that in the future her small business will bear better fruit and she can have a larger workshop, with many more workers.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials to make shelves that she will sell

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
La Señora Candelaria es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valerosas II”, vive en la región y  provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, ya tiene buen tiempo en este negocio y le va bien. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Tulumayo  S/N, en la Asociación de Vivienda San Genaro, lugar donde acuden diariamente sus clientes, los cuales son mayormente los vecinos de su  barrio.

Con el préstamo de S/. 2,500, el cual pagará en 6  meses, comprará  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, leche, aceite, conservas en cajas de diferentes tamaños, papel higiénico en paquetes, detergentes, jabones de diferentes marcas y tamaños, frutas y verduras, entre otros,  para surtir bien el negocio y sus clientes logren encontrar lo que buscan. 

La señora Candelaria tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y sus 03 últimos hijos, quienes la apoyan en la atención de los clientes en sus momentos libres. Es una mujer trabajadora, carismática y con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando con el negocio porque le gusta lo que hace, su meta es continuar con el negocio, seguir creciendo y tenerlo bien surtido para la satisfacción de ella y de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Candelaria is a member of the “Courageous Women II” communal bank and lives in the San Martín region and province, in the district of Tarapoto. She has worked selling groceries for some time, and the business is going well. The business is located in her own home on Tulumayo S/N Street, in the San Genaro Housing Association, a place where her customers come daily. The majority of the customers are people from her neighborhood. With this loan of 2,500 soles ($850), which she will repay over 6 months, she will buy essential products such as rice, sacks of sugar, milk, oil, preserves in boxes of different sizes, packages of toilet paper, detergents, soaps in different brands and sizes, and fruits and vegetables, among other things, in order to supply the business well so her customers can find what they are looking for. Mrs. Candelaria is 35 years old and lives with her husband and 3 youngest children, who help her to attend to the customers in their spare time. She is a very hard-working woman and charismatic, and has a great desire to keep working in the business because she likes the work. Her goal is to continue with the business, keep growing, and to have the business well-stocked for her own satisfaction and that of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy essential products such as rice, sacks of sugar, milk, oil, etc.

loans.name: Manuela Dolores

texts.es: Doña Manuela tiene 50 años de edad, habita en el barrio 3-80, es casada, tiene dos hijos de  12 y 18 años de edad, que están estudiando. Ella labora en la Cruz Roja Nicaragüense desempeñándose como enfermera, desde joven entró a laborar en dicha institución, son dieciocho años de experiencia, sale desde muy de mañana para cumplir con sus labores, su esposo trabaja como conductor y apoya a su familia. El uso del préstamo será para poner cerámica en el piso de su vivienda, ya que su mayor sueño es poder dejarles un buen patrimonio a sus pequeños, a parte de los estudios, para que éstos puedan tener un futuro más seguro.
texts.en:
Manuela is a 50 year old married woman who lives with her husband and two children in the 3-80 neighborhood. Her children, 12 and 18 years old, both attend school. Manuela works as a nurse for the Nicaraguan Red Cross and her husband is a truck/bus/taxi driver. Manuela began working with the Red Cross when she was young and has now been with them for 18 years. She continues to leave very early every morning to continue her labors and contribute, along with her husband, to the household income. The requested loan will be used to install ceramic tile throughout Manuela’s home. This is being completed in order to progress towards her dreams of providing well for her children. She wants to provide them not only with an education, but also a substantial asset, so that their futures will be secure.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of ceramic tile in the home.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Ambrosia

texts.es:
Ambrosia tiene 50 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos jóvenes, quienes cursan estudios superiores. Se dedica a la ganadería desde muy niña, ya que sus padres fueron ganaderos, también compra y vende animales en los mercados cercanos a su localidad, lo cual lo viene realizando  desde que se casó.Esta actividad la realiza desde muy de mañana, sale a pastear a sus animalitos en lugares lejanos donde puedan alimentarse, siendo esta la actividad que más le agrada, ya que puede salir con sus caneritos y estar con estos toda la mañana y regresa a su hogar a preparar los alimentos. Lo difícil es matar a sus carneritos,  ya que les toma cariño a cada uno, pero tiene que hacerlo, para vender su carne, la que lleva a los mercados en un carro que logró adquirir.  
Ambrosia tiene en sus tres hijos, su mayor motor y esperanza para mejorar, ya que están cursando estudios superiores en distintos institutos de las ciudades cercanas.
Ahora, está pensando incrementar sus ingresos mensuales, lo lograra invirtiendo en la compra de ganado que pueda pastear y criar, para que así, dentro de un tiempo, pueda venderlos y comercializarlos en las diversas ciudades de cercanas a su localidad.
texts.en:
Ambrosia is 50 years old and lives with her husband and three young children who are in college. She has worked with livestock since she was very young, as her parents were livestock farmers. She also buys and sells animals in the markets close to her home, which she has been doing ever since she got married. She does this starting very early in the morning, when she leaves to take her animals to pasture in places far away so they can eat. This is the activity that she likes the most because she can get out with her sheep and be with them all morning, and then return to her home to prepare food. The difficult part is killing her sheep, because she is affectionate with all of them, but she has to do it so she can sell the meat, which she takes to the markets in a car that she managed to buy.
