Madame Salamata Traoré est âgée de 28 ans et vit dans une famille polygame avec son mari, ses deux coépouses et leurs enfants au quartier Torakabougou de la préfecture de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Enseignante de formation, elle mène l’activité de fabrication de savons  traditonnels dès son jeune âge. Elle a appris cette activité auprès de sa grande mère. Avec une expérience de 8  ans, elle jouit d’une grande notoriété et d’une expertise sans égale dans la localité ce qui lui a valu la mise en place d’une association pour la promotion et la defense  des intérêts des fabricants de savon local.
Dans le souci d’agrandir la taille de ses activités Madame Salamata Traoré ( présidente et membre fondatrice de l’assciation des frabriçantes de savon local de la ville de Bougouni) a décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son premier prêt. Avec ce prêt, elle compte  acheter  15 sachets de soude caustique, 7 kilogrammes de beurre de karité,  20 litres d’huile d’arachide  et 15 sachets de savon en poudre.
Elle s’approvisionne en matières premières sur place à Bougouni. Elle fait sa fabrication dans son atelier à  domicile. Les produits sont melangés et mis dans des moules pour donner des savons de différentes couleurs. Ensuite elle les revend au comptant ou à crédit. Ses clients sont géréralement les boutiquiers, les revendeuses et des commerçantes ambulantes. Son cycle (achat de matières premières, fabrication et  vente) dure un mois. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice de 50 000FCFA par mois qu’elle utilisera pour  payer les intérêts du prêt et contribuer aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Salamata Traoré is 28 years old and lives in a polygamous family with her husband, his two other wives and their children in the area of Torakabougou in the prefecture of Bougouni (the third administrative region of the republic of Mali). A teacher by trade, from a young age she has been in the business of producing traditional soaps. She learned this business from her grandmother. With 8 years of experience, she enjoys the benefits of a good reputation and unequalled expertise in her area. This brought her to establish an association to promote and defend the interests of local soap makers. With the intent of growing her business, Mrs. Salamata Traoré (president and founding member of the association of local soap makers of the city of Bougouni) decided to integrate the loan program from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, from whom she has requested her first loan. With this loan she plans to purchase 15 bags of caustic soda, 7 kilograms of shea butter, 20 liters of peanut oil and 15 bags of powdered soap. She stocks her basic supplies on site at Bougouni and the soap production takes place in her home workshop. The products are mixed and poured into molds to create different colored soaps. She then sells them for cash or on credit. Her clients are generally shopkeepers, retailers and travelling salespeople. This process (the purchase of supplies, production and sales) takes one month. She foresees earning a profit of 50,000 FCFA per month which she will use to pay the interest on the loan and to contribute to her family expenses.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of ingredients to produce local soap

loans.name: Benkadi (Good Understanding) Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq (5) membres du groupe Benkadi de l’association Djiguissèmè sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et deux (2) enfants. Elles vivent en général dans des ménages monogamiques au quartier Bozo de la sous préfecture de Markala (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali). Unis par des liens ethnique et professionnel ce groupe de femmes Bozo existe depuis plus de 10 ans .Il exerce le commerce de poissons frais, fumés et séchés.
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de groupe avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela après avoir correctement remboursé les deux premiers prêts.
Ce nouveau prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 563 kg de poissons frais, 21 barres de glace alimentaire et 6 cartons de poissons fumés. Elles s’approvisionnent en poissons fumés dans les villages de Mignon et Diado (préfecture de Macina) et en poissons frais à Niono (village de Dora) et sur place à Markala au bord du fleuve Niger auprès des pêcheurs. Pour la glace elle est achetée à Seribala et à Dougabougou. La glace sert à mieux conserver le poisson frais. Les poissons sont vendus à Bamako et sur place à Markala au comptant et rarement à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 81.125 FCFA.qui sera utiliser essentiellement pour agrandir la taille de leur activité. Elles ont pour ambition de posséder chacune un congélateur afin de mieux conserver les poissons frais et augmenter ainsi leur marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en:
The five members of the group Benkadi of the association Djiguissèmè are all married with an average age of 41 and on average, two children. They mostly live in monogamous households in the Bozo neigborhood in the Sous-Prefecture Markala (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali.)

United by bonds of ethnicity and profession, this group of Bozo women has been in existence for 10 years. They sell fish--fresh, smoked, and dried.

They are on their third group loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, having correctly reimbursed their first two loans.

This new loan will be used to buy 563 kg of fresh fish, 21 blocks of food-grade ice, and 6 cases of smoked fish. They buy their smoked fish in the villages of Mignon and Diado (Macina Prefecture) and their fresh fish in Niono (Dora village) and right in Markala on the banks of the Niger River from the fishermen. As for the ice, they buy it in Seribala and in Dougabougou. The ice is used to preserve the fresh fish. The fish is sold in Bamako and in Markala itself, for cash and rarely on credit to a clientele composed of women and of men who come from the big cities and who re-sell what they buy.

They each hope to make a monthly average profit of 81.125 FCFA which will be used essentially to expand their businesses. Their ambition is to possess, each of them, a freezer so as to better preserve the fresh fish and thus raise their profit margin.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fresh fish, smoked fish, and food-grade ice

loans.name: Ortizer

texts.es:
Ortizer tiene 50 años, comparte su vida y su trabajo con su esposa. Se dedica, en su mayoría, a la producción de fréjoles, actividad que le toma todo el día, para ello tiene que salir muy de mañana de su hogar y trasladarse a sus chacras que están alejadas de su hogar, hay días que no regresa a su casa, aspecto que es muy común entre los agricultores, es algo a lo cual Ortizer está acostumbrado, ya que se dedica a ello por más de  30 años.Sin embargo, cuando  su producción hecha frutos es algo gratificante, el resultado de su trabajo y dedicación, de sobrellevar dificultades, limpiar y mantener sus terrenos productivos.
Ortizer tiene gran amor a su pareja, quien es el ser más importante para él  y quien lo motiva día  a día. Con el dinero que solicita tiene pensado incrementar su producción, sembrar gran cantidad y variedad de productos típicos de la zona, para ir asegurando su vejez y la de su pareja.
texts.en:
Ortizer is 50 years old. He shares his life and his work with his wife. He primarily works on the production of beans, an activity that takes up his entire day. For this, he has to leave his house very early in the morning and travel to the farm, which is located very far from his home. There are days when he does not return home, something that is very common among agricultural workers. It is something that Ortizer is accustomed to since he has spent more than 30 years doing it. However, when the production bears many fruits it is gratifying. It is the result of his work and dedication, of overcoming difficulties, cleaning and maintaining his productive lands.

Ortizer has a great love for his wife, who is the most important person for him and who motivates him day after day. With the money that he is seeking, he is thinking about increasing his production and growing a greater quantity and variety of products typical of the region so that he and his wife can be secure in their old age.


Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity and variety of agricultural products for his land

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha tiene 44 años, vive con su esposo y con su última hija de 3 años. Por más de 20 años, está plenamente dedicada a la producción de plátanos, actividad que le ayudó a educar a sus hijos mayores. Esta fruta demanda gran atención, y diarias horas de sacrificio, pero junto a su esposo la tarea se hace menos pesada.Gracias a ello, siempre mantuvo comunicación con su pareja, ya que trabajan juntos para el bienestar de los miembros de su hogar, lo que más le gusta es el momento cuando encajan en sus terrenos una a una las plantas de plátano, ya que al verlas pequeñas les dan una nueva esperanza en sus ingresos, sin embargo lo difícil es poder mantener sus plantaciones abonadas  y limpias para no perjudicar su producción. 
Martha tiene en su última hija su mayor motivo de trabajo y esfuerzo para su progreso como agricultora.
Invertirá el dinero que solicita en la ampliación de sus terrenos, así poder plantar mayor cantidad de plátano y aumentar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Martha is 44 years old and lives with her husband and her last daughter who is 3 years old. For more than 20 years she has dedicated herself to the production of bananas, this activity helped her educate her older children. This fruit requires lots of attention and daily hours of sacrifice, but with her husband labor is less demanding. Thanks to the work, she always keeps good communication with her husband, because they work together for the well being of their home. What she likes the most is when they place one by one new plantain’s plants, because looking at them so little always brings new hopes of income, yet is always difficult to keep them fertilized and clean in order to improve production.
Martha’s youngest daughter is her greatest motivation to keep on working and to progress as a farmer.
She will invest the money she is requesting on increasing her land in order to cultivate more plantains and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase plantain farming

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andrés tiene 57 años, vive con su esposa y sus cinco hijos. Desde niño se dedico a ser agricultor, desde que se casó, tuvo la responsabilidad de mantener a su familia, para ello tuvo que ocuparse en sus producciones de plátanos, tiempo completo,  pasando hasta días enteros en sus lejanas chacras.Para él, esto no es trabajoso ya que  tiene la experiencia de toda una vida en ello y disfruta realizando esta actividad, sobre todo en el momento de cosechar, porque toda su familia lo apoya en ello y no se siente solo, ya que es triste estar solo en sus terrenos sin tener con quien compartir su trabajo. 
Andrés tiene el deseo de ser un gran agricultor, ser reconocido como tal, y este es el motivo de su trabajo.
Desea invertir en la compra de plantaciones de plátanos y adquirir un terreno adicional para su nueva producción, y así con el tiempo lograr una estabilidad como agricultor.
texts.en:
Andres is 57 years old and lives with his wife and five children. Since he was a kid he worked in agriculture, and since he got married he had to support his family, so he decided to work producing plantains full time, spending full days on far away lands. For him this is not work because he has a life long experience on it and enjoys very much this activity, mainly the moment when he harvests, because his family helps him and he doesn’t feel alone, because sometimes is sad working alone without anyone to share his work with.
Andres wants to be a great farmer, and be recognized like one so he keeps on working.
He wants to invest the loan on buying land for the plantains to increase production and with time gain stability as a farmer.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy additional land for plantain farming

loans.name: Elvin

texts.es:
Elvin tiene 43 años, vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos.  Es un humilde agricultor dedicado a la producción de cítricos dentro de su comunidad y cuyos terrenos de cultivo se encuentran en zonas distantes de su hogar, por ello tiene que salir a tempranas horas de la mañana, y de la misma forma le toma tiempo el retornar a su casa. Pero el ver los frutos en sus terrenos lo reconfortan, y el cosechar aun más, aunque para ello tenga que invertir  grandes cantidades de dinero, ya que en la cosecha sabe que tendrá una  retribución al negociar sus productos, los que tienen que ser de alta calidad para tener mayores ingresos en su venta.
Elvin basa su esfuerzo en el bienestar de su familia, sobre todo en sus hijos.
Tiene proyectado aumentar su producción, para solventar los gastos de trasporte, ya que quiere llevar sus productos a la capital, Lima.
texts.en:
Elvin is 43 years old and lives with her wife and 4 kids. He is a humble farmer dedicated to produce citric fruits inside his community, the lands of cultivation are far away from his home, this is why he has to leave early in the morning and it takes time to go back home too. But when he sees the harvest of his land it comforts him and wants to harvest even more although in order to do that he needs to invest large amounts of money, because he knows that on a larger harvest, he will have better results, and the fruit has to be of better quality in order to get more income from the sales.
Elvin bases his effort on the well being of his family, mostly his children.
He wants to increase production, to pay for transportation expenses because he wants to take his products to the capital, Lima.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for transportation of his fruit to the capital city to increase his profit

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
Eliana tiene 48 años, vive con sus tres jóvenes hijos y con su esposo.  Se dedica a las plantaciones de plátano y yuca, lo cual realiza por más de 9 años, ahora tiene la experiencia de cómo desenvolverse como agricultora, y de tener la posibilidad de mejorar sus plantaciones, por ello se dedica a ellas todas las mañanas para que en las tardes pueda dedicarse a su hogar.Lo que le agrada, es poder hacer las plantaciones en sus terrenos, lo cual no es fácil, pero es como sembrar nuevas esperanzas, de la misma forma tiene que saber lidiar con el tiempo, que a veces le falta para poder limpiar sus terrenos.
Para Eliana, su mayor motivación son sus hijos, quienes desean estudiar en la universidad. 
Por ellos, tienen pensado invertir en nuevas plantaciones de yucas y plátano, pero sobre todo  ampliar sus terrenos de cultivo y llevar sus productos a las ciudades.
texts.en:
Eliana is 48 years old and lives with her three young children and her husband. She has been working on plantains and yucca farming for the last 9 years, now she has experience to develop more as a farmer and improve her land; this is why she works on the land every morning, so she can dedicate to her home in the afternoon. She likes to be able to work on her own land, which is not difficult and is like sawing new hopes; she also needs to organize her time, because sometimes she doesn’t have enough to clean her land.
To Eliana her greatest motivation is her children, who want to go to university.
Is because of them she wants to invest on land to cultivate plantains and yucca, mostly to improve her current land and take her products to the cities.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the land to cultivate yuca and plantains to increase production and sell it to nearby towns

loans.name: Tiguida

texts.fr: Tiguida D., 42 ans, mariée avec 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Kounkané 3 depuis 6 ans. Elle veut acheter des graines d’arachide pour les transformer en pâte d’arachide et vendre. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales. <b>Tiguida sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.<b/>
texts.en:
Tiguida D., age 42, is married and has five children in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Kounkané 3 for six years. She wants to buy peanuts to transform into peanut butter to sell. Her income will enable her to help cover family expenses. Tiguida is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Production and sale of peanut butter

loans.name: Nerida

texts.es:
Nerida tiene 25 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos pequeños. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, desde que se casó tuvo que trabajar en la producción de yuca y maíz, junto a su pareja, quien le enseñó todos los gajes de este oficio, desde entonces,  se ocupa en ello, todas las tardes.Por las mañanas de encarga de velar por sus hijos, para luego ir a apoyar a su esposo en sus chacras. Lo más difícil es trasladarse a sus terrenos, ya que son lejanos, como a dos horas de camino a pie.
Desde que se casó, Nerida tiene en sus hijos un nuevo motivo de progresar.
Con el dinero que pide, desea invertir en la compra de plantaciones de yuca y sembríos de maíz, los que puedan producir grandes cantidades y trasportarlos a las ciudades más comerciales, para ser ellos mismos quienes los vendan en los mercados.
texts.en:
Nerida is a 25 year old mother of three small children, who lives with her husband. She is a hard worker, having worked since she married growing yucca and corn together with her husband, who taught her the necessary skills. Since then, she has kept busy working the fields every afternoon. She cares for her children in the mornings, and later goes to the fields to assist her husband. The hardest part of the work is the journey to the fields, which are a two hour journey away on foot. Since her marriage, Nerida has found inspiration to work in her children. With the money that she is requesting, she would like to invest in the purchase of yucca and corn plantations, which can produce greater quantities, and then transport them to cities with more commerce so that they can sell them themselves in the markets.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in the purchase of yucca and corn plantations

loans.name: Dario

texts.es:
Darío es un hombre de 58 años, vive con su esposa. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura,  y desde que se casó volcó toda su experiencia en los campos de cultivo, para junto a su esposa, logren el bienestar de su familia, gracias a ello, sus hijos ahora son independientes y tienen su propia familia, ahora, ambos siguen trabajando el uno por el otro.Esta actividad le toma  gran parte del día y le demanda mucho esfuerzo para  realizarlo, pero le agrada, sobre todo el cuidado de sus productos, para lo cual compra diversos productos como abonos y fertilizantes que le ayuden a mantenerlos sin problemas, pero los costos de estos, son muy elevados.
Darío tiene que velar por su pareja, esto le da mayores motivos para esforzarse en su trabajo.
Ahora quiere invertir en la producción de yuca, tener una muy buena producción que le resulte lo suficientemente rentable para tener otro negocio que asegure el futuro y la vejes de él y de su pareja.
texts.en:
Dario is a 58 year old man who lives with his wife. He has always worked in agriculture, and since his marriage, he has put his experience to work in the fields so that he and his wife might achieve well being in their family. Thanks to their hard work their children are now independent with families of their own. Now, the couple works to support each other. Their jobs take up most of their time every day, and require plenty of hard work, but they enjoy it. They are especially proud of their product, which they care for by purchasing manure and fertilizer which help them to grow their crops successfully. The cost of these necessary items, however, is very hight. Dario must care for his wife every day, and this is his main motivation to work hard. He would like to make an investment in Yucca production, so that he can have a successful enough crop to start another business which will provide a secure future for him and his wife.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in a yucca plantation, increase his income and be able to have another business when he is no longer able to work the fields

loans.name: Carlos Florencio

texts.es:
Carlos U. paga el alquiler de una casa ubicada en la calle Juan Granier de la zona 14 de septiembre (ciudad de La Paz), en donde también tiene un taller de sastrería, con esta actividad mantiene a su esposa e hijos (es su única fuente de ingresos). Su solicitud de crédito es para adquirir material de trabajo ya que actualmente él remienda prendas pero ahora tiene planeado confeccionar trajes completos para ganar más dinero con sus ventas (en Bolivia los trajes hechos a medida son bien pagados debido al buen precio).

Es uno de nuestros clientes más antiguos y su historial es muy bueno,  por lo que aconsejamos ayudar a este micro empresario.
texts.en:
Carlos U. pays rent on his home located on Juan Granier Street in the zone of La Paz known as 14 de Septiembre (September 14). He has a tailoring workshop in his rented home. He supports his wife and children with the workshop; it is his only source of income. His loan application is for capital with which to buy working materials. Currently he does only alterations, but he plans to begin making complete suits in order to earn more money with his sales. In Bolivia, making custom suits to order pays well, thanks to the good price the tailor can charge for the final product.

Carlos is one of IMPRO's oldest clients. His credit history is very good; IMPRO recommends helping this microentrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata Kanté, 44 ans, mariée avec 03 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Kounkané 3 depuis 2 ans et demi. Elle vend de la glace, des crèmes glacées et de la banane. Elle veut renforcer son commerce en achetant des sacs de pain de singe, de bissap et de sucre pour faire des crèmes glacées et de la banane à revendre.  <b>Fatoumata sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.<b/>
texts.en:
Fatoumata Kanté, age 44, is married and has three children in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Kounkané 3 for two and half years. She sells ice, ice cream, and bananas. She wants to bolster her business by buying bags of monkey bread (the fruit of the baobab tree), bissap (hibiscus flowers), sugar to make ice cream, and bananas to resell. Fatoumata is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell ice, ice cream, and bananas

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter tiene 30 años, vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos. Desde muy pequeño está familiarizado con la agricultura, gracias a sus padres sabe cómo  trabajar la tierra, ahora está dedicado netamente a la producción de maíz, que realiza durante todo el día, ocupándose en limpiar, regar y sobre todo a abonar sus terrenos, para que su producción sea adecuada.Dentro de su actividad como agricultor siempre le agradó limpiar sus terrenos, porque es algo muy importante y liviano, lo más difícil es cuando las lluvias atraen moquitos que perjudican sus plantas, para ello tiene que adquirir insecticidas para combatir esta amenaza.
Walter desea mejorar la calidad de vida de los miembros de su hogar, siendo esto el motivo de su ardua labor.
Invertirá el dinero que solicita en la compra de abono e insecticidas para afrontar  las diversas adversidades de la naturaleza, con el fin de tener a unos meses la mejor producción de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Walter is 30 years old and lives with his wife and their 4 children. He has been very familiar with agriculture since he was young; thanks to his parents he knows how to work the land. Now he supports himself entirely from corn production. He works all day cleaning, irrigating and fertilizing his fields so that his production will be good. He has always liked cleaning his fields because it is important and is lighter work than many of his tasks. The most difficult part of his work comes when the rains attract mosquitos that damage his plants. He has to buy insecticides to combat that threat.

Walter wants to improve his family's quality of life; that wish provides the motivation for his arduous work. He will invest the loan in the purchase of fertilizer and insecticides to help him face nature's diverse threats, with the aim to have the best production in his community in a few months.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and insecticides for his crops.

loans.name: Yulber

texts.es:
Yulber tiene 32 años, vive con su esposa y su hijo de tres años. Desde hace poco se dedica a la producción de ladrillos de adobe, ya que se ha dado cuenta que hay muchas personas que han empezado la construcciones de sus viviendas, entonces, la venta de estos adobes incrementa los ingresos en su hogar, dicha labor la realiza a un lado de su domicilio, sin tener que  ausentarse de su familia.Es así, que su trabajo le agrada, porque desde niño le gustó e interesó mucho la producción de ladrillos, ahora espera que  le vaya muy bien en esta nueva actividad, aunque a veces tenga que lidiar con las lluvias y con el ardiente sol de la tarde, el cual hace cansado esta labor.
Yulber tiene una familia a la cual mantener, y son ellos el motivo de arduo trabajo.
El dinero que solicita será invertido en la comprar de madera para elaborar mayor cantidad de  moldes, para los ladrillos, tiene la esperanza que esta nueva actividad le abrirá nuevos caminos para el progreso de su familia.
texts.en:
Yulber is 32 years old; he lives with his wife and his 3 year old son. For a short while now he has been working in the production of adobe bricks. He started the business when he realized that many people have begun construction on their homes. His brick sales increase the family's income. He makes the bricks in an area alongside his home without having to spend the day at a distance from his family. He enjoys his work because since he was a boy he has liked and been interested in the production of bricks. Now he hopes that the business goes very well for him, even though he sometimes has to battle with the rains and the blazing afternoon sun that makes his work tiring.Yulber has a family to support; they are the motivation for his arduous work. The loan will be invested in the purchase of wood to make a large quantity of molds for brickmaking. He has hope that this new business will open new roads for his family's progress.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood with which to make molds for his small brick factory.

loans.name: Cesar Raul

texts.es:
Cesar B. de 28 años de edad, vive en casa de sus suegros (calle las flores, zona de Tacagua, ciudad de La Paz). Tiene un taller de chaperia instalado en la Av. Jaime Freyre de la zona de Sopocachi, el cuál viene dándole utilidades desde hace un año, el negocio funciona de 8:30 a 20:30 (ininterrumpidamente). Cesar fue uno de los beneficiados con el programa de Kiva en febrero de este año. Ahora solicita crédito para comprar material de trabajo que le permita seguir trabajando en su taller. 

Su actividad es bastante segura, sólo necesita un poco de apoyo, es por eso que califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Cesar B., 28 years old, lives in his inlaws' home on the street called Las Flores in the Tacagua zone of the city of La Paz. He has an auto body shop on Jaime Freyre Avenue in the Sopocachi zone. He has been working in his business for a year now; the shop is open from 8:30 AM to 8:30 PM, with no interruption. Cesar was one of the benificiaries of the Kiva program last February. Now he is requesting a new loan with which to buy the working materials that will allow him to continue working in his shop. His business is quite secure. He needs only a small amount of support; for that reason he qualified to receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy working materials

loans.name: Diaraye

texts.fr:
Diaraye S., 42 ans, mariée avec 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Kounkané 3 depuis 6 ans. Elle veut acheter des graines d’arachide et les griller pour faire de la pâte d’arachide et vendre. Elle vend aussi des légumes par moment. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent de contribuer aux charges familiales. <b>Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.<b/>
.
texts.en:
Diaraye S. is 42 years old and married with five children under her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Kounkané 3 for six years. She wants to purchase peanuts so she can grill them, make peanut butter, and sell it. She also sells vegetables for the time being. The money that she makes allows her to support her family. The loan she’s requesting will be paid back in one lump sum in six months’ time. .

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Production and selling of peanut butter

loans.name: Teobaldo

texts.es:
Teobaldo tiene 41 años, vive con su esposa y sus 5 hijos jóvenes. Se dedica al cultivo de yuca, lo cual realiza desde muy joven, desde que se casó tuvo que dedicarse a ello a tiempo completo, ya que es la manera de poder satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar.Lo que le agrada de ello, es comercializar con las personas que visitan su comunidad para negociar los productos que cultivan en la zona, negociación que hasta el día de hoy ha beneficiado a Teobaldo. Se han presentado diversas dificultades en su producción por los costosos precios de los insecticidas que ayudan a mantener su producción.
Teobaldo tiene en su familia el mejor motivador en su trabajo.
Ahora, desea invertir en la producción de yuca,  además del cultivo de maíz, porque la temporada es propicia, con el tiempo, adquirir nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción y  sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Teobaldo is 41 years old and lives with his wife and their five young children. Since he was very young, Teobaldo has been a yuca farmer. Since getting married, he has dedicated all his time to his crop, as this is his means for covering household expenses. Teobaldo loves doing business with the folks who visit his community to buy products grown in the region -- an activity which continues to benefit Teobaldo. Nevertheless, he has encountered various challenges to raising his crop, such as the high cost of insecticide used to keep up production. Teobaldo's family keeps him going in his work. He would like to invest in growing yuca and corn, seeing the climate is favorable. Over time he plans to purchase more land to expand his production and increase profits.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in yuca and corn crops

loans.name: Cristhian

texts.es:
Cristhian B. (28 años de edad, profesor de música especializado en acordeón) tiene domicilio propio ubicado en la calle Nanahua de la zona de Pasankeri (ciudad de La Paz) vive con su madre su hermano. Debido al bajo sueldo que percibe Cristhian también se dedica a la confección de ropa para niños, su producto es vendido en distintas ferias de todo el país. Por eso, solicita crédito para comprar material de trabajo, lo que le permitirá mantener su fuente de ingresos ya que con dicha actividad él esta progresando.

Es un buen cliente de Impro y se recomienda ayudarlo.
texts.en:
Christhian B. (28 years old and a music teacher specialized in the accordion) has his own home located in Nanahua Street in the Pasankeri zone of the city of La Paz. He lives with his mother. Because his salary as a music teacher is very low, Cristhian works making children's clothing which is then sold at fairs throughout the country. He is requesting a loan with which to buy working materials. The loan will allow him to maintain his source of income, since the clothing business is developing well. Christhian is a good client of Impro and the organization recommends helping him.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMPRA DE MATERIALES / Purchase of materials

loans.name: Mene

texts.es:
Mene tiene 29 años, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos de 5, 3 y 2 años de edad. Está dedicado a la producción de yuca, que por temporada, tuvo gran acogida en los mercados, es un producto que todo el tiempo es solicitado en las chacras, para satisfacer los requerimientos de los compradores tiene que cuidar sus terrenos de cultivo casi por todo un día, lo cual no le parece muy complicado, ya que desde 10 años se dedica a esta actividad.Lo que más le agrada, es que su esposa viene a ayudarlo por las tardes, compartiendo las labores juntos,  tratando de  limpiar y abonar sus sembríos adecuadamente. Lo más  perjudicial es que los abonos son muy costosos  y generan una inversión considerable.
Mene desea el dinero que solicita para invertirlo en la compra de plantaciones de yuca e incrementar nuevas producciones, como de plátano y cítricos;  y con el tiempo ser un próspero  agricultor y comerciante.
texts.en:
Mene is a 29 year old man who lives with his wife and their 3 children, ages 5, 3, and 2. He works growing yucca, which for the season was very sought after in the markets. It is a product which requires daily attention in the fields in order to meet the requirements of the customers. Mene works all day in the fields, something that he is used to; having done it for 10 years. What makes him the happiest is that his wife comes to help him in the afternoons. The work together to fertilize and cultivate their crops sufficiently. The hardest part is that the fertilizer is quite expensive, and they require a significant investment. Mene would like to use the money that he is requesting to purchase yucca plantations and to begin new crops such as bananas and citrus; and in time be a prosperous farmer and merchant.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase yucca plantations and begin growing bananas and citrus.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 28 años, vive solo.  Siempre le agradó la agricultura y gracias a ello logró obtener su independencia económica, y sobre todo ayudar a sus padres. Pero esta labor le toma todo el día, se ocupa de sus chacras desde muy temprano, prepara sus alimentos para luego salir a sus terrenos, esta todo el día  trabajando en limpiar y  abonar la tierra.Como es soltero le agrada su trabajo, aunque es pesado, pero es algo que le agrada realizar, sobre todo abonar sus terrenos, aunque  lo que le resulta difícil es adquirir estos abonos, por su costo altísimo, pero indispensables en todo cultivo.
Lo que le motiva es su futuro, para que cuando tenga su familia pueda ofrecerle lo necesario para su felicidad.
Jaime invertirá en la compra de abonos que mejoren sus productos, sobre todo mantengan a sus terrenos altamente productivos, y con el tiempo tener una familia, ser un gran agricultor y comerciante.
texts.en:
Jaime is a 28 year old single man. He has always worked in agriculture, and because of that he has been able to achieve economic independence and help his parents. His work takes all day, and he works in the fields from early in to morning - preparing his food and taking it with him. He spends the day cultivating and fertilizing his crops. As a single man he enjoys his work, particularly fertilizing his crops. The fertilizer is quite expensive, but it is critical for every crop. What motivates him is a vision toward the future, so that once he has a family he will be able to offer them what they need to be happy. Jaime will invest his loan in the purchase of fertilizer which will improve his product and will keep the production rate of his fields high. Someday he hopes to have a family and to be a fine farmer and merchant.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for agricultural fields.

loans.name: Tasuthekeh Group

texts.en:
These are Sallay K., Marie L., Yeabu K., and Mohamed J.. They are business people in Magburaka town, selling different items. Sally is the group's leader and sells cottons and shoes. She travels as far as neighboring Guinea to buy the goods she sells. Sally is 38 and a widow with four children. She has been in her business for the past ten years. Previous loans have helped Sally a lot. Her business has grown both in size and quality. She is expecting this loan to further enlarge her business.

Marie sells palm-oil and Yeabu sells market food in a small stall on her veranda. Mohammed J. sells firewood and local produces. This will be their third loan from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans made great impacts in their lives. Their business capital increases to a new height each time they get a loan from SMT. They are seeking another loan to keep strengthening their businesses and livelihoods. They are requesting a loan of Le 3,200,000.00. With this loan, they will be able to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more goods to further strengthen their businesses.

loans.name: Kamuyu Assciation No. 3 Group

texts.en:
This group is called Kamuyu Association No 3. Kamuyu is a Temne word meaning patience. These ladies are: Marie K. (left), Isatu K. and Emma B.. (The other two members of the group are not pictured).

These three sell market food at the Magburaka town market. This will be their 3rd loan from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans were of immense help to these entrepreneurs. They however still need more loans to further enhance their businesses. They are thus seeking a loan of Le 2,400,000.00 to enable them do so.

Marie K. is the leader of the group. She is 30 years of age, married with 4 children. Three of her children are still in primary school and the other is in secondary school. Both Marie and her husband who works for Salcost (Sallani Construction, an Italian company contracted by the government for the construction of roads) pay their school fees. She has sold peppers and onions at the town's main market for the past 5 years now.

With her previous loans, Marie has been able to buy a freezer. She uses it to sell cold water, ginger beer and soft drinks. With this loan, Marie can now buy a brand new generator to replace the old one that has being giving her a lot of problems.

loans.use: Buy a generator

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: After You Na Me Group

texts.en:
This group is called After You Na Me. Its members include Marie C., Kadiatu K., Sallamatu Koroma, Mabinty K. and Kadiatu Koroma. (the latter is not pictured) They are requesting a loan of Le 3,200,000.00 to help them enhance their businesses.

This will be their 3rd loan from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans made a lot of improvements in the lives of these entrepreneurs. Their businesses expanded a bit further, and at the same time they were able to solve most of their numerous problems with the proceeds, and then repay their loans successfully.

Their leader is Kadiatu K.. Kadiatu is 35 years of age. She was born in Magburaka, is married to a businessman, and they have 2 children. Both of her children are in secondary school. She and her husband are responsible for their school fees and other charges.

Marie has sold peppers, onions, tomatoes, salt etc. at the Magburaka town market for the past 15 years now. Marie used her previous loans to buy gallons of palm-oil which she stored until the price for palm-oil increased. She also gave her husband part of the loan to start his own business. With this new loan, Marie will invest in rice and ground-nuts.

loans.use: Expand their businesses

loans.name: Nyètaa (Essor) Group

texts.fr:
Les neuf (9) femmes du groupe Nyètaa (composé de 3 veuves et de 6 mariées) ont une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et 3 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Bozo de la sous préfecture de Markala (région de Ségou République du Mali). Appartenant à une ethnie de pêcheurs (Bozo) et exerçant la même activité professionnelle à savoir la vente de poissons sous diverses formes (frais, fumés ou séchés). Par ailleurs en plus du poisson, elles font le commerce d’habits et de tasses.
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante ce groupe a décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel il est à son troisième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 938 kg de poissons frais et 35 barres de glaces. Elles s’approvisionnent en poissons frais sur place au bord du fleuve Niger à Markala auprès des pêcheurs. Une partie est vendue en état frais et une autre partie est fumée dans un endroit aménagé dans la concession conjugale sur des foyers traditionnels spécialement conçus pour cette activité. Les poissons ainsi fumés sont acheminés sur Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) pour être vendus en gros et au comptant à des revendeurs. Au retour elles achètent des habits et des tasses qui seront vendus dans les marchés de Markala, Niono et Siribala à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 40.000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités. Elles ont pour ambition de diversifier leur commerce en embrassant d’autres activités génératrices de revenus telle la vente de céréales sèches.
texts.en:
The nine (9) women of the Nyètaa Group (made up of 3 widows and 6 married women) have an average age of 45 years and have three children living in large traditional extended families in the Bozo quarter in the Markala sous-prefecture (in the Ségou region of Mali). They belong to an ethnic group known for fishing (Bozo) and are involved in the selling of various forms of fish (fresh, smoked, or dried). In addition, they also sell clothing and cups.

In order to keep up with ever-increasing customer demand, the group has decided to get help from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with whom they are on their third solidarity (or group) loan. All of their previous loans have been repaid in full. They are planning to use this loan to purchase 938 kg of fresh fish and 35 cakes of ice. They purchase their fresh fish from the fishermen on-site on the banks of the Niger River in Markala. Some of the fish is sold while it’s fresh and some is smoked in a converted area on the family land in buildings specially designed for this job. The women take the smoked fish to Bamako (the capital of Mali) to be sold to resellers wholesale and for cash. When they return from Bamako they buy clothing and cups that they will sell in the markets of Markala, Niono, and Siribala to a customer base made up of men and women.

They each hope to make an average monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA which will be used to pay the interest on the loan and to take care of their extended family. The rest will be reinvested into their business. They would like to diversify their business by branching out into other income-generating areas such as the sale of dried cereals.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fresh fish and food-grade ice

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza Tanzania!

This is Rabia M., she is thirty-one years old. She is married with two children, aged five and seven. She started running a pharmacy earlier this year. She works six days a week and is assisted by one employee. She can make a monthly profit of about $100. Rabia is requesting a loan of $450 to purchase additional stock of medicine. In the future she plans to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so she can use it while in process of paying back her loan Ð a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of medicine.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Née à Tabligbo en 1982, monsieur S. est marié et père d’un enfant. C’est un commerçant d’huile à moteur très rusé. Il s’est installé à côté d’une station à essence qui est souvent à cour d’huile à moteur. C’est d’ailleurs ce qui donna l’idée à ce monsieur de ce lancer dans ce commerce. Il s’est alors très tôt attiré une clientèle qu’il fidélisa.
La particularité chez lui est que ses produits sont un tout petit peu moins cher que le prix du marché. Il a besoin de ce premier crédit pour augmenter son stock afin de répondre à sa demande croissante.
texts.en:
Born in Tabligbo in 1982, Mr. Komi S. is married and has one child. He is a very skilled salesman of motor oil. He settled next to a petrol station which often runs short of motor oil. This is what gave this gentleman the idea to go into business. As a result, he very quickly attracted a clientele whose loyalty he has ensured. A characteristic of his business is that his products are slightly cheaper than the market price. He is in need of this first loan to increase his stock in order to respond to the increasing demand.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy motor oil for resale

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah Q. is 42 years old. She is a wife and the mother of seven children. She is a retailer of charcoal and firewood in her local community. Charcoal and firewood are a very popular source of energy for cooking in most traditional Ghanaian homes.

Hannah buys her supply of charcoal and firewood from the villages and retails them to her customers. She has supported five of her children to finish school with income from her business. With the loan, she wants to buy more charcoal and firewood to serve her customers. She hopes the loan will enable her to save more to support the other two to finish school. She would be very grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for re-sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose A. is a 44-year-old widow with four children who have all completed school. She started trading twelve years ago and enjoys selling things; currently she trades in clothing materials. Rose believes in hard work and dedication. She has gained a great deal of marketing experience, making her one of the most successful traders in Obuasi market. She believes a loan would provide her with capital to purchase clothing materials to better serve her customers. Rose belongs to the community group called God First Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee and provide support for one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing materials

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is a mother of two kids who are currently in school. She is a 49-year-old trader. She trades in lace materials. Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations. For lack of adequate working capital, Mary buys few stocks of lace materials and sells through hawking.

She believes the loan will enable her to grow her business to the expected level. With the loan, she wants to purchase a bulk supply of lace materials and textiles. She hopes to use part of her profit to provide her children with a quality education.

Mary belongs to the community group called Gift Trust group. The group members guarantee a loan through a repayment pledge and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase bulk of lace materials and textiles

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa G. is twenty nine years old. She is married with two kids. She realizes the need to support her family with additional income so she decided to start a trade. She has been selling palm oil and bleaches like parazole for the past ten months. She buys her supply of parazole and palm oil from the local manufacturers and retails them to her customers who are mostly households, food vendors, and drivers.

With the loan, she wants to buy palm oil and parazole in bulk to cater for the demands of her customers. She wants to use proceed from her operation to support the kids in school. Theresa is a member of the group called Gift. Members agree to guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy palm oil and bleaches in bulk

texts.es:
Clara es productora de leche de vaca, tambien tiene una tienda de artesanias (comparte el negocio con su familia) ayuda a su padres a mantener a sus hermanos menores de 18, 12, y 2 años de edad. Ella vive en casa de sus padres (comunidad de Palomar a dos horas y media de la Ciudad de La Paz).

El crédito sera usado para comprar una vaca de mediana calidad para generar mayores ingresos económicos.
 
Es su primer crédito con Impro, califica para la aprobación del préstamo.
texts.en:
Clara is a milk cow producer, she also has a hanycrafts shop (she shares the business with her family). She helps her parents to support her younger brothers and sisters who are 18, 12, and 2 years old. She lives at her parents' house in the city of Palomar, two and a half hours away from the City of La Paz). The loan will be used to buy a cow of medium quality to generate a better economic income. This is her first loan with Impro, she qualifies for the approval of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana A. is 47 years old and a married mother with three children. Two of them are in school. She is so grateful to Sinapi for giving her a loan which saved her marriage as her husband saw her to be a burden on him. She used the previous loan to start selling cooked rice for schools and children and other workers in her town. This enabled her save to help her husband in paying the children's school fees.

Juliana wants to add to her rice business the selling of spring rolls which she says customers want for breakfast. She therefore wants to use this loan to buy more bags of rice and flour, vegetables, eggs and assorted meat to expand her operation. She is a member of the group called 'Yesu ne manidaso'. Members in this group agree to guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, baking flour, etc. to make food to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Carolina es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Florcitas del Progreso II“, vive en la región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de repuestos en general. El negocio está ubicado en su propio domicilio,  en el Jr. vía de evitamiento C-14

Se inicia en el negocio ante la necesidad de generar sus ingresos para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de la casa. Con su esfuerzo ha logrado que su negocio crezca y se mantenga. Comenzó vendiendo aceites de diferentes marcas y repuestos para diferentes vehículos. Actualmente el negocio es muy variado y surtido. Tiene buena cantidad de clientes, quienes acuden desde muy temprano a comprarle sus productos.

Con el préstamo de S/. 600, que pagará en 4 meses, comprará filtro de freno, focos, pernos, aceites y repuestos que son más pedidos entre sus clientes y poder satisfacer sus necesidades.

Carolina tiene 55 años, vive sola ya que sus hijos son independientes. Se considera independiente para decidir y manejar el negocio, porque es quien dirige el negocio. Los clientes se han incrementado debido al carisma y amabilidad en la atención. Cree que tener un negocio surtido también garantiza las ventas, su meta es acondicionar y arreglar un ambiente en su domicilio para el negocio.
texts.en:
Carolina is a member of the Las Florcitas del Progreso II community bank. She lives in the San Martin region and province of the Tarapoto district. She works selling auto parts. Her business is located in her home, in the Jr. route of of the C-14 cut off. She began her business out of the need to help her husband with the household bills. Through hard work she has been able to grow her business and provide support. She began selling different brands of oil and spare parts for vehicles. Now her business is more diverse. She has many clients who start arriving early each day to purchase products. With a loan of 600 soles, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase brake filters, light bulbs, bolts, oils and the parts most frequently requested by her customers in order to meet their needs. Carolina is 55 years old. She lives along now that her children are independent. She considers herself independent as she makes decisions and manages her business. Her client base has grown because of her charisma and friendliness in providing service. She believes that having a well supplied business also helps sales. Her goal is to set up an area in her home for her business.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of brake filters, lightbulbs, bolts, oil and spare parts.

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr:
Monsieur A. est née en 1970 à Danyi Elavagno, village dans lequel abondent les fruits tels que ananas, mangue, avocat etc. Il est marié et est père de deux enfants. Il a toujours aimé la couture et avait rêvé être un grand couturier. Faute de soutien, il n’a pas pu faire cet apprentissage. Néanmoins il s’est lancer dans la fourniture des articles de mercerie qu’il livre aux couturiers. Son affaire évolue et depuis 2002 il s’est installé à son domicile et ce sont les couturiers qui viennent s’approvisionner chez lui.
A cause de la rentrée scolaire il à besoin de ce crédit pour étoffer son stock de mercerie pouvant permettre au tailleur de bien faire leur métier.
texts.en:
Mr. Komla A. was born in 1970 in Danyi Elavagno, a village in which fruits such as pineapples, mangoes, avocados, etc. grow abundantly. He is married and has two children. He has always liked sewing and dreamed of being a big fashion designer. Due to a lack of means, he was unable to do an apprenticeship. Nevertheless, he began to supply haberdashery items, which he delivered to designers. His business has grown and since 2002, he has run his business from home, and the designers now come to him to supply themselves. Thanks to the start of the school year, he needs this loan to fill out his haberdashery stock and allow the tailors to better carry out their work.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy haberdashery items in preparation for the start of the school year

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina A. is 34 years old and a mother of four kids, two of whom are currently in school. She has been selling frozen water and kenkey (a sourdough dumpling), as well as plastic ware, for nine years now. Due to a low income, she has not been able to support the rest of her children in acquiring an employable skill or education to earn a living. With the loan, she wants to buy an efficient refrigerator to enable her to save some money and send the two kids to school.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Estefania

texts.es:
Estefanía como muchas mujeres boliviana es madre soltera y fue abandonada por su esposo. Ella trabaja como productora de leche de vaca y tambien es una pequeña agricultora de hortalizas, vive la Comunidad de Palomar a dos horas y media de la Ciudad de La Paz.

Solicita crédito para comprar una vaca de mediana calidad para incrementar su producción de leche y sus ingresos económicos.
 
Es su primer crédito con Impro, esta calificada para acceder al prestamo.
texts.en:
Estefanía, like many Bolivian women, is a single mother and was abandoned by her husband. She works as a producer of cow milk and is also a small farmer of vegetables. She lives in the la Comunidad de Palomar, two and a half hours from the city of La Paz.

She is requesting a loan to buy a cow of medium quality to increase her milk production and economic income. It is her first loan with IMPRO; she is qualified to receive this loan.

Note from Kiva: The Kiva staff confirmed with the IMPRO team that while Estefanía is pictured in front of a vehicle, she does in fact have a milk sales business. When the team went out to take her photo, she was in a hurry so she posed in front of her car instead of with her cows.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en: Abiba A. is 30 years old and a mother of two children who are currently in school. Abiba sells used clothing in Ghana, where there is a very big market for them, as brand new clothes are too expensive for the economically active poor. Abiba is asking for a loan to buy more bales of used clothing and increase her inventory. She believes this loan will help her to save for her children's future and also to rent a store for her business.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothing

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Celia Elida

texts.es:
La señora Celia es socia del BC “MUJERES TRABAJANDO II”,  vive en la región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Cacatachi. Se dedica a la venta de frutas y productos de pan llevar como plátanos, yuca y limones. El negocio está ubicado en el mercado Nº 02 de la ciudad de Tarapoto, en el cual tiene un puesto de venta. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 800, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará frutas como: plátanos en racimos, papayas, menestras de diferentes variedades, yuca, limones en sacos y productos que encuentra en oferta cuando sale a las chacras a comprar los productos para traerlos al mercado y ofertar a sus clientes. Celia manifiesta que tiene que surtir bien el negocio para asegurar las ventas.  

La señora Celia tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y la de su suegra, quien la apoya en el cuidado de su pequeño hijo. Su meta es comprar una casa en la ciudad y surtir más el negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Celia is a member of the “WORKING WOMEN II” group. She lives in the Peruvian province of San Martin, in the Cacatachi District. She sells fruits and other agricultural products such as plantains, yucca, and lemons. She sells her goods at a stall in Market no. 2 of the city of Taracoto.

With her loan of 800 soles (to be repaid in 4 months) she will buy goods such as plantain bunches, papayas, different kinds of legumes, yucca, sacks of lemons, and other products offered at the farms where she buys what she sells at the market. Celia declares that she has to properly stock up her stall in order to ensure her sales.

Ms. Celia is 31 years old, and she lives with her husband and their little son. She has the support of her husband and of her mother-in-law, who helps her take care of her young child. Her goal is to buy a house in the city, and to keep adding supplies to her business.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy goods such as plantain bunches, papayas, different kinds of legumes, yucca, lemons, etc.

loans.name: Cidlia

texts.es:
La señora Cidlia es socia del BC “CORAZON DE JESUS”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia del Dorado y distrito de San José de Sisa. Se dedica a la venta de útiles de oficina, adornos y celulares, complementa el negocio con la venta de cosméticos de la marca Esika. Se inició con un capital de S/. 300 en un local alquilado y sólo contaba con mesa, silla y una vitrina.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,300 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 04 meses, comprará colonias, talcos, desodorantes, esmaltes, cremas, lentes en docenas, celulares y otros útiles que necesita para surtir bien el negocio y contar con lo necesario para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

Cidlia tiene 42 años de edad, vive con su esposo y tiene dos hijos que son estudiantes, quienes la ayudan en atender el negocio. Es una persona amable, positiva y trabajadora. Piensa que no hay barreras si uno tiene las ganas de hacer las cosas bien y salir adelante. Su meta es surtir más el negocio y comprar una casita para que no pague local y así poder apoyar a su esposo en la economía de la casa.
texts.en:
Señora Cidlia is a member of the community bank "Corazon de Jesus" (Heart of Jesus). She lives in the region of San Martín, in the province of Dorado, and in the district of San José de Sisa. She is dedicated to the sales of office supplies, ornaments, and cell phones. She complements this business with the sales of cosmetics from the brand of Esika. She began with a capital of 300 Soles in a rented site and worked with just a table, chair, and a display case. With the loan of 1300 Soles, which she will pay back in four months, she will buy talcs, deodorants, nail polishes, creams, dozens of glasses, cell phones, and other supplies that she needs to give her business a good boost and satisfy the needs of her clients. Cidlia is 42 years old. She lives with her husband and has two children who are students and help her with the business. She is a friendly, positive, and hard working person. She thinks that there are no barriers if one has the desire to do things well and move forward. Her goal is to increase her business and buy a little house so that she won't have to pay to rent her business space and in this way be able to support her husband in meeting the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy talcs, deodorants, nail polishes, creams, glasses, etc.

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina G. is 46 years old and a mother with four kids. Three of them are in school now and the eldest has completed university. She has been selling grocery products for five years on a table in her neighborhood to support her family. 
Faustina says business is doing well and she therefore wants to use this loan to buy more products to increase her inventory. Faustina believes the loan would help her increase her savings towards the welfare of her two children who are in school now. She is a member of the group called 'Nyame ye odo'. Members in the group agree in unison to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products like tinned fish, tinned tomatoes, cocoa products, skimmed milk, vegetable oil, etc.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo es productor de queso de leche de vaca (vende su producto a La Paz),  también hace labor de MINKA (ofrece sus servicios de agricultor a otras personas a cambio de dinero y parte de los productos) Vive la Comunidad de Palomar a dos horas y media de la Ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito sera usado para comprar una vaca de mediana calidad, él quiere generar mayores ingresos económicos.
 
Es su primer crédito con Impro, es apto para recibir el dinero
texts.en:
Lorenzo is a producer of cheese made from cow milk (he sells his product in La Paz). He also does labor for MINKA (he offers his agricultural services to other people in exchange for money and part of the products). He lives in the community of Palomar, two and a half hours from the city of La Paz. The loan will be used to buy a cow of medium quality; he wants to generate greater economic income. It is his first loan with IMPRO. He is well suited to receive the money.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Mademoiselle Fatoumata D. N° 2 est âgée de 36 ans et vit dans une famille monogame avec un enfant dans le quartier attbougou un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Pour des raisons sociales elle abandonna prématurément l’école. Après s’être s’essayé à plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus sans succès, elle finit par apprendre auprès de sa grande mère le secret de la fabrication de l’encens (déodorant traditionnel). Après sa phase d’apprentissage, depuis maintenant 10 ans, elle exerce cette activité et jouit aujourd’hui d’une notoriété d’envergure sous régionale. Elle reçoit des commandes de toute la sous région de l’Afrique de l’ouest (Burkina Faso et Côte d’ivoire). Pour avoir de l’encens de qualité (c’est-à-dire avoir une bonne odeur), il faut du magnonkisèni (plante exotique très prisée en Afrique de l’ouest) assaisonné à des parfums et à l’eau de Cologne pendant un mois.
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus importante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans.
Après 4 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) tous correctement bien remboursés, elle est à son premier prêt individuel.
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt : 30Kg de graine d’encens (magnonkisèni), 70Kg de Kèni (encens naturel), 15 cartons de parfums (y compris l’eau de Cologne) et des bouteilles vides. Elle s’approvisionne en matières premières essentiellement au grand marché de la ville de Ségou et vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes du Mali et des pays voisins. Elle est sollicitée lors des mariages car sa marchandise est très prisée par les nouveaux mariés.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter le fonds de commerce. Son ambition est de se construire une maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatoumata D. I. is 36 years old and lives in a monogamous family with one child in the area of Attbougou, one of the outlying areas of the city of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali). For social reasons, she left school early. After attempting many profit-generating businesses without success, her grandmother taught her the secret art of incense (traditional deodorant) production. She finished her apprenticeship and for the last 10 years has practiced this business. Today, she enjoys the benefits of a good reputation on a regional scale. She receives orders from all over the sub-region of West Africa (Burkina Faso, Côte d'Ivoire). To make a good quality incense with a pleasant smell requires magnonkisèni, an exotic plant highly valued in West Africa, to be seasoned with perfumes and eau de Cologne for one month. To satisfy her growing clientele, she decided two years ago to join Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. After four joint group loans all which were properly repaid, she has requested her first individual loan. With this loan she plans to purchase 30 kg of incense seed (magnonkisèni), 70 kg of Kèni (natural incense), 15 boxes of perfume (including eau de Cologne) and empty bottles. She gets her supplies mostly from the large market in the city of Ségou and sells her product for cash or on credit to a clientele composed mainly of women and men from Mali and neighboring countries. When weddings take place she is in very high demand due to the fact that her product is highly valued by newlyweds. She plans to earn a monthly income of 50,000 FCFA which will be used mainly to increase her business capital. Her dream is to build a new home.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of raw materiels for incense production

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena A. is a 41 year old woman. She is married and the mother of seven kids. Through hard work, Abena has supported three children in finishing high school. She is a food vendor who sells kenkey in her neighborhood. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grain, which is cooked and then mixed with hot pepper and fried fish. She has lots of customers, because many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey for breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. She hopes to raise more income to support her first child entering university. She belongs to the community group called 'Nyame ye odo' Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another and provide assistance to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.es:
La señora Crecencia, socia del BC “DORADINAS EN ACCION”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia del Dorado y distrito de San José de Sisa. Se dedica a la venta de chupetes y ya tiene buen tiempo en esta actividad. Aprovecha el tipo de clima de la zona para ofertar sus productos, cuenta con una congeladora que le permite almacenar buena cantidad de chupetes por que tiene un personal que vende en las escuelas de su distrito.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual pagará en 04 meses comprará insumos para la preparación de sus chupetes como: azúcar en saco, bolsitas y vasitos para chupetes, colorantes y frutas para la elaboración de sus chupetes, además quiere comprar calaminas, clavos en kilos para calamina,  fierros y palos para techo. Desea mejorar su casa para darle una mejor seguridad a sus cosas.

Crecencia tiene 50 años de edad, 8 hijos, los cuales ya son independientes. Ahora vive con su esposo, quien la apoya en algunas actividades. Ella es una persona amable y trabajadora con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Su meta es tener una bodega en su casa para solventar sus gastos y tener una vejez tranquila.
texts.en:
Señora Crecencia, member of the community bank "Doradinas en Accion", lives in the region San Martín, in the province of Dorado, in the district of San José de Sisa. She is dedicated to selling popsicles and is now having a good time with this activity. She takes advantage of the type of climate of the region to offer her products. She works with a freezer that allows her to keep a good quantity of popsicles, which is why she can sell them in the school districts. With the loan of 1500 Soles, which she will pay back in four months, she will buy ingredients for the preparation of her popsicles like: sugar, little bags and little cups for popsicles, food colorings, and fruits, for the production of her popsicles, and she also wants to buy corrugated iron, nails for corrugated iron, iron and poles for her roof. She wants to improve her house and make these things more secure. Crecencia is 50 years old, has eight children, who are already independent. Now she lives with her husband, who supports her in some of the activities. She is a friendly and hard working person with strong desires to move forward in life. Her goal is to have store in her house, to settle her finances, and to have a peaceful old age.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients like sugar, little bags and little cups, food coloring, and fruits.

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence O. is 41 years old and a married mother with two kids. All the kids are currently in school. She has been selling cooked rice for school  children and other workers in her town for the past six years.  Many people buys from her stand, especially in the morning and in the afternoons because of its good taste and affordable price. With the loan, she wants to buy more bags of rice , vegetables, eggs and assorted meat to expand her operation. She is a member of the group called ‘Yesu ne manidaso’.  meaning "God is my hope" Members in this group agree to guarantee and support one another to repay the loan. Florence was at work when her photo was taken.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, vegetables, cooking oil and assorted meat etc.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa es productora de leche de vaca, percibe un sueldo quincenal por la venta de la leche, además cultiva flores y verduras  las cuales son vendidas en diferentes ferias de la ciudad de La Paz.

Tiene casa propia y vive con su hija en la población de Palomar (Rio abajo).

El crédito sera usado para adquirir una vaca lechera ya que desea incrementar sus ventas.
 
Es su primer crédito con Impro, califica para obtener el prestamo .
texts.en:
Luisa is a milk cow producer. She perceives a fortnightly salary for the sales of the milk, also she cultivates flowers and vegetables which are sold in different fairs of the city of La Paz. She has her own house and she lives with his daughter in the city of Palomar. The loan will be used to acquire a dairy cow since she wants to increase her sales. This is her first loan with Impro, she qualifies to obtain the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es:
La señora Damaris, es socia del Banco Comunal “LOS EUCALIPTOS”, vive en el  departamento y Provincia de San Martín, Distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a prestar servicio de lavado de autos, mototaxis y motos lineales que requieren de este servicio. El local esta en su domicilio, el cual está situado en el Jr. Augusto B. Leguía  Nº 794, lugar donde acuden sus clientes. 

Los motivos que tuvo para iniciarse en esta actividad fue el factor económico en vista que está estudiando y tiene que solventar sus gastos.

Con el préstamo de S/. 800, el cual pagará en 6 meses, invertirá en la compra de detergentes en bolsas grandes, mangueras para tener un buen stock y poder atender bien a sus clientes, refiere que comprando en cantidad es más rentable.

Tiene 27 años, vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo, quien la motiva y le da fuerzas y ganas de seguir trabajando. Una de sus metas es llegar a tener un óleo centro bien implementado.
texts.en:
Señora Damaris is a member of the community bank "Los Eucaliptos." She lives in the province of San Martín, in the district of Tarapoto. She is dedicated to offering the service of car washing for cars, motorcycle taxis, and regular motorcycles. The business is in her home, which is located at Jr. Augusto B. Leguía Nº 794, a place where her clients come. Her motives for beginning this business was the economic factor because she was studying and had to settle her costs. With the loan of 800 soles, which she will pay back in six months, she will invest in purchasing detergents in bulk and water hoses in order to better serve her clients, who advised her that buying in bulk is more profitable. She is 27 years old, lives with her husband, and her little son, who motivates her and gives her the power to continue working. One of her goals is to have an oil change center set up.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy detergents in bulk and water hoses

loans.name: Malvina

texts.en:
Malvina D. is married and has three kids. She lives with her family in Obuasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She is 37 years old. She runs a clothing shop and has been selling jeans, blouses and skirts, women's slippers and dressing bags for the past seven years.

Malvina is constrained by insufficient funds to run the business. She needs this loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up her business progress. She believes the loan will help her to have resources to purchase good quality and large quantity to upgrade her inventory. She says she would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase jeans, ladies' wear, and slippers for re-sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Aicela

texts.es:
La Sra. Aicela ella tiene poco que adquirir su casa pero le está haciendo falta algunos acabados en el exterior y reparación al techo.

La Sra. Aicela es soltera y trabaja en una compañía de chofer de entregas productos en varias tiendas de la cuidad de Nuevo Laredo. Este es su ingreso familiar.

Ella en cuanto se entero que Fvp y kiva le podían ayudar a realizar su mejora más rápido y sin descapitalizarse inmediatamente acudió a las oficinas para solicitar un préstamo de $1,000.00 dlls para la reparación del techo y acabados de exterior de la casa.
texts.en:
Aicela has little left to do on her house, but it does still lack some finishing touches to the exterior and requires repairs to the ceiling.

Aicela is single and works in a company that offers product delivery services for various stores in the city of Nuevo Laredo. This represents her regular source of income.

As soon as she found out that field partner FVP and KIVA could help her to make the improvements quickly and without being undercapitalized, she immediately went to the offices to ask for a loan of $1,000.00 to complete ceiling repairs and exterior finishes to her house.


Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Exterior finishes and ceiling repair for the home.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Madame A. Abla est marié et mère de deux enfants à 40 ans. C’est une esthéticienne de formation qui s’est aussi spécialisé dans le métier de coiffeuse. Elle a ouvert depuis 2007 à son domicile un salon de coiffure AMAZONIE COIFFURE. Elle y a aussi associé la vente des produits cosmétiques, des pagnes et de mèches.
Cette association d’activités a donné un coup de pousse a son métier car elle a besoin d’un crédit pour augmenter son stock par l’achat de 5 cartons de mèche et 5 sachets de bijoux.
texts.en:
Mrs. Abla A., 40, is married and the mother of two children. She is a trained beautician who also specialized in hairdressing. In 2007 she opened in her house a beauty salon which she calls Amazonie Coiffure. At the same time, she sells cosmetics, pagnes (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth), and hair extensions.
