This constellation of business activities has given her salon a boost, and she now needs a loan to add to her stock by buying 5 cases of hair extensions and 5 sets of costume jewelry.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cosmetics, costume jewelry, and pagnes

loans.name: Martha Anselma

texts.es:
Martha es productora de leche de vaca, comercializa su producto a la empresa Delicia, también trabaja como pequeña agricultora de hortalizas junto con su madre  y sus dos hijos (estos productos son vendidos en la ciudad de La Paz). Vive en  la Comunidad de Palomar a dos horas y media de la Ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito sera usado para comprar una vaca de mediana calidad para incrementar su producción de leche y generar mayores ingresos económicos.
 
Es su primer crédito con Impro, esta calificada para obtener un préstamo.
texts.en:
Martha is a producer of cow milk. She sells her product to the business Delicia. She also works as a small farmer of vegetables together with her mother and her two children (these products are sold in the city of La Paz). She lives in the community of Palomar, two and a half hours from the city of La Paz. The loan will be used to buy a cow of medium quality to increase her production of milk and generate greater economic income. It is her first loan with IMPRO; she is qualified to obtain a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy a milk cow

loans.name: Dianith

texts.es:
La señora Dianith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS BRISAS”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia y distrito de Bellavista. Se dedica a la venta de hielo y chupetes en su propio domicilio, en  jr Ancash 3er piso, donde espera a sus clientes para darles una buena atención.

Dianith se dedica a este negocio desde hace 3 años gracias a la iniciativa de su prima. Se inició por necesidad, ya que tenia que apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Gracias al factor climático (calor) y por la amabilidad que ella tiene con sus clientes sus ventas se incrementaron en los últimos tiempos.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará bolsitas para chupetes y hielo, frutas de diferentes variedades, azúcar en saco, vainilla,  saborizantes y otros insumos  que necesita para surtir su negocio y asegurar las ventas. También, debido a que cultiva maíz, piensa invertir en su chacra.    

Dianith tiene 26 años, vive con su esposo y su menor hijo, es una mujer muy entusiasta y trabajadora. Su meta es llegar a tener un negocio de abarrotes bien implementado y surtido donde quiere dar mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dianith belongs to the “Las Brisas” comunal bank and lives in San Martín Region, in the Province and District of Bellavista. She sells ice and popsicles from her home in jr Ancash, 3rd floor, where she waits on her customers attentively.

Dianith has been working in this business for 3 years, thanks to an invitation from her cousin. She started the business due to necessity, since she needed to help her husband with the household expenses. Thanks to the climate (it’s hot) and her friendly manner toward her customers, her sales have increased in the last few seasons.

With the loan of S/. 1,000.00, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy bags for the popsicles and ice, a variety of fruits, sugar in sacks, vanilla, flavorings and other ingredients she needs to stock her business and ensure sales. Also, because she grows corn, she plans to invest in her land.

Dianith is 26 years old, lives with her husband and youngest child. She is a very enthusiastic and hard-working woman. Her goal is to someday have a well run, well-stocked small grocery store where she can give the best service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase goods for her store.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace O. started her local restaurant twenty years ago in Dunkwah, a suburb of Obuasi, where she lives. Since then, she has become one of the most popular food vendors in her neighborhood. She is now 53 years old, married with eight children, of whom four are currently in school.

Grace serves many kinds of local dishes like fufu, rice balls, and banku, among others. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, taken with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. She is with the community group called Partners Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access a loan and peer pressure to repay the loan. Grace is in the photograph taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantains, meat, fish and firewood

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La señora Dominga, socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen del Pilar”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Lamas, distrito de Zapatero y caserío de Nuevo Celendin. Se dedica a la venta y cría de pollos y cuyes para luego venderlos a las personas que lo solicitan (en el caso de los cuyes), los pollos los distribuyen en las bodegas y pueblos cercanos. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 800, el cual pagará en 6 meses, invertirá en la compra de alimentos de inicio, engorde, acabado, vacunas y maíz, para alimentar a los pollos para luego sacarlos a vender a sus clientes.

Dominga tiene 58 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo, quien la apoya bastante en este trabajo. Es una mujer optimista y trabajadora. Su meta es crecer en el negocio.
texts.en:
Dominga is a member of the “Virgen del Pilar” comunal bank. She lives in San Martin Region, Lamas Province, Zapatero district, in the small town of Nuevo Celendin. She raises chickens and guinea pigs and then sells them to people who ask for them (in the case of the guinea pigs). She sells the chickens to small grocery stores and in nearby small towns. With the loan of S/. 800.00, which she will repay in 6 months, she will invest in starter feed, fattening feed, finishing feed, vaccines and corn. This will be used to feed the chickens so that she can later sell them to her customers. Doming is 58 years old, lives with her husband and son, who help her a lot with work. She is an optimistic and hard-working woman. Her goal is to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy feed

loans.name: Mayde

texts.es:
Mayde es productora de leche de vaca y pequeña agricultora de hortalizas (trabaja con la ayuda de hijo mayor de 14 años), sul esposo migró hacia la Republica de Argentina para poder trabajar de costurero (envía dinero mensualmente para mantener a sus tres hijos). Mayde vive en la Comunidad de Palomar a dos horas y media de la Ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito sera usado para comprar una vaca de mediana calidad, su intención es generar mayores ingresos económicos.
 
Es su primer crédito con Impro, esta calificada para obtener el préstamo
texts.en:
Mayde is a small vegetable farmer and processes cows' milk (she works with help from her 14 year old son). Her husband migrated to Argentina to work sewing (he sends money monthly to maintain their 3 kids). Mayde lives in the Community of Palomar, two and a half hours from the city of La Paz.

The credit will be used to buy a medium quality cow and her intention is to generate more economic income.

This is her first credit with Impro, and she is qualified to get a loan.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a milk-giving cow/COMPRA DE VACA LECHERA

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana D. is divorced and has two kids. She lives with her family in Dunkwa, a suburb of Obuasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She is 43 years old. She runs a clothing shop and has been selling jeans, blouses and skirts, women's slippers, and dressing bags for the past seven years.

Diana is constrained by insufficient funds to run her business. She needs this loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up her business progress. She believes the loan will help her have resources to purchase good quality and large quantity to upgrade her inventory. She says she would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase jeans, ladies' wear, and slippers

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa A. is a 30-year-old married woman with three children who are all in school. Yaa sells frozen foods in the local market, but she says profits from sales is very low because she pays high rent on the store she operates from. She wants to use the loan to buy more cartons of frozen foods to enable her to raise enough income to build a permanent store for herself. She is a member of the group called Amen. Members in this group agree to guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, mutton, etc

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es:
El Sr. Mario S. acaba de recibir su casa pero le está haciendo falta los protecciones para poder  vivir en ella para que su hijo y esposa tengo un lugar seguro donde estar ya que están viviendo en casa de la mama de su esposa, y su esposa está a punto de dar a luz un nuevo integrante a la familia  y el quiere ya estar en su nueva casa cunado llegue su nuevo hijo.
 El Trabaja en una compañía de refrescos en el aria de repartidor y ventas esté es el ingreso de su familia. Por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para pagar las protecciones de su casa.
El Sr. Mario se acerco a las oficinas de pedir información sobre nuestros créditos y le pareció excelente saber que excite una compañía como Kiva que le puede ayudar a mejorar su vivienda para darle una mejor vida a su familia.
 Mario esta solicitando un préstamo de $425.00 dlls para la colocación de las protecciones a su casa
texts.en:
Mario S. is the new owner of a house that is lacking a protective fence. Mario needs the protective fence to be able to live securely in his new home with his wife and son. They are currently living in his mother-in-law's house, with his wife on the verge of giving birth. He would like to already be living in his new home when his second child is born. Mario works for a refreshment company as a distributor, and his sales constitute his family's income. At the moment, he does not have sufficient funds to pay for a fence for his house. Mario approached the FVP offices to solicit information about our loans. He thought it was excellent to find out that a company like FVP exists that can help him to improve his house to give his family a better life. Mario is requesting a loan of $425 to build a protective fence around his house.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a protective fence.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Rene es productor de leche de vaca,  percibe un sueldo quincenal por la venta de la leche, además cultiva choclo, el cual comercializarÁ en el mes de octubre que es la temporada para la cosecha. 

Vive solo en casa propia (Palomar).
 
Con el monto del crédito adquirirá una vaca lechera ya que desea incrementar sus ventas de leche.
 
Es su primer crédito con Impro pero es apto para recibir el préstamo.
texts.en:
Rene is a producer of cow's milk; he receives biweekly pay for milk sales. He also cultivates corn, which he will sell in October, the month of the harvest. He lives alone in his own house in Palomar, Bolivia. With loan proceeds he will buy a milk cow since he wishes to increase milk sales. This is his first loan with field partner IMPRO, but he is a good candidate to receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena D. is 60 years old, a wife and mother of four children. Only one of them is in school now. She has been selling grocery products for ten years in the town to support her family. She says business is doing well and she therefore wants to use this loan to buy more products to increase her inventory.

Abena believes this loan would help her increase her savings towards the welfare of her last child who is in school still. She is a member of the group called Anointed Ladies. Members in this group agree in unison to guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products like tinned fish, tinned tomatoes, cocoa products, skimmed milk, body pomade, etc.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr:
Monsieur T. Komlan est né à Notsè en 1984. Il est célibataire sans enfant. C’est un jeune homme très actif qui veut a tout prix réussir dans la vie. L’activité qui lui a toujours passionné est le commerce. Il s’y lança alors en 2007 en vendant les chaussures.
C’est bientôt la rentrée scolaire, et les parents d’élève se procurent des chaussures pour leurs enfants. A cet effet il décida d’augmenter son stock pour répondre à la demande à venir.
texts.en:
Mr. Komlan TSALE was born in Notsè in 1984. He is unmarried and has no children. He is a very active young man who wants to succeed in life at any cost. The career that has always inspired him passionately was commerce. He therefore entered the field in 2007 by becoming a seller of shoes. Soon the school year will start again, and the students' parents will buy shoes for their children. As a result, he has decided to increase his stock to respond to the upcoming demand.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell shoes

loans.name: Erica

texts.es:
La señora Erica pertenece al BC “María Auxiliadora”, vive en la Región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de refrigerios, como jugos de frutas naturales y sándwiches, en el frontis de su domicilio situado en el LR. Alfonso Ugarte Nº 947, lugar donde acuden sus clientes por ser calle principal de la ciudad.
 
En estos últimos meses el negocio ha aumentado gracias al clima y la buena atención. Los clientes son sus vecinos, estudiantes, motocarristas entre otros, quienes acuden todas las mañanas para disfrutar de los jugos de diferentes frutas y sándwiches de jamón, queso y huevo que oferta diariamente.

 Con el préstamo de S/. 600, el cual pagará en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de frutas para la preparación de los jugos como: papaya, naranja, manzana, guineos, maracuyá, betarraga, azúcar en saco, panes, huevo, jamón y queso. También comprará vasos descartables, servilletas, sorbetes, entre otros, para dar una buena atención a sus clientes.

Tiene 27 años, es una mujer muy optimista, sobre todo muy trabajadora, su meta es llegar a tener un local propio para instalar mejor y bien implementado su negocio de refrigerio.
texts.en:
Erica belongs to the Community Bank 'Maria Auxiliadora' and she lives in the region and province of San Martin, in the district of Tarapoto. She sells cold food and drink like natural fruit juices and sandwiches from the front of her house in the LR. Allfonso Ugarte No 947 is where she goes to get her clients as it is the main street in the city.

In the last few months the business has been growing thanks to the climate and the attention she's been getting. Her clients are neighbors, students and bikers among others, and they come to her every morning to enjoy the different fruit juices and ham, cheese and egg sandwiches that she offers daily.

With the loan of $600 which she will repay over a period of 4 months, she will invest in buying fruit to make juice such as: papayas, oranges, apples, 'guineos' (green bananas), passion fruit, beetroots, sacks of sugar, bread, eggs, ham and cheese. She will also buy throw-away cups, napkins, sorbet amongst other things to serve her clients well.

She is 27 years old and is a very optimistic woman and, more than anything, she is very hard working. Her aim is to install and stock out her own store to sell cold foods and drinks.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits like papayas, oranges, apples, passion fruit, sugar, bread, eggs, ham, cheese etc/Compra de frutas como papaya, naranja, manzana, maracuyá, azúcar, panes, huevo, jamón, queso, etc.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
La señora Esther, socia del Banco Comunal “Maria Auxiliadora”, vive en el Departamento y Provincia de San Martín, Distrito de Tarapoto. Se inició vendiendo carteras de suelas, broches, marroquí, y ropa interior, para ello salía con todos sus hijos a vender.

Ahora confecciona y vende al por mayor ropa interior para damas, caballeros y niños. La mercadería lo distribuye en diversas ciudades del departamento a los negociantes minoristas, también alquila cuartos. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará telas de diferentes colores, hilos, agujas, elásticos en fardo, para la elaboración de su mercadería, y así sus clientes tengan mayor opción para escoger.

Esther tiene 57 años, es una mujer optimista y trabajadora y muy hábil para el negocio que aprovechó sus ganancias para aumentar el negocio y la red de distribución. Tiene como meta el mejorar y aumentar su casa para tener un local propio para su negocio.
texts.en:
Esther, a member of the Community Bank 'Maria Auxiliadora', lives in the department and province of San Martin, in the district of Tarapoto. She started selling leather wallets, broaches and underwear and because of that she goes out with all her children to sell.

She now makes and sells women's, men's and children's underwear. She distributes this merchandise in the different cities in the department to small businessmen. She also rents out rooms.

With the loan of $2000 which she will repay over a period of 6 months, she will buy different colored materials, threads, needles, bundles of elastic to make her merchandise so that her clients will have more to choose from.

Esther is 57 years old and is an optimistic, hard working woman who is very skilled at her job and took advantage of her earnings to enlarge her business and distribution network. Her aim is to improve and enlarge her house to have her own store for her business.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy material, thread, needles and elastic/Compra de telas, hilos, agujas, elásticos.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalia es una joven emprendedora de 19 años de edad. Produce y comercializa hortalizas junto a sus hermanos menores, también se dedica a la producción de leche de vaca (tanto las verduras como la leche son vendidas en la ciudad de La Paz). Sus padres son de la tercera edad y no pueden ayudarla, vive en la Comunidad de Palomar a dos horas y media de la Ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito sera destinado para comprar una vaca de mediana calidad
 
Es sul primer crédito con Impro, esta calificada para obtener un préstamo
texts.en:
Rosalia is an enterprising, young 19-year-old. She produces and sells vegetables alongside her younger siblings. She also works in milk production. The milk and vegetables alike are sold in the city of La Paz. Her parents are advanced in age and cannot assist her. She lives in the Palomar community, 2 1/2 hours from the city of La Paz. The loan proceeds will be used to purchase a medium grade cow. This is Rosalia's first loan with field partner IMPRO; she is qualified to be granted a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow.

loans.name: Euloli

texts.es:
La señora Euloli, socia del Banco Comunal “LAS BRISAS”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Bellavista. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes desde hace 7 años. El negocio está ubicado en su propio domicilio, Jr. Nva esperanza donde acuden diariamente a comprar los clientes que son los vecinos del su barrio y personas particulares.

Con el préstamo de S/. 800, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, aceite, leche grande y pequeño en caja,  fideos, papel higiénico, sal en paquetes, sillao, gaseosas de diferentes marcas, tamaños y sabores, sardinas, para surtir bien el negocio y asegurar las ventas, como también satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes.

Euloli, es una mujer trabajadora, carismática. Tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo y sus 02 hijos, quienes la apoyan en sus momentos libres. Su meta es llegar a tener una tienda de abarrotes y poder vender al por mayor y menor.
texts.en:
Euloli is a member of Las Brisas Community Bank. She lives in San Martin region, in the province and district of Bellavista. Euloli has been a grocer for 7 years. Her business is located in her own home at Jr. Nueva Esperanza. Her clients -- her neighbors and other individuals -- come to the shop every day to make purchases. With a loan of 800 soles (approximately $275), which will be paid back in 6 months, Euloli plans to purchase basic cooking and household products such as rice; sugar; oil; large- and small-size boxed milk; noodles; toilet paper; salt packets; soy sauce; soft drinks of different brands, sizes and flavors; and sardines. These purchases will keep store is well stocked, insure sales and meet the needs of her clients. Euloli is a hard-working and charismatic woman. She is 42 years old and lives with her husband and their two children, who help out in their spare time. Euloli's goal is to own a grocery store and to sell both in bulk and small quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of basic cooking and household products: rice, sugar, oil, noodles, toilet paper, salt, etc.

loans.name: Sergio Natalio

texts.es:
Sergio es productor de leche de vaca, esta es comercializada en la población para la producción de queso, percibe un sueldo quincenal por dichas ventas, tambien cultiva maiz (producto a comercializarse en el mes de octubre, temporada de cosecha). 

Vive solo en casa propia (ubicada en la población de Palomar).

El crédito será destinado para comprar una vaca lechera ya que desea incrementar su producción 
 
Es su primer crédito con Impro, esta calificado para obtener un préstamo.
texts.en:
Sergio is a milk cow producer. The milk is commercialized in town for the production of cheese. He perceives a fortnightly salary for such sales. He also cultivates corn ( which is commercialized in October during the crop period). He lives alone at his own house located in the city of Palomar. The loan will be used to buy a dairy cow since he wants to increase his milk production. This is his first loan with Impro, and he is qualified to obtain the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Evila

texts.es:
La señora Evila es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen del Pilar”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia Lamas, distrito Zapatero y Centro Poblado de Nuevo Celendin. Se dedica a la siembra y venta de uva, plátano, yuca, fréjol, cacao y maíz, productos que son vendidos en la ciudad de Tarapoto y en su misma comunidad. 

Evila comenzó con el negocio desde hace 3 años, antes se dedicaba a la venta de ropa, pero no le generaba muchas ganancias por la cual decidió cambiar de actividad y dedicarse a las labores de la chacra junto a su esposo y dicha producción saca al mercado.

Con el préstamo de S/  800, el cual pagará en 6 meses, invertirá en la compra de semillas de frijoles, maíz para sembrarlos en su chacra, además comprará insecticidas y abono para mantener su parral de uvas, también pagará la mano de obra de peones quienes ayudaran en este trabajo.

Evila, tiene 44 años, es una mujer segura y trabajadora con muchas ganas de seguir creciendo. Su meta es terminar su casa y poner un negocio en ella.
texts.en:
Mrs. Evila is a member of the Virgen del Pilar village bank. She lives in the Nuevo Celendin neighborhood, Zapatero district, in Lamas, San Martin, Peru. She works growing and selling grapes, plantains, yucca, beans, cocoa and corn; products which she sells in the nearby city of Tarapoto and in her community. Evila started her business 3 years ago; before she worked selling clothing but it didn't generate much income, so she decided to switch to working her land with her husband and selling their crops in the market. With this $275 loan which she will repay in 6 months, she will invest in the purchase of bean and corn seeds to cultivate these crops on her land; she will also purchase insecticides and fertilizer for her grape vineyard, and pay for laborers to help work the land. Evila is 44 years old, and a very confident and hard-working woman with great desire to move forward. Her goal is to finish her house and put a small business in it.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bean and corn seeds, insecticides, and fertilizer

loans.name: Soledad Pacesa

texts.es:
Soledad es productora de leche de vaca, la cual es comercializada en la población para la producción de queso, percibe un sueldo quincenal por la venta de dicho producto, además cultiva lechuga, acelga, toronjil (todas estas verduras son comercializadas en el mercado Rodríguez de la ciudad de La Paz jueves y sábados). Así ayuda a sus padres y sus hermanos. 

Vive en casa de sus padres junto a sus hermanos en la población de Palomar.
 
El crédito sera invertido en una vaca lechera, cree que ya es hora de aumentar las ventas.
 
Es su primer crédito con Impro, esta calificada para obtener un préstamo
texts.en:
Soledad produces cow's milk, which is sold to be used in cheesemaking. For this, she receives a biweekly income. She also grows lettuce, beets, and lemon balm, all of which are sold in the Rodríguez market in the city of La Paz on Thursdays and Saturdays. In this manner, she aids her parents and siblings. Soledad lives at home with her parents along with her siblings in the city of Palomar. The loan proceeds will be used to purchase a dairy cow because Soledad thinks that now is the time to increase sales. This is Soledad's first loan with field partner IMPRO; she is qualified to be granted a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
La señora Flor D. María, D. especialidad técnica en enfermería y jubilada en ESSALUD, es socia del Banco Comunal “Nuestra señora D. la Paz”. Vive en la Región y provincia D. San Martín, distrito D. Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta D.  juanes y comidas, además complementa el negocio con la venta D. aves D. corral y aves silvestres. El negocio lo realiza en su domicilio, ubicado en el Jr. Leoncio Prado c-6, sus clientes principales son los estudiantes D. la universidad y turistas que visitan la ciudad. Ya tiene bastante tiempo en esta actividad y le va muy bien. 

Con el préstamo D. S/. 3,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará  sacos D. arroz, azúcar, aceite en galones, verduras y carne del diario, también comprará alimentos para los animales menores que cría en su domicilio y tenerlos aptos par al venta cuando sus clientes lo requieran.

Flor D. María, tiene 69 años y 5 hijos todos ya independientes, ahora vive con su esposo, quien la apoya en el negocio. Se siente muy orgullosa D. lo que ha logrado porque es fruto D. su esfuerzo y dedicación constante. Su meta es terminar D. arreglar su casa y acondicionar un ambiente para dar mayor comodidad  a sus clientes y así obtener mayor ganancia y nuevamente invertir.
texts.en:
Mrs. Flor D. Maria, a technical nursing specialist and retiree from ESSALUD, is a member of the Nuestra Senora D. la Paz (Our Holy Mother of Peace) village bank. She lives in Tarapoto, San Martin, Peru. She works selling juanes (a typical rice dish from the selva) and other prepared foods; on the siD., she also sells wild and domesticated chickens. She works out of her home located on Leoncio Prado Street; her customers are generally university students and tourists that visit the city. She has worked in this business for years and it is going very well for her. With this $1,025 loan which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase bags of rice, sugar, vegetable oil, vegetables, and meat; she will also purchase feed for the chickens that she raises in her home so that they are ready for sale when her customers want them. Flor D. Maria is 69 years old and has 5 adult children. She lives with her husband who helps her in her business. She is very proud of what she has achieved because it is the fruit of her effort and constant dedication. Her goal is to finish her home and create a better environment to attend to her customers in order to earn a greater income, and re-invest in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, oil, vegetables, and feed for small animals

loans.name: Flor Elisa

texts.es:
La señora Flor Elisa, socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valerosas II”, vive en el Departamento y Provincia de San Martín,  Distrito de Tarapoto, se dedica a  la venta de  productos de belleza y salchipapa, su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el AA.HH. Nueva Esperanza Mz “B”- Lt. 15,  sus clientes son los vecinos de su barrio.
 
Con el préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará productos  para su negocio como papas, pollos, cremas (Ketchup, mostaza), también invertirá en productos de belleza en oferta como perfumes para damas caballeros y niños, desodorantes, joyas, esmaltes, lociones, etc., para surtir el negocio y pueda tener mayor ganancia y volver a invertir nuevamente.

Tiene 21 años, vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien la motiva en lo que ella emprende, siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer decidida y trabajadora. Su meta es ampliar y seguir creciendo con el negocio y llegar a ser una micrompresaria.
texts.en:
Mrs. Flor Elisa, member of the Mujeres Valerosas II (Valiant Women) village bank, lives in Tarapoto in the district of San Martin, Peru. She sells beauty products and hot dogs in her business which she runs out of her own home in the Nueva Esperanza (New Hope) neighborhood. Her customers are primarily her neighbors. With this $425 loan which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase products for her business like potatoes, chicken, ketchup and mustard; she will also invest in beauty products like perfumes, colognes, deodorants, jewels, enamels, lotions, etc. to resupply her store and help her to earn a greater income which she will re-invest. She is 21 years old and lives with her husband and small son. Her husband supports her in all she sets out to do; she has always stood out for being a hard-working, decisive woman. Her goal is to continue to grow her business and become a small businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Gloria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Aguerridas II”, vive en la Región y Provincia San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de Salchipapas, pollo broster, arroz chaufa y refrescos, vende frente a su casa, el cual está ubicado en el Jr: Ramón Castilla Nº 227, lugar donde acuden diariamente sus comensales, los cuales son moradores de su barrio y visitantes de otros lugares. 

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará un licuo extractor, mesas, sillas, cremas como salsa de tomate, mostaza en baldes, huevos y otros insumos que necesita para la preparación de los alimentos que a diario oferta a sus clientes.

En estos últimos tiempos se incrementaron las ventas gracias al trato amable, higiene, sazón y un local acogedor.

Gloria, de 51 años, es una mujer decidida, alegre y buena administradora. Tiene como meta implementar el negocio con más mesas y sillas,  porque su clientela va en aumento.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria, a member of the Las Aguerridas II (The Veternas) village bank, lives in Tarapoto, San Martin, Peru. She sells hot dog dishes, roasted chicken, fried rice, and drinks; she sells from the front of her home on Ramon Castilla Street. Her daily customers are primarily her neighbors and visitors from other places. With this $350 loan which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase a liquid extractor, tables, chairs, ketchup, mustard, eggs, and other ingredients that she needs for the preparation of the food she offers to her customers. Lately, her sales have increased due to her friendly treatment of customers, the cleanliness of her locale, and the great taste of her food. Gloria is 51 years old and a determined, happy woman who is a good manager of her business. Her goal is to add tables and chairs to her store since her clientele is increasing.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of assets (liquid extractor, tables, chairs) condiments, and other ingredients

loans.name: Grimaneza

texts.es:
La señora Grimanesa, socia del Banco Comunal “Doradinas en acción”, vive en el Departamento de San Martín, provincia de El Dorado, distrito de San José de Sisa. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, el negocio está ubicado en su propio domicilio en el Jr. Tacna  Nº 121. Los clientes son las personas que viven por su barrio y turistas que visitan la localidad.
 
Con el préstamo de S/.500, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará diversos productos para surtir el negocio como:  jabón de diferentes marcas (Marsella, bolívar, jumbo, etc.), papel higiénico en paquetes, conservas de pescado, aceite por litros, arroz, azúcar en sacos, lejía, detergentes, leche de diferentes marcas y tamaños, para ofertar a sus clientes.

Tiene 70 años, 4 hijos, quienes ya son profesionales e independientes. Siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer trabajadora y responsable con las labores asumidas. Desea mantener bien surtido el negocio, porque así se distrae y no se siente sola.
texts.en:
Mrs. Grimanesa, member of the Doradinas en accion (Golden Girls in action) village bank, lives in El Dorado, San Jose de Sisa in San Martin, Peru. She sells groceries out of her own home on Tacna Street. Her customers are primarily her neighbors and tourists that visit the city. With this $175 loan which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase various products to supply her business such as different brands of soap (Marsella, Bolivar, Jumbo, etc.), toilet paper in packages, fish preserves, vegetable oil, rice, sugar, bleach, detergent, and different brands and sizes of milk to sell to customers. She is 70 years old with 4 adult children who are professionals. She has always stood out for being a hard-working, responsible woman in all of her undertakings. She hopes to maintain a well-supplied store to keep her focused and from feeling lonely.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products like soap, toilet paper, fish preserves, oil, etc.

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
La señora Hermelinda, socia del Banco Comunal “Corazón D. Jesús”, vive en el Departamento D. San Martín, provincia D. El Dorado, distrito D. San José D. Sisa. Se dedica a la venta D. ladrillo y abarrotes. El negocio está ubicado en su propio domicilio en el Jr. Santiago Pérez s/n cdra 04, caserío san isidro. Los clientes son las personas que viven alrededor D. su barrio y D. la localidad.


Con el préstamo D. S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará leña  en gran cantidad, combustible para la elaboración D. los ladrillos, además comprará productos para surtir el negocio como aceite por litros, arroz, azúcar, lejía, detergente, leche D. diferentes marcas y tamaños, para así tener surtido el negocio y satisfacer las necesidades D. los clientes.


Tiene 35 años, 2 hijos, quienes están estudiando, junto con su esposo comparten la atención en el negocio. Siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer  trabajadora y responsable con las labores asumidas. Desea en el futuro ampliar el negocio, quiere vender al por mayor, llegar a tener su distribuidora D. estos productos y abastecer a toda la zona  donD. vive.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is a member of the Community Bank 'Corazon D. Jesus' (Heart of Jesus) and she lives in the department of San Martin, in the province of El Dorado, in the district of San Jose D. Sisa. She sells bricks and groceries. Her business is located in her own home in the Jr. Santiago Pérez s/n cdra 04m in the hamlet of San Isidro. Her clients live around her in her neighborhood and local area.

With the loan of $1000 which she will repay over a period of 4 months she will buy firewood in large quantities, fuel to make bricks as well as products to stock out her business like oil by the liter, rice, sugar, bleach, detergent, milk of different labels and sizes to stock out her store and satisfy her clients' needs.

She is 35 years old and has 2 kids who are studying. Together with her husband they share looking after the business. She has always stood out for being a hard working and responsible woman who has taken on labors. In the future she wants to enlarge her business and sell in bulk, have her own distributor of these products and to supply to the whole zone where she lives.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood, fuel, oil, rice, sugar, bleach, detergent etc/Compra de leña, combustible, aceite, arroz, azúcar, lejía, detergente, etc.

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es:
La Señora Ingrid, socia del Banco Comunal “Maria Auxiliadora”, vive en la región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de pasamanería en general y ropa. El negocio lo realiza en el puesto de venta que tiene en el mercado “Las Palmeritas Nº 01”, de la ciudad donde acuden  diariamente los clientes para adquirir sus productos.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 06 meses, comprará  productos como relojes de diferentes marcas y modelos para damas, caballeros y niños, sandalias también de diferentes tallas modelos y colores, calculadoras, ropas para damas, caballeros y niños, para surtir el negocio y cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes.

Ingrid tiene 24 años, se considera una mujer muy entusiasta y trabajadora. La  meta en el futuro es contar con un local mas amplio para surtir bien el negocio, quiere que sus clientes se sientan cómodos y a gusto cuando la visiten.
texts.en:
Ingrid, a member of the Community Bank 'Maria Auxiliadora', lives in the region and province of San Martin, in the district of Tarapoto. She sells general tassels and braids, and clothes. She sells from her market stall in the market 'Las Palmeritas Nº 01' in the city where most of her clients come from daily to buy her products.

With the loan of $1000, which she will repay over a period of 6 months, she will buy products like different makes and types of watch for women, men and children, as well as sandals of different makes and colors, calculators and women's, men's and kid's clothing to stock out her business and meet the needs of her clients.

Ingrid is 24 years old and she is considered to be an enthusiastic and hard working woman. Her aim in the future is to have a bigger store to stock her business out well, and she wants her clients to feel comfortable and pleased when they visit.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy watches, sandals, women's and men's clothing/Compra de relojes, sandalias, ropa para damas y caballeros, etc.

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es:
La Señora Isidora, socia del Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora de la Paz”, vive en la región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de relojes, pilas, calculadoras y correas para relojes. El puesto de venta está ubicado en el Jr. Lima c-5, frente al mercado Nº  02 de la ciudad,  también recorre los distritos donde hay ferias y fiestas patronales de los pueblos más cercanos, buscando vender más y aumentar sus ganancias.

Con el préstamo de S/.  2,000, el cual pagará en 06 meses, comprará relojes en gran cantidad de diferentes marcas y modelos para damas, caballeros y niños, también correas de diferentes colores y tamaños, además comprará accesorios para relojes como brazaletes, pilas de toda marca y calculadoras, etc. para surtir mas el negocio y satisfacer las necesidades y exigencias de los clientes.

Tiene 51 años y 1 hijo, el cual aún dependen de ella. Es una mujer decidida, positiva y muy trabajadora. Está contenta porque apoya en la economía de su hogar y su meta es tener un local con vitrinas para mostrar sus productos y evitar el polvo.
texts.en:
Isidora, a member of the Community Bank 'Nuestra Senora de la Paz' (Our Lady of Peace), lives in the region and province of San Martin, in the district of Tarapoto. For 8 years she has sold watches, batteries, calculators and watch straps. Her stall is in the Jr. Lima c-5 in front of the market No 2 of the city, and she also goes round the districts where there are different fetes and saints' festivals in the nearest towns, looking to sell more and increase her earnings.

With the loan of $2000 which she will repay over a period of 6 months, she will bulk buy watches of different makes and models for women, men and kids. She will also buy different colored watch straps of different sizes as well as buying accessories for watches like bracelets, all makes of battery and calculators etc to stock out her business more and meet the needs and demands of her clients.

She is 51 years old and has 1 son who depends on her. She is a very dedicated, positive and hard working woman. She is happy because she can help out with her home's finances, and her aim is to have a store with windows to show off her products and avoid dust.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bulk buy different makes and models of watch for men and women/Compra de relojes en cantidad en diferentes modelos y marcas para caballeros y damas.

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es:
El Sr. Raúl V. se acerco a las oficinas de Fvp para solicitar un préstamo ya que el por el momento no cuenta con el capital necesario para cubrir los gastos de las escuela de sus tres hijo y no quiere que se queden sin estudio esté años por falta de útiles escolares y los uniformes.

El Sr. Raúl trabaja de albañil (se dedica a la reparación y construcción de casas) esté es su ingreso familiar. Cuando fuimos a realizar la visita al domicilio de Sr. Raúl no se encontraba en su casa el estaba trabajando es por eso que en la foto aparece su esposa y sus hijos.

El Sr. Raúl se entero del apoyo que les estamos ofreciendo para los gastos escolares a las familias de Nuevo Laredo y acudió a fvp. Para solicitar un préstamo de $300.00 dlls y comprar lo necesario para que sus hijos puedan estudiar sin ningún problema.
texts.en:
Mr. Raul Vazquez came to the office of Fvp to solicit a loan because at this moment he doesn’t has enough capital to cover the expenses of his three children’s school and he doesn’t want them to lose any studies this year because of lack of school supplies and uniforms.
Mr. Raul works as a carpenter (works fixing and building houses) this is the family’s income. When we went to visit Mr. Raul’s house he wasn’t there because he was working, this is why on the picture you will see his wife and kids.
Mr. Raul learned about the support we are offering for school expenses to the families in New Laredo and came to fvp to solicit a loan of $300.00 and buy the necessary supplies so his children will be able to study without any trouble.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies and uniforms

loans.name: Cesar Omar

texts.es:
Cesar es un joven preocupado en salir adelante, empezó su negocio cuando su padre se quedo desempleado y sobresalió poco a poco apoyando a su familia vendiendo dulces de tamarindo, y chamoy, inicio vendiendo en las casas y luego en las horas de descanso en la Escuela de la colonia.

El necesita un préstamo por US $350 que pagara en 3 meses para surtir dulces diferentes y ofrecerlos en escuelas primarias, con tu ayuda Cesar saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Cesar is a young man who is concerned with getting ahead. He began his business when his father became unemployed. He stood out bit by bit, supporting his family by selling tamarind sweets and chamoy (a conidiment of Mexican cuisine). He began by selling at people's homes and later at the neighborhood school during recesses.

He needs a loan of US $350.00, which he will repay in 3 months, to buy different sweets and offer them for sale in primary schools. With your help, he will get ahead.


Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria luisa es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 15 y 9 años, su esposo trabaje n la construcción. Ella decidió empezar su negocio para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la educación de sus hijos ya que el trabajo de su esposo era eventual y solo trabajaba una temporada y pues no quedaba entradas de dinero en la semana. Ella empezó con su negocio de elaboración y venta de comidas que estableció en su casa o que le ha permitido salir adelante.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $350 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar materia prima para poder continuar con la venta de sus comidas. Con tu ayuda Luisa saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa is married and has 2 children, who are 15 and 9 years old. Her husband works in construction. She decided to start her business in order to help her husband with the expenses of their children's education. Her husband's job was intermitent and he only worked for temporary periods--there were times when money did not come in during the week. She began her business making and selling food in her house, which has allowed her to get ahead.

She needs a loan for US $350, which she will repay in 3 months, to buy raw materials so that she can continue selling her foods. With your help, Luisa will come out ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Rosa Elia

texts.es:
Rosa Elia hace 3 años empezó con el negocio ya que sus hijos crecieron y cada uno tomo su camino, así que ella necesitaba dedicarse alguna actividad que le generara ingresos, por lo cual empezó con su negocio aparte de que es de gran además para su economía la mantiene activa, y así ha ido prosperando poco a poco con su tienda de abarrotes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y así surtir mas la tienda y vender mas para crecer el negocio.
texts.en:
Three year sago Rosa Elia started her business as each of her kids had gone their own way. This is why she needed to do something to generate more income for herself, and by starting this business she has remained active as well as earning some extra income. Her bric-a-brac shop has prospered bit by bit.

She needs a loan of $575 (which she will repay over a period of 6 months) to buy merchandise and thereby stock out her shop more and sell more so that her business can grow.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise/compra mercancia

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Jery Cristina

texts.es:
La señorita Jery Cristina, de profesión Ingeniero Agroindustrial, es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Trabajando II “, vive en la región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y lencería por catálogos, también vende productos naturales. El negocio lo realiza en su lugar de trabajo, ella trabaja en una institución de la ciudad, los clientes son sus compañeros de trabajo y amigos.  

Con el préstamo de S/. 800, el cual pagará en 4 meses invertirá en la compra de productos naturales de la marca Tian-Shin, productos de belleza de las marcas Unique, Natura. Jery aprovecha las ofertas para tener una mayor ganancia y dar facilidades a sus clientes.

Tiene 26 años y es soltera. Le gusta lo que hace y complementa su trabajo con esta actividad. Está contenta con los resultados obtenidos porque le permitió solventar sus gastos en la universidad. Su meta es formar una pequeña empresa de Productos Agroindustriales y de esta manera poner en practica su carrera.
texts.en:
Ms. Jery Cristina is an Agroindustrial Engineer, and a partner in the Mujeres Trabajando II communal bank. She lives int the San Martin region and province of the Tarapoto district. She works selling cosmetics and lingerie through cateloges, along with natural products. She runs her business from the place that she works, which is in a business in the city. Her clients are her friends and the people that she works with. With an 800 sol loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of Tian-Shin natural products, and Unique and Natura beauty products. Jery takes advantage of sales to increase her profit and to offer specials to her customers. She is single and 26 years old. She enjoys what she does, and adds to her work income through her side business. She is please with the success that she has had, because it allows her to pay her tuitions bills for college. Her goal is to form a small Agroindustiral products company, and to be able to put her degree to use.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of natural producst and beauty products

loans.name: Blanca Esthela

texts.es:
Blanca es casada y tiene 2 hijos: Kelia Mareza de 26 años, Hever Arturo de 23 años, su esposo trabaja en la venta de ropa. Inicio el negocio para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares y del hogar. Empezó hace 5 años vendiendo abarrotes en su casa y poco a poco fue invirtiendo en mercancía hasta lograr establecer su tienda de abarrotes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $350 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu ayuda ella saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Blanca is married and has 2 kids: Kelia Mareza who is 26 and Hever Arturo who is 23. Her husband works selling clothes. She started her business to help her husband with the family's expenses and household costs. Five years ago she started selling bric-a-brac from her house and bit by bit she invested in merchandise until she was able to open a bric-a-brac shop.

She needs a loan of $350 (which she will repay over a period of 4 months) to buy merchandise. With your help she will move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchanside/comprar mercancia

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Joicith

texts.es:
La señora Joicith, socia D. Banco Comunal “Mujeres Trabajando  II“, vive en la región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Morales. Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de la marca Unique. El negocio, el cual lo realiza recorriendo y visitando las casas de sus clientes. Se levanta muy temprano a realizar las labores domésticas para salir por las tardes a ofrecer los productos y cobrar,  porque ofrece los productos al crédito y con facilidades de pago.

Con el préstamo de S/. 600, el cual pagará en 4 meses  invertirá en la compra de productos de oferta como jabones, colonias, desodorantes, esmaltes, shampoo, etc., que son los productos que más le solicitan sus clientes. Desea surtir su mercadería para tener en stock y de esa manera poder atender a sus clientes con lo que ellos requieran.

Tiene 27 años, vive con su esposo y su  hijo, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien la motiva en el trabajo que realiza. Es una mujer muy activa e independiente, su meta es llegar a ser una empresaria de Unique.
texts.en:
Mrs. Joicith, member of the "Working Women II" Community Bank, lives in the San Martin province, in the district of Morales. She sells "Unique" brand beauty products. She runs the business in a door-to-door fashion. Mrs. Joicith wakes up early to complete her domestic responsibilities so that she can sell her beauty products in the afternoon, and get paid for the ones she previously sold on credit. With the loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase soaps, cologne, deodorant, nail polish, shampoo, etc., which are the most heavily requested products. She would like to stock up on her merchandise so that she can provide what her clients need. She is 27 years old, and lives with her husband and son. She relies on the support of her husband, who motivates her in her work. Mrs. Joicith is an active and independent woman, whose goal is to become a business partner in "Unique."


Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products for sale

loans.name: Olga Nelly

texts.es:
Olga inicio el negocio para sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que ella es la que se hace cargo de la manutención de sus 4 hijos: Francisco Javier de 19 años, German de 13 años, Laura Emilia y Gloria Marina, ambas de 11 años. Empezó su negocio hace 10 años elaborando y vendiendo tacos en su casa y gracias a su buen sazón la gente la empezó a recomendar y así se fue haciendo de clientela lo que le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos,

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $350 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar materia prima y poder continuar con su negocio. Con tu apoyo Olga saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Olga started her business to help her children get ahead, given that she is in charge of supporting all four of her kids: Francisco Javier who is 19 years old, German who is 13 years old, Laura Emilia and Gloria Marina, who are both 11 years old. She started her business ten years ago, making and putting together tacos at her house. Thanks to her great seasoning and cooking skills, her customers started to recommend her to others. This is how she has grown her business, which has allowed her to support her children.

She needs a loan of $350 USD, which she will repay over a period of four months, in order to purchase raw materials and to be able to continue with her business. With your support, Olga will get ahead.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Minerva Herminia

texts.es:
Minerva inició el negocio porque no tenía un trabajo estable y tenia que obtener recursos para los gastos de su casa y de sus 3 hijos: Lorena Elizabeth de 20 años, Yaneth de19 años y Guadalupe de 18. Comenzó hace 4 años vendiendo accesorios para teléfonos celulares, posterior mente agrego, teléfonos y tarjetas telefónicas y ahora vende varios otros articulos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancía y así poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Minerva opened her business because she could not find stable work and she needed income to cover the costs of raising her three children: Lorena Elizabeth (20 years old), Yaneth (19 years old) and Guadalupe (18 years old). Four years ago she began selling cellular telephone accessories. She later added telephones and telephone calling cards, and now sells many more goods. Minerva needs a loan of $250 -- which she will pay back in 4 months -- to purchase merchandise and, in doing so, continue making sales.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
La señora Juanita, socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen del Pilar”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Lamas, distrito de Zapatero y caserío de Nuevo Celendin. Se dedica a la venta de pollos vivos y eviscerados y para ello tiene un pequeño galpón en su domicilio desde donde sale a vender en los poblados mas cercanos y a los clientes que acuden a su casa.

Se inició en el negocio con la venta de juanes y parrilladas y tuvo que cambiar porque la nueva actividad le generaría mucha ganancia y vio que en el lugar donde vive no hay quien venda esta carne que es muy requerida a diario y es por eso que ahora se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos 

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual pagará en 6 meses que lo invertirá en la compra de pollitos BB, alimento de inicio, engorde, acabado y vitaminas, para  lograr vender un buen pollo y satisfacer las exigencias de sus clientes.

Juanita, tiene 51 años, vive con su esposo y su hija quienes la apoyan en todo momento. Es una mujer que poco a poco está creciendo en este negocio. Su meta es poner un galpón propio en su chacra y abastecer con pollos a los caseríos mas cercanos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juanita, member of the "Virgen de Pilar" Community Bank, lives in the region of San Martin, in the province of Lamas, in the district of Zapatero. She sells live and dead chickens, which she stores in a small shed. She sells her chickens in the heavily populated areas, and to clients living close to her. She began the business by selling "juanes," a typical Peruvian food, and grilled food, but she had to change because her current product offers her a higher income, and she struggled to find a market for her meat.

With this loan of 1,500 soles, which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase, small chicken, chicken feed, fatteners, and vitamins, so that she can sell good chicken and satisfy her clients' demands. Juanita is 51 years old, and lives with her husband and daughter, whom always support her. She is little by little expanding her business. Juanita's goal is to have her own chicken shed, and get her supply from the local farmhouses.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase small chickens and food for them

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las florcitas del Progreso II”, vive en la Región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Morales. Se dedica a la venta de refrigerios, como jugos de frutas naturales, tamales, juanes y humitas. La venta lo realiza en el frontis de su domicilio, situado en el Pasaje San José Mz A-L-19 AA. HH San Marcelo, a donde acuden los clientes.

Con el préstamo de S/. 800, el cual pagará en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de maní, maíz en saco para a preparación de humitas y tamales, también quiere invertir en la compra de diferentes variedades de fríjoles y plantones de cacao para que siembre en su chacra.

Tiene 42 años, es una mujer responsable y trabajadora. Su meta es arreglar su casa para implementar el negocio con la venta de asados y platos de la región por las noches.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julia belongs to the "Las florcitas del Progreso II" Community Bank. She lives in the San Martin province, in the morales district. She sells food such as natural juices, tamales, "juanes" (a tipical peruvian food) and stewed sweet corn. Julia sells her products in the front of her house, which is located on San Jose street. With the loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase peanuts, corn (to use in the preparation of stew and tamales), beans, and bananas. She is 42 years old, and is a responsible and hard-working woman. Her goal is to arrange her house so that she can sell BBQ meat and typical foods at night.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase peanuts, corn, beans and bananas.

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
Martha inicio el negocio porque necesitaba de un ingreso propio para poder ayudar a sus padres, ya que es soltera y ellos dependen de ella. Empezó hace 5 años vendiendo ropa a sus vecinos y amigos quienes la fueron recomendando hasta que logro hacerse de clientes, lo que le permitió mejorar sus ingresos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $ 400 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y así continuar con su negocio. :
texts.en:
Martha started the business because she needed to generate her own income to help her parents, given that she is single and they depend on her. She started five years ago selling clothing to her neighbors and friends. They started to recommend her business until she was able to build a customer base, which allowed her to improve her earnings.

She needs a loan of $400 USD, which she will repay over six months, to purchase merchandise and in this way be able to continue with her business.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Lauristela

texts.es:
La señora Lauristela, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra señora D. la paz”, vive en la Región y Provincia D. San Martín, distrito D. Tarapoto. Se dedica  con la confección D. Gigantografía, calendarios, complementa el negocio con la venta D. comida, sobre todo pensión, jugo D. frutas, llamadas celulares, desarrolla el negocio en su domicilio ubicado en el Jr. Ulises Reategui Nº 302,  donD. diariamente acuden los clientes, que en su mayoría son vecinos D. su barrio y particulares que requieren D. sus trabajos.

Con el préstamo D. S/ 1,500, el cual pagará en 6 meses, invertirá en la producción D. calendarios para el 2009 D. diferentes modelos y tamaños, también en la gigantografía, que es un negocio que le está dando buenos resultados, además quiere comprar productos como arroz en saco, azúcar, aceite, menestras, fideos para la preparación D. sus platos a ofertar a sus clientes D. su pensión. 

Lauristela, es una mujer atenta, decidida y trabajadora. Gracias a este negocio aprendió a tratar con todo tipo D. personas. Cuenta con 56 años y tiene 1 hijo quien la apoya en el negocio con la mano D. obra. Desea más adelante tener un taller D. gigantografía y seguir trabajando junto a su familia para formar una microempresa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lauristela belongs to the "Nuestra señora D. la paz" Community Bank. She lives in San Martin, in the Tarapoto district. Lauristela makes blow-ups of photos and calendars, which compliments her sales business, in which she sells fruit juices, and cell phone calls. She operates her business from home, and her clients are mainly neighbors. With the loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase materials to make calendars for 2009 of various styles and sizes. She will also purchase materials to make blow-up photos, which has been particularly successful. She also would like to purchase rice, sugar, oil, pulses (legumes) and noodles. Lauristela is a helpful, determined and hard-working woman. Thanks to this business, she has learned how to work with all types of people. She is 56 years old and has a son who helps her in the business venture. She would like to have a photography workshop and continue working with her family to form a small business.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to make calendars for 2009, and to purchase rice, sugar, oil, pulses (legumes) and noodles

loans.name: Ariana Lizeth

texts.es:
Ariana tiene un pequeño de 6 meses, Raúl Antonio quien es el motor de su vida. Ella inicio el negocio para salir adelante con una actividad que le diera buenos ingresos, y actualmente lo hace para sacar adelante a su hijo ya que ella es la que se hace cargo de la manutención de su pequeño. Comenzó hace 7 años vendiendo comidas en su casa posterior mente rento un local y se amplio.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para invertirlo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ariana has a six-month-old, Raúl Antonio, who drives everything in her life. She started the business to get ahead through a venture that would provide her with good income. These days she also runs it to help her young child get ahead, given that she is his sole means of support. She started seven years ago selling food from her house, and she subsequently has rented and outfitted a separate space for her enterprise.

She needs a loan of $400 USD, which she will repay over a period of six months, to invest into her business.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Hila Patricia

texts.es:
Hilda es casada y tiene 3 hijos: Sergio de 8 años, Adriana de 6 años  y Mia de 2 años. Ella quería apoyar a su esposo con los gastos escolares de sus hijos ya que desean darles una buena educación para que puedan salir adelante en un futuro; por lo que hace 2 años inicio con la venta de zapatos por catalogo, y tambien otros articulos, y ha obtenido buenas ganancias.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 4 meses para tener mas surtido de mercancía y poder darles mejor servicio a sus clientes entregándoles mas rápido la mercancía.
texts.en:
Hilda is married and has three children: Sergio (8 years old), Adriana (6 years old) and Mia (2 years old). She wanted to help her husband cover the cost of sending their children to school -- to give them a good education so they can get ahead in the future. Two years ago Hilda began selling shoes from a catalogue, as well as other goods, and has made good profits. Hilda needs a loan for $250 -- which she will pay back in 4 months -- to increase her stock of merchandise. This will help her offer better service to her clients by delivering their orders in less time.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es:
Dionicio es una persona dedicada al negocio de la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde muy temprana edad con una antigüedad de más de treinta años, en aquel entonces el necesitaba un empleo y lo consiguió en el molino del pueblo donde aprendo el oficio y después de unos años se independizo, lo que le permitió sacar adelante a su esposa y tres hijos.

El necesita un préstamo por US $1150 que pagara en 6 meses para reparación de sus 2 maquinas y así poder abrir un nuevo local que aumentaran sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Dionicio is dedicated to his business of making and selling tortillas. He started at a very young age and has more than 30 years experience. At the time, he needed the work, and he started at the village mill where he learned the trade. Some years later he went out on his own and started his business, which has helped him make headway for his wife and three children. Dionicio is requesting a loan of $1,150, which he will repay within six months, to repair two of his machines so he will be able to open a new shop and increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair two of his machines for making tortillas

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Lariza

texts.es:
Lariza, es una muestra del espíritu de triunfo, ella desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de libros, entre escuelas y papelerías, hace 3 meses logro por su permanencia ser nombrada representante de una editorial, y ahora cuenta con la exclusividad para ser distribuidora.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses para así poder invertirlo en la compra de libros y poder comprar no solamente en la ciudad sino también en el interior del estado, para así vender mejores libros a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lariza is a model of the triumphant spirit. For the past six years, she has been dedicated to selling books among schools and bookstores. Three months ago, her persistance paid off as she was named a representative for a publishing house and given exclusive rights to its distribution.

Lariza is requesting a loan of $975, which she plans to repay within six months, so she can invest in the purchase of books and be able to buy items not only in her city but also in the inland areas. This will allow her to sell better books to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase books for resale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Leovina

texts.es:
La señora Leonina, socia del BC “Las Moralinas”, vive en la Región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Morales. Se dedica a la venta de comidas y gaseosas. El negocio lo realiza en el Jr. Aviación Nº 100, donde acuden los clientes que son amigos, pasajeros y transeúntes de los diferentes terminales terrestres de la ciudad, porque el negocio está muy cerca a ellos.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1, 000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, invertirá en la compra de arroz, azúcar en saco, fideo, aceite en galón, gaseosas de diferentes marcas tamaños y sabores, también comprará los demás productos que necesita para la preparación de los platos a ofertar a sus clientes, además quiere implementar mejor el negocio para ello comprará vasos, servilletas, ollas y baldes para dar una buena atención a sus clientes.

Tiene 38 años, es una mujer responsable, cautelosa  y  trabajadora. Su meta es incrementar el negocio y surtir más, porque gracias a este negocio puede solventar los gastos de sus hijos quienes están estudiando.
texts.en:
Mrs. Leonina, member of the "Las Moralinas" Community Bank, lives in the San Martin province, in the Morales district. She sells food and soft drinks. She operates her business on Aviacion Street, where her clients, friends and travelers are close by. With the loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase rice, sugar, noodles, oil by the gallon, soft drinks, and other products that she needs for the preparation of foods. Also, she would like to improve her business by purchasing glasses, napkins, pots and buckets. She is 38 years old, and is a responsible, cautious and hard-working woman. Her goal is to expand her business and supply more, because thanks to this business she can cover her children's expenses, who are currently in school.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, noodles, oil by the gallon, soft drinks, and other products that she needs for the preparation of foods.

loans.name: Lili Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Lili, socia del Banco Comunal “Jerusalén II“, vive en la región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de productos naturales Omnilife, mercadería (ropa y zapatos). El negocio lo realiza recorriendo y entregando mercadería a los comerciantes minoristas del mercado Nº-2  y visitando la casa de los clientes. Se inició por iniciativa de una amiga con la de las ofertas para tener una mayor ganancia y dar facilidades a los clientes. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, invertirá en la compra de productos como aloe vera, mágnus, optimus, aloe beta y mercadería como zapatos de diferentes modelos y marcas, ropa para niños(as), varones y damas de diferentes modelos, edredones, etc., para surtir la mercadería y poder atender a sus clientes en lo que necesitan.

Tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, quienes la apoyan en esta actividad, ahora se siente segura, decidida, optimista con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Su meta es crecer en el negocio y vender al por mayor.
texts.en:
Lili is a partner in the Jerusalen II communal bank, and she lives in the San Martin Province and region in the Tarapoto district. She works selling Omnilife natural products, clothing and shoes. She does her work by picking up and delivering merchandise to the small scale merchants in the Number 2 market and by visiting clients in their homes. She began working because of the inspiration of a friend who saw that by purchasing goods on sale she could sell at a profit and offer deals to her customers. With this 1000 sol loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she will invest in the purchase of products including aloe ver, magnus, optimus, alo beta, various kinds and sizes of shoes, clothing for children, men and women, and bedding. This will allow her to carry a variety of merchandise and to be able to offer her customers what they want. Lili is 47 years old. She lives with her husband and 3 children who support her in her business. She now feels confident, dedicated and optimistic, with a strong desire to progress. Her goal is to grow the business and to sell wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Omnilife natural products and clothing for men and women

loans.name: Liliana Emperatriz

texts.es:
La señora Liliana, socia del Banco Comunal “LAS BRISAS”, actualmente vive en la Región de San Martín, provincia de Bellavista, Distrito de Bellavista, se dedica a la venta de pollos eviscerados. El negocio se ubica en el Jr. Puno 4to piso, donde diariamente acuden gran cantidad de clientes, los pollos lo reparten en las bodegas y pollerías, los fines de semana ella vende más. 

Desde que se inició en el negocio, Liliana cambió de actividad, primero vendió abarrotes, no le fue bien y ahora vende pollos eviscerados, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo, iniciando así su crecimiento económico. 

Con el préstamo de S/ 500.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará pollos  para luego sacrificarlos y poder proveer a sus clientes de las diferentes bodegas y pollerias de la ciudad.

Liliana es una mujer joven y entusiasta de 40 años. Se siente contenta de estar alcanzando sus objetivos propuestos, está creciendo en el negocio. Hoy en día tiene asegurada su venta diaria, sueña  con arreglar su casa y poder tener una tienda de abarrotes en su casa y poder dar una buena educación a  sus hijos.
texts.en:
Liliana is a partner in the Las Brisas community bank. She currently lives in the San Martin region of the Bellasvista province and district, and works selling chickens prepared for cooking. Her business is located in the Jr. Puno on the 4th floor, where every day she receives many customers. She sends chickens to stores and to chicken roasters - selling to most on the weekends. Since she started her business, Liliana has changed her commercial activities. In the beginning she sold groceries. When that didn't work out well for her, she switched to chickens. She has received help from her husband, and through that she has experienced economic growth. With this loan of 500 soles, which she will repay in 4 months, Liliana will purchase chickens for later sale so that she can offer her product to different stores and chicken roasters around the city. Liliana is a young and enthusiastic 40 year old. She is happy to be reaching her goals and growing her business. She currently has steady daily sales, and she dreams of arranging her house so that she can run a small store in her home and offer a good education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chickens

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos.   Se dedica a la negocio de venta la de abarrotes, con el motivo de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar, hace 10 años abrió esta tienda en su casa, la cual se convirtió en una actividad importante para su familia.El estar íntegramente en su tienda le ayuda a poder relacionarse con sus vecinos y clientes  quienes concurren a su bodega frecuentemente, siendo esto lo que le agrada, además que está pendientes de sus  hijos, sin embargo los precios elevados de los productos está perjudicando  su negocio y desea tener la capacidad de enfrentar estos altos costos.
Maria tiene en sus hijos, el mejor motor de su negocio, ya que desea ofrecerles una adecuada educación de calidad para su porvenir.
Ahora, desea invertir en la compra de mercadería que aumente la cantidad de productos que satisfagan las necesidades de sus clientes y los suyos propios.
texts.en:
Maria is 42 years old and leaves with her husband and 3 children. She has a grocery store to help her husband to pay for household expenses, she opened the store 10 years ago and it turned out to be a very important activity for her family. Working at the store helps her connect with her neighbors and clients who go to her store frequently, while she also takes care of her children, but the high prices had decreased her profits and wants to be able to deal with high costs. Maria’s greatest motivation is her children, because she wants to offer them a good education for their future. Now she wants to invest buying products to increase their number and selection to satisfy her clients and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the number and selection of products to satisfy her clients

loans.name: Dominica

texts.es:
Dominica es una mujer de 40 años, vive con su esposo y sus 6 hijos.  Desde que se casó se ha dedicado a la crianza de animales, ahora al cuidado y crianza de sus vaquitas, a las cuales trata de mejorar su raza, por ello se dedica en ellas durante todas las mañanas, las alimentan y les brinda lo necesario para su salud, ya que tienden a enfermarse, pero gracias a los medicamentos o vacunas que brindan las municipalidades, puede estar  aliviada.Sin embargo, el cariño que les tiene hace que el alimentarlas sea lo que más le agrade, para ello tiene que dedicarse al cultivo de maíz, porque son las yerbas de éste las que más alimentan a sus  animales, además que obtiene maíz para su consumo diario.
Dominica tiene en su familia a sus mayores motivadores para su trabajo y el bienestar de estos es su prioridad.
Invertirá el dinero que pide en la compra de un becerrito que pueda criar, y  desea que en un futuro cercano inicie la crianza de animales de mejor raza.
texts.en:
Dominica is 40 years old, lives with her husband and 6 children. Since she got married she has worked rising animals and currently she is rising little cows, and she is trying to improve their breed, so she works with them all morning, she feeds them and gives them everything they need to keep them healthy, because they get sick very easily, but thanks to all the medicine and vaccines supplied by municipalities, she is relieved. What she likes the most is to feed them, so she has to cultivate corn, which is what they eat and she also cultivates for her own consumption. Dominica’s greatest motivation is her family and they well being. She will invest the money to buy a young cow to rise and wants in a near future to rise animals of a better breed.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a young cow to increase the quantity of her livestock

loans.name: Marbely Del Socorro

texts.es:
El negocio al que se dedica la señora Marbely M. es a la reparación de zapatos ubicándose en las afueras del mercado Israel Lewites de la ciudad de Managua. Es de necesidad destacar que el negocio lo tiene desde hace 10 años y or medio de este ha logrado mantener a su familia compuesta por sus dos pequeños niños en edad escolar.

Hoy en día la señora Marbely busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito el cual le permita adquirir los utensilios necesarios para continuar con su actividad económica de reparación de zapatos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marbely M. works in shoe repair. Her business is located in the open-air markets of Israel Lewites in Managua. It is necessary to stress that she has run this business for 10 years and through it has been able to provide for her family, composed of her two school-aged children.

Today, Marbely is seeking support through CEPRODEL in order to obtain a loan with which she can acquire the tools necessary to continue her shoe-repair business.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to repair shoes.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer tiene 29 años, vive con su esposa y sus 4 pequeños hijos.
