Se dedica a la producción de plátano, lo cual realiza con formalidad desde que contrajo matrimonio, ya que tuvo que asumir responsabilidades para llevar el pan a su hogar, para ello  tiene que  trabajar desde muy de mañana y regresar muy tarde a su hogar.Sin duda, lo que le agrada es cosechar sus productos, porque aparte de vender su producto, a él le encanta comer plátano, y es infaltable en su hogar, las limitaciones que tiene son con respecto al traslado de sus productos a los mercados.
El bienestar de su familia es algo indispensable para su vida, y ese es su mayor motivo de esfuerzo. 
Desea invertir en la compra de plantaciones de plátano para aumentar su producción, y eso ayude a solventar los gastos de transporte de sus frutas, con el tiempo desea él mismo trasladar sus productos en su propio vehículo.
texts.en:
Wilmer is a 29 year old father who lives with his wife and 4 small children. He works as a banana grower - something that he has done since he married. In order to support his family, he begins work early in the morning - returning to his home late in the day. What makes him happiest is to harvest his crop, since besides selling his product, he loves to eat bananas and they are always served in his home. His only limitation is his ability to get his crops to market. The wellbeing of his family is important to him, and is the driving force behind his hard work. Wilmer would like to invest in the purchase of banana plantations to increase his production - this will allow him to cover the costs of the transportation of his fruit. He hopes in time to be able to transport his product in a vehicle of his own.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase his number of banana plantations on order to increase production

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 32 años, actualmente está embarazada, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos.
Trabaja en las labores ganaderas desD. hace 2 años, porque notó en esta actividad una buena opción D. desarrollo para su familia, es así que comenzó primero con una vaca, ahora cuenta con 3 vacas, sale todos los días por L. mañana a hacerlas pastear, aprovecha D. sus animales L. leche que producen, L. cual elL. comercializa diariamente, el alimento diario D. sus vacas es L. alfalfa, que extrae D. sus propias tierras D. cultivo.Por su actual estado D. embarazo, ahora no pueD. hacer tareas que requieren mayor esfuerzo físico, como cargar grandes cantidades D. alfalfa, por ello, su esposo es ahora un apoyo importante en su trabajo.
Isabel se motiva cada día por ver a sus hijos creciendo y superándose.
L. razón D. su solicitud D. crédito se debe a que elL. necesita comprar alimento balanceado y dosis antiparasitarias para sus vacas.
texts.en:
Isabel is 32 years old. She lives with her husband and their two children and is currently expecting a third child. For two years Isabel has worked with livestock. She chose this work because she saw a good development opportunity for her family. She began with one cow, but now has three. Every day she goes out in the morning to take her cattle out to graze. She also benefits from their milk, which she sells every day. Isabel's cows eat a daily diet of alfalfa, which Isabel harvests from her own fields. Because of her pregnancy, she currently is not able to perform tasks requiring a lot of physical effort, such as carrying large quantities of alfalfa. For that reason, right now her husband is a key source of support for her work. Seeing her children growing and excelling motivates Isabel every day. She is requesting a loan because she needs to purchase cattle feed and medicine for controlling parasites for her cows.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle feed and medicine for her cows

loans.name: Pedro José

texts.es:
Con mucho esfuerzo el señor Pedro A. desde hace 18 años se dedica a la actividad económica de reparación de zapatos teniendo su establecimiento en las afueras del mercado Israel Lewites de la ciudad de Managua.

Este caballero se esfuerza día a día y a pesar de las difíciles situaciones económicas que ha atravesado ha logrado llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación para beneficiar a sus pequeños hijos. Hoy en día solicita un crédito en Ceprodel con el objetivo de adquirir su materia prima para la reparación de los zapatos y así continuar manteniendo su humilde hogar de habitación.
texts.en:
With considerable effort Mr. Pedro A. has worked in shoe repair for 18 years. His establishment is in the open-air market Israel Lewites in Managua. This gentleman struggles day by day, and despite the difficult economic situations that have occurred, he has managed to provide a livelihood to his home for the benefit of his young children. Today he is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL with the goal of acquiring the raw materials for repairing shoes, and as such continue maintaining his humble home.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to repair shoes.

loans.name: Hida

texts.es:
Hilda es una mujer de 28 años de edad que vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos.  Se dedica a las plantaciones de yuca, frijoles y maíz, lo cual realiza por más de 10 años.Sale desde muy temprano, junto a su esposo,  rumbo a sus terrenos, no sin antes haber  realizado los quehaceres de su casa.Debido a que esta actividad le toma todo el día, tiene que dejar preparados los alimentos en su hogar, pero ya se acostumbró a esta rutina, por lo que le agrada estar al lado de su pareja, lo más difícil para ella, es levantarse muy temprano para dejar todo en orden y después tener que salir a sus terrenos de cultivos.
Hilda tiene en sus tres menores hijos un motor para su esfuerzo y trabajo.
Ahora, piensa comprar  mayor cantidad de semillas de frijoles y de maíz, para incrementar su producción, y con el tiempo ser la que abastezca a parte de los comerciantes que vienen a su localidad en busca de productos.
texts.en:
Hilda is 28 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children. She has been harvesting yuca, beans, and corn for more than 10 years. Along with her husband, she leaves her home early for her fields, however, not before finishing her household chores. Since her work occupies her entire day, she must prepare the food for her household before leaving for work. However, she has grown accustomed to this routine, and enjoys working alongside her husband. The most difficult thing for her is waking up extremely early to leave everything in order. Hilda's three children are her inspiration for her sacrifice and hard work. She plans to purchase a larger quantity of bean and corn seeds so as to increase production and meet the demands of her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bean and corn seeds to increase production

loans.name: Indira

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua específicamente en el mercado Israel Lewites, la señora Indira L. se dedica a atender su propio negocio de veterinaria donde brinda atención a los animales y a la vez tiene una pequeña venta de medicamentos para los animales.

A medida qeu los años han venido transcurriendo, ha logrado mejorar su negocio y esto ha sido gracias a Ceprodel el cual le ha brindado el apoyo crediticio para su beneficio en la compra de los medicamentos y mejora del local. Una vez más busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito y de esta manera continuar supliendo las necesidades de su hogar.
texts.en:
In Managua and specifically in the Israel Lewites market, Señora Indira L. takes care of her own veterinary shop where she treats animals and also sells medicine for animals.

As the years have passed she has improved her business thanks to Ceprodel, who have supported her in providing the credit that helped her buy medicine and improve the premises of the business. Once again she seeks Ceprodel's support for credit so she can continue providing for her home's necessities.


Translated from Spanish by Nathan Paluck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy animal medicine for her veterinary store

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina inició el negocio ya que deseaba percibir un mayor ingreso ya que trabajaba como empleada doméstica y lo que ganaba no era suficiente para solventar las necesidades familiares y el sueldo de su esposo no era suficiente y gracias a su deseo de mejorar encontró en las ventas una forma distinta pero efectiva para obtener un ingreso ya que por haber trabajado en varios empresas conoce a mucho gente a la que le ha ofrecido zapatos que es lo que vende y le han respondido muy bien, comenzó en el mes de Marzo de 1998primero ayudandole a una vecina a vender zapatos y ella le daba una comisión por cada venta. Poco a poco se fue haciendo de clientes y por lo mismo su vecina ya no podía surtirle a tiempo por lo que decidío independizarse y hacer ella la venta directamente para lo cual junto un poco de capital y así pudo iniciar su propio negocio, al mismo tiempo que las ganancias eran totalmente para ella.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia y surtir los pedidos de sus clientes lo cual le permitirá seguir conservárlos y que sus ganancias no disminuyan.
texts.en:
Cristina started her business because she wanted to increase her income; she already had a job as a housekeeper, but what she and her husband earned wasn't enough to cover the costs for her family's needs. Thanks to her desire to get ahead, she discovered that getting involved in sales would be a different but effective way to earn additional income. She has worked in various businesses and knows a lot of people that she has been able to turn into clients for her new business selling shoes. Many people have been interested in her products; she started in March 1998 by helping a neighbor sell shoes. Cristina received a commission for each sale, and she slowly increased the number of clients. Eventually, her neighbor couldn't supply all of the customers, so Cristina decided to start her own independent business. She raised a small amount of money to start the business and now makes her own income selling shoes.

Cristina needs a $400 loan, which she will repay in 6 months. She is seeking the loan in order to purchase merchandise and fill her customers' orders. This will ensure that she doesn't lose clients or her income.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramón inició el negocio porque es una actividad que le gusta mucho y en la cual puedo tener más libertad que si estuviera como empleado en alguna empresa y puede llevar una vida menos agitada. Comenzó en el mes de Abril de 1998 cuando en su trabajo anterior como mensajero conoció a una persona que trabajaba la fibra de vidrio lo cual le interesó mucho y entonces el se ofreció a enseñarle el oficio en sus ratos libres. Por un tiempo trabajó con esta persona y después se independizó y logró instalar su propio taller en el patio trasero de su casa y desde entonces le ha ido muy bien y en la actualidad ya cuenta con muchos clientes.

El necesita un préstamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar el material necesario para elaborar los pedidos que tiene por delante y que sus clientes reciban a tiempo los productos que le han solicitado.
texts.en:
Ramon started his business because it's something he really enjoys. It also allows him more freedom than if he were an employee at a company and makes his life less stressful. He started in April 1998 while he was still at his former job as a messenger. He met someone who works with fiberglass and became very interested in the trade, which that person offered to teach him in his spare time. He worked with him for some time and then started his own business. He set up a workshop on the patio behind his house and since then has done very well with his business. He currently has a large number of clients.

Ramon is seeking a US $400 loan, to be repaid in six months. He will use the loan to purchase the materials he needs to fill the orders he already has so that his clients can receive what they've ordered on time.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Alida

texts.es:
Alida tiene 45 años, vive en compañía de sus 3 hijos y su esposo.
Hace más de 6 años trabaja en la venta de cosméticos por catálogo, de las marcas más famosas de su medio, como ella trabaja de manera dependiente, aprovecha la oportunidad de ofrece estos cosméticos a sus compañeros de trabajo, es responsable para administrar su tiempo de venta y repartición de sus cosméticos y de su trabajo en esta entidad.La dificultad con que a veces se encuentra Alida, es cuando da crédito y se demoran en pagarle la cuenta, por ello, previene, y trabaja con dos capitales: el recuperable, y el fijo, con el que vuelve a comprar la mercadería, para que de esa manera ella pueda continuar trabajando en la venta de cosméticos.
Alida se  esfuerza porque desea seguir adelante con sus metas para que sus hijos sigan progresando, sin detenerse en el camino hacia la superación.
Ahora, necesita incrementar su mercadería, para lo cual solicita este prestado que invertirá netamente en ello.
texts.en:
Alida is 45 years old and lives with her 3 children and husband. For more than 6 years she’s been a sales rep for a cosmetics catalogue that offers the best brand names available. She works dependently, so she is able to offer her cosmetics to colleagues at work, is responsible for administering her own sales and delivery time, and all other tasks related to the job. The difficulty Alida finds in this work is that she gives credit and then her clients take a long time to pay the bill. To alleviate this, she works with two incomes: the money from outstanding invoices and her fixed income, which she then reinvests in stocking up on merchandise so she can continue her work as a sales rep. Alida works hard because she wants to continue moving forward with her projects and so her children can continue moving toward a better future. Currently, she needs to stock up on merchandise and is asking for this loan so she can begin reinvesting in her business. Alida tiene 45 años, vive en compañía de sus 3 hijos y su esposo. Hace más de 6 años trabaja en la venta de cosméticos por catálogo, de las marcas más famosas de su medio, como ella trabaja de manera dependiente, aprovecha la oportunidad de ofrece estos cosméticos a sus compañeros de trabajo, es responsable para administrar su tiempo de venta y repartición de sus cosméticos y de su trabajo en esta entidad.La dificultad con que a veces se encuentra Alida, es cuando da crédito y se demoran en pagarle la cuenta, por ello, previene, y trabaja con dos capitales: el recuperable, y el fijo, con el que vuelve a comprar la mercadería, para que de esa manera ella pueda continuar trabajando en la venta de cosméticos. Alida se esfuerza porque desea seguir adelante con sus metas para que sus hijos sigan progresando, sin detenerse en el camino hacia la superación. Ahora, necesita incrementar su mercadería, para lo cual solicita este prestado que invertirá netamente en ello.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase quantity of merchandise (cosmetics) for sale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 43 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos.  Cada día, trabaja en el cuidado y crianza de ovejas, desde hace 12 años, atiende a sus animales, todos los días, durante varias horas para que puedan engordar, para luego vender su carne a las tiendas de su localidad, en esta etapa, recién puede ver los frutos de una intensa labor, que le ha costado un cuidado diario, esta actividad le brinda ingresos económicos que aporta a su hogar y que muchas veces también la ha sacado de apuros.
Maria se esfuerza para que sus hijos sigan superándose a través del estudio. 
La solicitud  de su préstamo es para que pueda comprar alimento balanceado y de las ganancias seguir apoyando a sus hijos con sus gastos de estudio.
texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children. For over 12 years she has raised sheep. Every day she tends to her animals so that they can fatten, allowing her to later sell the meat at the local market. At this time she is seeing the profits of her hard work, which demands daily attention. The income from her job contributes to household expenses, and it has also helped her get through difficult times. Maria makes a great sacrifice so that her children can continue to succeed in school. She asks for a loan to purchase well-balanced nourishment for her animals, and with the profits hopes to continue to support her children and meet scholastic expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase well-balanced nourishment for her sheep

loans.name: Las Alacatrces Group

texts.es:
Maria Inés, Cintia y Magdalena son casadas, María Inés tiene 3 hijos: Juan Enrique de 24 Francisco Javier de 23 y Juan Ángel de 19 años, su esposo trabaja como mecánico. Cintia tiene 2 hijas: Emili de 3 años y Yesenia de 2 años su esposo trabaja como mecánico por lo que sus ingresos son variables y Magdalena tiene 4 hijos: Iliana de 25 años María Guadalupe de 24, Vianey de 17 y Cesar Mario de 16, su esposo es ganadero.

Ellas deseaban apoyar a su esposos con los gastos familiares para así darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos; por lo que decidieron emprender un negocio. María Inés empezó hace 16 años a vender ropa y así logro obtener el ingreso extra que necesitaba. Cintia comenzó hace 2 años vendiendo zapatos por catalogo a sus amigos y familiares y ahora ya tiene una cartera de clientes mas amplia. Magdalena comenzó su negocio hace 18 años ya que deseaba tener su propia fuente de ingresos, y en la venta de ropa pudo lograrlo. María Inés es la coordinadora de este grupo llamado “Las Alcatraces”

Ellas necesitan de US $ 875 que pagarán en 4 meses para lograr hacer crecer su negocio y así poder ofrecerles mejor calidad de vida sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria Inés, Cintia, and Magdalena are all married. Maria Inés has three children: Juan Enrique, 24; Francisco Javier, 23; and Juan Ángel, 19. Her husband is a mechanic. Cintia has two daughters: Emili, 3; and Yesenia, 2. Her husband is a mechanic; however, his income fluctuates. Magdalena has four children: Iliana, 25; Maria Guadalupe, 24; Vianey, 17; and Cesar Mario, 16. Her husband is a rancher. These women want to help their husbands with the household expenses, as well as give their children a better way of life. For these reasons they decided to start a business. Maria Inés has been selling clothes for 16 years, which has helped her obtain an extra income. Cintia started 2 years ago selling shoes through a catalogue to her friends and family members. Now her client base is larger. Magdalena started her business 18 years ago. Her goal was to produce her own income, and selling clothes has allowed her to accomplish this goal. Maria Inés is the coordinator of this group called "Las Alcatraces". They ask for a loan of $ 875, which they will repay in 4 months, to help their business grow, and thus, allow them to provide a better quality of life for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: comprar mercancia

loans.name: Jessyca

texts.es:
Jessica tiene 32 años, vive con sus padres. Es una joven con muchos deseos de superación, por eso, decidió hace 5 años dedicarse a la  venta de ropa, comenzó con poco capital, ahora ha visto, con el paso de los años, acrecentar su mercadería, debido a los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes.Durante varias horas al día se dedica a ofrecer sus prendas, viaja periódicamente a la ciudad para  adquirir nueva y variada mercadería.Además de esto, también cultiva la papa y maíz, entonces, mientras espera la época de la cosecha, vende ropa, aprovechando mucho más cuando hay ferias debido a celebraciones o festividades regionales.
Jessica quiere superarse y progresar en la vida, además de eso, retribuir a sus padres por lo que hicieron por ella.
Con el dinero que solicita, además de comprar prendas de vestir al por mayor, adquirirá zapatos, y también comprará sacos de abono y fertilizantes para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Jessica is 32 years old, and she lives with her parents. She is a young woman with great desires to progress, and for this reason 5 years ago she decided to begin selling clothes. She started off with a little capital, and over the years she has been able to bring in more merchandise, thanks to her customers' orders. Throughout the day she works selling her wares, traveling to the city from time to time to get new and varied merchandise. Additionally, she grows potatoes and corn. While she is waiting for the harvest time, she works selling clothing. She takes advantage of sales opportunities at celebrations and regional festivals. Jessica would like to get ahead and progress in life. She would also like to repay her parents for all that they have done for her .With the money that she is requesting, besides buying clothing wholesales, she will buy shoes, and will also purchase bags of fertilizer and manure for her next crop.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Add to the clothing she offers for sale, and purchase fertilizer and manure for crops.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
Erika tiene 27 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo de 4 añitos. Ella es una mujer muy valiente y trabajadora, tuvo la iniciativa de emprender un negocio familiar, decidieron junto con su esposo, fabricar colchones, debido a la disponibilidad de un espacio que les permite esta actividad; ya son 4 años de esta intensa labor, la cual consiste en juntar en dos días todo lo necesario en materia, sobre todo paja, luego de esto, durante  3días fabrican los colchones, para posteriormente repartirlos a las diferentes tiendas de muebles de la ciudad de Huancayo, con esto, pueden conseguir el sostén que le permite costear la educación de su hijo, además de tener un horario flexible que le permite tener tiempo disponible para atender a su pequeño.
Erika se esfuerza porque le motivan sus deseos de superación en bien de su familia. 
Solicita este préstamo, el cual invertirá en la compra, al por mayor, de lanilla, directamente de Lima, porque los costos son menores, además de abastecerse de paja y tela, para que tenga mayor tiempo disponible para atender a su pequeño.
En la foto se observa a Erika en uno de los procesos de la elaboración de los colchones que se denomina el chancado, ya que los colchones que había elaborado los había terminado de distribuir.
texts.en:
Erika is 27 years old. She lives with her husband and their 4 year old son. She is a hard working, brave woman. She took the initiative to begin a family business. Together with her husband, they decided to make mattresses, since they had the necessary space. They have worked hard for 4 years. They must gather all the necessary material in 2 days - more than anything else, straw. For the next 3 days, the build the mattresses, later delivering them to different furniture stores around the city of Huancayo. By doing this, they have been able to afford schooling for their son. Erika works hard, motivated by a desire for her family's success. She is requesting this loan, which she will use to purchase stuffing material in bulk, directly from Lima, which will save her money. She will also stock up on straw and material she that she can have more time to care for her small son. You can see Erika involved in one of the steps in mattress making in the pictures, since she had already delivered the mattresses which they had completed.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking up on material used for making mattresses.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 53 años, en la actualidad vive con la menor de sus hijos que tiene 15 años.
El talento para la cocina, le permite hoy, a Margarita, sostenerse económicamente, ella y su hija. Todas las mañanas vende diversos platos a base de pescado (ceviche, chilcano y leche de tigre) en un kiosko cercano a su casa, por la buena sazón y el esmero con el que atiende a los comensales, ha visto crecer significativamente su clientela.Se levanta muy temprano en la mañana para preparar estos potajes, para esto, en la tarde del día anterior ya ha comprado los ingredientes, para ella su negocio, más que un trabajo, es una distracción, se siente satisfecha al final del día, por realizar un buen trabajo.
Margarita desea superarse cada día, y ayudar a su hija a que se conduzca por el camino, este es el motivo de su esfuerzo.
Solicita este préstamo, que invertirá para la mejora de su negocio, su deseo es arrendar un local amplio y convertirlo en una marisquería.
texts.en:
Margarita is 53 years old and she lives with her youngest daughter who is 15 years old. Her talent in the kitchen had supported her financially. Every morning she sells different sea food dishes (ceviche, chilcano and tiger milk) at a kiosk near by her home, because she is a great cook and her good service, her customers have increased considerably. She wakes up early in the morning to prepare the food and buys the ingredients the previous afternoon, for her this is more than work, is also pleasure and she feels satisfied at the end of the day after finishing a good job. Margarita wants to improve herself each day and guide her daughter on the right direction, this is her motivation. She is requesting the loan to invest it on improving her business, she wants to rent a bigger place and turn it into a sea food restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To rent a bigger place and turn it into a sea food restaurant

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Jenny tiene 31 años, vive en casa y compañía de sus padres. Es una joven responsable, con un corazón lleno de gratitud hacia sus progenitores, por tal motivo se dedica, desde hace mas de 5 años, al bordado de fustanes folklóricos de su zona, decidió emprender esta actividad como negocio, debido a la demanda que tuvo a consecuencia de la calidad de los trabajos que ella realiza. Ahora, trabaja a tiempo completo para cada prenda, en la elaboración de un fustán utiliza bellos y variados colores, para que se dé una combinación perfecta, así, con mucho esfuerzo,  entrega a tiempo los pedidos de bordados que le solicitan y es un gran disfrute el hecho de estar en la comodidad de su hogar  realizando sus trabajos, además de ser una labor independiente.
Jenny tiene una razón para  trabajar y esforzarse, mejorar su calidad de vida y también la de sus padres.
Solicita este préstamo, con la cual podrá adquirir telas e hilos, al por mayor, y con ello, aumentar su productividad. Ella se ve en el futuro como una fuente de trabajo para muchas personas, ya que por la creciente demanda que ella tiene podrá contratar personal para sus bordados.
texts.en:
Jenny is 31 years old and lives with her parents in their house. She us a responsible young woman whose heart is filled with gratitude towards her parents. This is why she has spent more than five years embroidering the cotton skirts that are traditional in the area where she lives. She decided to launch this business because of the high demand for her work, due to its high quality. She works full-time, and for each skirt she uses many beautiful colors to achieve just the right combination. With a lot of hard work, she completes her custom orders on time. Jenny thoroughly enjoys the ability to independently work from her own home. Jenny works hard for one reason: to improve her quality of life and that of her parents. She is requesting this loan to buy fabric and thread in bulk, and thus increase her productivity. It looks as though she may be a source of employment for many people in the future, since because of the growing demand for her products she will be able to contract employees to do some of her embroidery work.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials (fabric, threads) for embroidered skirts

loans.name: Ivone Aneth

texts.es:
Ivone es casada y tiene 2 hijos: Jasón de 10 años y Jacqueline de 4 años, su esposo es empleado. Ella inició el negocio por querer sacar adelante a su familia apoyando a su marido con la economía familiar. Empezó hace 3 años vendiendo ropa americana y le ha dejado buenos ingresos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancía ya que quiere hacer crecer su negocio y con tu apoyo lo va a conseguir
texts.en:
Ivone is married and has two children: 10-year-old Jason and 4-year-old Jacqeline. Her husband is an employee. She began her business because Ivone wanted to help her husband in supporting the family. Three years ago she began selling American second-hand clothing, which has generated a good income. She requests a loan for $250 to be paid back in four months. The loan will be used to buy merchandise to make her business grow. With your help, Ivone will make it.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying merchandise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Odelia

texts.es:
Odelia tiene 33 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Mujer empeñosa y trabajadora, hace un año decidió abrir un cafetín escolar en las instalaciones de una escuela primaria, desde ese entonces, ofrece todo tipo de refrigerios escolares y confiterías a los niños, que son los principales consumidores, que en los recreos  salen a comprar, Odelia nota que este negocio le está resultando rentable, y la atención que requiere es de todos los días, solo por las mañanas, así, en las tardes, se dedica a la atención de sus 2 hijos, y en sus momento libres, vende ropa y zapatillas a sus vecinos.Ella desea seguir adelante con estas dos actividades, porque disfruta mucho de trabajar en las ventas.
Odelia se esfuerza diariamente porque quiere dar lo mejor a sus hijos, y de cubrir sus necesidades.
Con el préstamo que obtenga, Odelia podrá adquirir mayor cantidad de mercadería para que siga con sus negocios.
texts.en:
Odelia is 33 years old; she lives with her husband and 2 children. A year ago she decided to open a coffee shop at a school, where she offers all kind of school snacks and candies for kids, who are her main clients, when they go out during their breaks. Odelia notices this business is profitable and requires daily attention, mainly in the mornings, in the afternoons she takes care of her children and on her free time she sells clothes and sandals to her neighbors. She wants to keep on with these activities, because she enjoys working on sales. Odelia works daily because he wants to give her children the best and cover their needs. With the loan she is requesting, Odelia will get more merchandise to keep on with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the merchandise for her coffee shop and clothes and sandals she sells

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Valentina tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Mujer trabajadora del campo, que siempre está buscando mejoras para su familia, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 20 años, fue la mejor herencia que le pudieron dejar sus padres, cultiva papa, olluco y camotillo; además, también cría animales, los cuales vende, tales como cuyes, gallinas, cerdos, ovejas y caballos; para la alimentación de sus animales siembra pastos, pero también aprovecha la cosecha de sus productos y juntamente con sus pastos los lleva a vender a la ciudad.Lo que afecta su trabajo es cuando el clima daña seriamente sus cultivos, al punto que puede ocasionarle pérdidas, por ello es que sostiene esos momentos con la crianza y venta de animales.
Valentina está motivada cada día, por el grande amor que siente  por sus 4 hijos.
Invertirá el presente préstamo en la compra de una vaca lechera, con la que podrá producir leche y hacer queso.
texts.en:
Valentina is 35 years old and lives with her husband and their 4 children. She has worked in agriculture for 20 years, and is always looking for ways to help her family's situation. The fields were the best inheritance her parents could have left her. She grows potatoes and other crops, and also raises animals to sell such as guinea pigs, hens, pigs, sheep and horses. In order to feed the animals she needs to grow grains, but she also takes advantage of the harvest and sells the grain in the city with the rest of her goods. What affects the success of her business the most is when the weather does serious damage to her crops and she loses them. When this happens, the animal sales help sustain the business. Valentina is motivated every day by the great love she has for her children. She will invest the loan in a dairy cow, with which she will produce milk and cheese.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO PURCHASE A DAIRY COW WHICH WILL ENABLE HER TO PRODUCE  AND SELL MILK AND CHEESE

loans.name: Martha Adela

texts.es:
Martha inició el negocio porque deseaba tener un ingreso extra para la familia y de esta forma ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a sus hijos que estaban estudiando. Comenzó en 1998, cuando un hermano empezó su negocio de gorditas de maíz cerca de la Universidad de la localidad y le fue muy bien, el la animó a que pusiera su propio negocio en otra zona ya que en ese entonces le ayudaba a él en su negocio, lo cual llevó a cabo y le fue muy bien ya que pudo instalar dos puestos en diferentes puntos de la ciudad. Después del crédito anterior que recibió a través de KIVA pudo abrir un tercer puesto de gorditos en su casa, para el cual acondicionó un lugar en el patio y le ha ido muy bien allí.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $575 que pagara en 5 meses para poder comprar materia prima para la elaboración de las gorditas de maíz que vende y mantener satisfechos a los clientes que regularmente le compran.
texts.en:
Martha started her business because she wanted to earn extra income for her family and, in doing so, help her husband support their school-age children. She began in 1998 when one of her brothers started a business selling "gorditas de maíz" [corn flour biscuits] near the local university; the business was very successful. As Martha was then helping her brother with his business, he encouraged her to establish her own business in another neighborhood. She did so, and since then it also has been successful, seeing she has established two selling points in different parts of the city. Since receiving her previous loan from Kiva, Martha has been able to open a third "gorditas de maíz" selling point in the specially adapted courtyard of her home. This also has been successful. Martha needs a loan of $575 -- which she will pay back in 5 months -- to purchase basic ingredients for making the "gorditas de maíz" she sells. This will keep her loyal clients happy.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic ingredients

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina inició el negocio porque enviudo y se empezaron a acumular deudas y no tenía ingresos para pagarlas, entonces comenzó a vender diferentes cosas hasta que decidió instalarse en un lugar fijo. comenzó en Abril de 1997, instalando una tiendita en su casa con muy poca mercancía, la cual fue surtiendo poco a poco y fue creciendo y así se ha mantenido mas de 11 años, pero pese a las enfermedades y ser una persona mayor todavía tiene animo de seguir adelante y continuar trabajando para que su negocio crezca mas.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $575 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar mercancía y poder resurtir su tienda con mercancía variada y seguir dándole una buena atención a sus clientes para que le sigan comprando y de esta forma obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Paulina began her business because after becoming a widow, bills started to accumulate, and she did not have an income to pay them off. She sold various products until she decided to establish a small store in April, 1997. At first, her store had just a few items, but little by little she has steadily expanded her business for 11 years. Despite illnesses and advancing age, Paulina still has enthusiasm and willingness to work hard and see her business continue to grow. She requests a loan of US $575 to be paid back in 5 months. The loan will be used to stock her store with a larger selection of merchandise to offer her customers and increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying merchandise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: la señora Maria M., tiene 51 años de edad, es soletra tiene dos hijos con edades comprendidas entre los 17 y 14 años, ambos estudian en sucundaria, su compañero de vida es juvilado,  señora se dedica a una pequeña puleria ubicada en su domicilio, la cual dad inicio como una alternativa al desempleo y una opcion para poder salir adelante con  sus hijos, para la cual desde hace cuatro años atras desempeña esta tarea. con sus creditos ha podido lograr ir creciendo y fortaleciendo el inventario de su negocio, su mayor sueño es poder ver realizados profesionalmente s sus hijos, su deseo es poder acondiconar su casa de habitacion, los creditos que ha slicitado han sido utilizados para invertir en capital de trabajo como es la compra de detergentes, gaseosa, bisuteria, granos basicos, su proposito es poder mejorar su negocio  y producto de las ganancias ir poco a poco cumpliendo sus deseos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria M. is 51 years old, unmarried, and has two children who are 17 and 14 years old. They both attend high school and her life-partner is retired. She works in a small general store located in her home, which she began as an alternative to unemployment and an option to be able to improve the lives of her children. The latter is why she has dedicated herself to her work for the past 4 years. With her loans she has been able to successful increase and maintain her business inventory. Her greatest dream is to be able to see her children become professionals, she also hopes to be able to furnish her home. The loans she has requested have been used as business investment capital to buy detergent, cooking-gas, accessories, and household necessities. Her goal is to improve her business and produce the income to, little by little, realize her dreams.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
Aída después de haberse divorciado, decidió emprender un negocio que le dejara ganancias pues para salir adelante y vivir cómodamente. Al darse cuenta que sus vecinas batallaban para llevar a sus hijos a la escuela por estar retirada de la colonia, vio la oportunidad de emprender este negocio, ya que son muchos los niños que van a la escuela, primero empezó llevando a niños de primaria, posteriormente con el paso del tiempo decidió que también le era posible llevar a los de secundaria, ya que hay un buen numero de jóvenes de secundaria. Actualmente le ha ido muy bien, pero tiene el deseo y la inquietud de ampliar su negocio extenderse a colonias aledañas a su domicilio, al igual a escuelas del mismo sector.

Ella necesita de un préstamo por US $775 que pagara en 6 meses para compra una camioneta para el transporte escolar y así ampliar su negocio, tiene toda la fe que con el apoyo de Kiva obtendrá su crédito y podrá ampliar su negocio y así poder apoyar a las madres de familia con sus hijos.
texts.en:
After her divorce, Aida decided to start a business that would allow her enough earnings to get ahead and live comfortably. She realized that her neighbors were struggling to take their children to school due to living in remote areas of the neighborhood. She saw the opportunity to start this business since there were so many school-aged children. She began taking children to elementary school, and as time passed she decided that it was also possible to take those who go to secondary school since there were also a large number of them. It has been going very well for her, but she has the desire and the interest to expand her business and extend to other surrounding neighborhoods as well as the schools in the same sector.

She needs a loan of $775.00 US which will be repaid in 6 months in order to buy a bus for school transportation and thereby expand her business. She has complete faith that with the support of Kiva she will obtain her credit and will be able to expand her business. This will in turn allow her to support the mothers of the families with children.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a bus

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efraín decidió emigrar a esta frontera, para tener un mejor futuro de vida, ya que en su pueblo natal el trabajo es muy escaso y por lo regular en trabajo de campo, y el aspiraba a mas, pues para poder solventar gastos y vivir cómodamente. Al llegar a Reynosa empezó a buscar trabajo, encontró en una empresa maquiladora, al trabajar arduamente por varios años en esta maquiladora, el decido emprender su propio negocio, con los ahorros que tenia, empezó su negocio con una pequeña tienda de abarrotes el cual ahora desea agradar y remodelar debido al éxito obtenido.

El necesita un préstamo por US $450 que pagara en 6 meses, para remodelar y comprar mas surtido de mercancía.
texts.en:
Efraín decided to emigrate to this border in order to have a better future. In his hometown work is very scarce, and normally it is field work. He aspires to do more so that he can pay his expenses and live comfortably. Upon arriving in Reynosa he began to look for work. He found a job in a factory, and after working hard for several years in the factory, he decided to open his own business. With his savings, he began his business with a small grocery store, which he now wishes to improve and remodel due to the success he has had.

Efrain needs a loan of $450.00 US which he will pay in 6 months, in order to remodel and purchase a greater supply of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: remodelar su tienda

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: El señor Ricardo F., tiene 36 años de edad, es casado, le tiene dos hijos, con edades comprendidas entre los nueve y tres años respectivamente, ambos cursan la primaria, su esposa es comerciante de mercaderia, su proposito es poder continuar apoyando a la comunidad a traves de sus servicios como laboratorista dedicandose a esta actividad desde hace mas de dos años, ya que trabaja en conjunto con otra persona, su deseo es poder con el tiempo llegar a tener un laboratorio propio de esta menra generar empleos, su deseo es poder poder llegar a tener un local propio y no alquilar, dicho negocio surge como una idea de querer tener un negocio propio en el que se aplique sus conocimientos como profesional, con sus creditos ha ido adquiriendo material necesraio para brindar un mejor servicio y diagnostico mas preciso pero para ello requiere de mejores equipos y un local bine constituido razon por la cual tiene la fe en Dios en poder lograrlo con una mano amiga que desee trabajar en su proyecto.
texts.en:
Mr. Ricarda F. is 36 years old, married, and has two children who are 9 and 3 years old. Both children are in primary school and his wife works as a saleswoman. His goal is to be able to continue supporting his community through his services as a lab technician, a service he has provided for the past two years. Since he works in conjunction with another person, his desire is to be able to have his laboratory so the he can generate jobs. He hopes to be able to have his own space, not rented. This business came about as an product of wanting to have his own business in which to apply his professional knowledge. With his loans he has acquired materials necessary to provide better services and more precise diagnostics, but in order to continue he need better equipment and a well-established locations, which is why he has faith in God that he will be able to accomplish his goals with helping hands from friends who desire to work on his project.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Luis Adrian

texts.es:
Luis Adrian inició el negocio porque se caso muy joven y no tenía un trabajo fijo, entonces llegó su primer hijo y había gastos de leche y de pañales aparte de las necesidades de su esposa y mías. Comenzó en marzo de 2006 por una amiga de su esposa que la convenció de que vendieran ropa usada en el mercado rodante de nuestra colonia. Posteriormente entro a trabajar como mesero en un restaurante, pero los fines de semana van a los mercados rodantes a vender, sobre todo en el más grande de la ciudad al que acude muchísima gente y les ha ido muy bien desde entonces.

El necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para surtirse de ropa de temporada y tener una mejor variedad y mayor surtido que ofrecer a los compradores
texts.en:
Luis Adrian started his business because he married very young and didn't have a steady job. Then his first child arrived and there were expenses of milk and diapers along with his needs and those of his wife. He began in March 2006 when a friend of his wife convinced him to help her sell used clothing in the market near the neighborhood. Previously he had worked as a waiter in a restaurant, but went on weekends to the nearby markets to sell, mostly in the largest of the city which attracts many people and it has gone very well for them ever since.

He needs a loan of $300 US which will be repaid in four months in order to stock seasonal clothing and to increase variety and offer a better selection to the customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio inició el negocio porque dejó de trabajar después de 10 años y no se pensioné y solo le dieron una compensación por lo cual quiso abrir su propia empresa para seguir apoyando a sus hijos y sacarlos adelante. Comenzó en el año de 1988 cuando un amigo lo invitó a trabajar en una obra y le fue enseñando todo acerca de la albañilería, después el siguió por su cuenta y le empezaron a caer trabajos de pintura y de impermeabilización de casas y así se fue haciendo de clientes. En la actualidad su hijo le ayuda en el negocio y entre los dos sacan los trabajos y les va muy bien.

El necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para poder comprar herramientas y materiales que le permitan sacar adelante sus compromisos y no quedar mal con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gregorio started his business because after leaving his job of 10 years, he did not qualify for retirement, and he was given only a lump sum that he used to open his own business in order to support his children. He began his business in 1988, when a friend invited him to work in a construction site, and taught him all about construction. Later, Gregorio started working on his own, and soon was hired for painting and insulating jobs, and began building a customer base. These days his son helps him and between the two keep the business going well. Gregorio needs a loan of US $300 to be paid back in 4 months. The loan will be used to buy tools and construction materials to complete their contracts and keep their customers satisfied.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying construction tools

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es: La señora Olga Marina M., es soltera, tiene 48 años de edad, es madre de cinco hijos, dos ya trabajan, sus otros hijos dos de ellos cursan el segundo año de secunadrai y su ultimo niño tien nueve años y cursa el tercer grado de primaria, su compañero de vida y padre de sus hijos se desemepña como chofer en la alcaldia municipal de leon, su proposito en la vida es poder salir adelante con su familia, su  sueño es poder mejorar sus condicIones de vivienda, y mejorar su negocio siendo este una puleria donde a diario ofrece productos de uso y consumo diario para el hogar, teniendo mas de 17 años de tener este negocio con el cual ha sacado adelante poco a poco a sus hijos, dadndo inicio su negocio como una necesidad de aportar al nucleo familiar dado que su familia es muy numerosa, en la actualidad es un negocio que esta bine surtido tiene bastanet clientela en el sector ya que ofrece gran variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Olga Marina M. is 48 years old, single, and mother of five children. Two of her children work, two are in high school and her youngest son is nine years old and is in 3rd grade. Her husband is employed as a chauffeur in the Leon municipality. Her purpose in life is to move forward with her family and dream is to be able to improve the conditions of her home and improve her business. She has a store where she offers useful products and daily necessities. She has run her general store for 17 years with which she has been able to provide little by little for her children. Olga started her business as a necessity for supporting her very large nuclear family. In reality her business is well-established and she has several clients in the area since she offers a large variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Elida

texts.es: La señora Elida T. T., tiene 46 años de edad, es soltera, madre de tres hijos, de los cuales solo a uno tiene a su cargo y actualmente cursa el tercer año de secundararia, su sueño ha sido poder acondiconar su casa, sacar adelante a sus hijos, y contiuar con su negocio siendo este la venta de tortillas, venta de frijoles cosidos, cuajada, actividad que tiene desarrollar desde hace 11 años, en su casa de habitacion, su actidad da inicio como una alternativa al desempleo y a la necesidad de obtener un ingresos digno para el hogar, su proposito es poder mas adelante vender refrescos, gaseosas aperturar un pequeño sañon de comida pero requeriria mejorar sus condiciones de vida y local para ofrecer a su clientela razon por la cual trabaja con creditos.-
texts.en:
Elida T. T., 46, is a single mother of three. Only one of her children is still at home, attending middle school. Elida's dream has been to have a good home, provide for her children and continue with her business. She sells tortillas, cooked beans and cuajada (fresh, dry-curd cheese) out of her home. She began her business 11 year ago after becoming unemployed and needed to support her family. Elida wants to add sodas to the food she sells, and eventually open a small diner. She knows that a small diner requires a better place for her customers and better living conditions for her family. This is her reason to work with loans.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: work capital

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Kheav

texts.en:
Mrs. Kheav P. is 38 years old, and she is the mother of seven children. Three of her children attend the local school, while the remaining four children are too young to work or study. She owns a small grocery store in the local market, which is located in Taing Tbeng Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Meanwhile, her husband, Mr. Huon Haor, breeds pigs and cows.

Because her husband's cow-breeding business has been doing very well, he wants to expand the business. Accordingly, Mrs. Kheav P. decided to ask for a loan to buy cows for breeding purposes. This is the second loan Mrs. Kheav P. has sought; previously, she obtained a loan to start a pig-breeding business, and she fully and promptly repaid that loan.

loans.use: To expand her husband's cow-breeding business by purchasing additional cows

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Khhuth

texts.en:
This is the second time that Mrs. Khhuth S. has asked for a loan to improve her living conditions. She is a farmer in Trapaing Phnov Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Aside from this business, she sells Kor fruit, which is used to make pillows in Cambodia. Her husband, Mr. Prang Phalla, is employed by World Vision Organization.

Although Mrs. Khhuth S. and her husband both have an income, they sill cannot afford to build a new house so Mrs. Khhuth S. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Mrs. Khhuth S. is 41 years old and the mother of four children who are all enrolled in the local school. Previously, Mrs. Khhuth S. borrowed $75 from AMK and she has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to add to her saving to build a new house for the household.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Tit

texts.en:
Mr. Tit M., 38, and his wife, Mrs. Ngau Sokny, 38, who live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, have been married for almost twenty years and have five children: two sons and three daughters. One daughter is a garment factory worker and  one other daughter is in local school. The two boys are still young and stay at home. 

Mr. Tit has been a mason since 2002. He does his work in the village and nearby province, while his wife stays at home taking care of the children. Tit travels to work by motor taxi and the cost is very high so he needs to buy a motorbike to use to commute to work. Therefore, he is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 1000 for purchasing a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to use to commute to work

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi: Chị Mỳ năm nay 36 tuổi, hiện chị đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con nhỏ tại Huyện Ninh Giang tỉnh Hải dương. Sau khi được vay vốn 2.000.000 đ của Quỹ tình thương chị đã sử dụng vốn để buôn bán cau. Công việc khá ổn định và cho thu nhập  300.000đ/ tháng. Đến nay không chỉ buôn bán cau vợ chồng chị Mỳ còn nuôi khoảng gần 2000 con chim cút lấy trứng bán. Hàng tháng thu nhập của gia đình chị từ buôn bán cau và bán trứng chim cút đạt 4.000.000 đến 5.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn cho kinh doanh và chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Ms. M., this year is 36 years of age, she presently resides with her husband and 2 small children in Huyen Ninh Giang, province Hai duong. After borrowing 2.000.000d from the organization in which she used to invest into the fishing trade; she has seen a success earning in about 300.000d/month. Not only does she and her husband are in the fisherman trade; Ms. M. also raises about 2000 pigeon and selling their eggs. Every month the family income from selling fish and pigeon eggs ranges between 4.000.000 to 5.000.000d/month. Her next loan, she is requesting an amount of 20.000.000d to invest into doing business and raising farm animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business and raising

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Dinh Thi

texts.vi: Chị Đinh Thị Hương năm nay 37 tuổi. Thời gian đầu khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương gia đình chị làm nghề buôn bán nhỏ. Sau một thời gian sử dụng vốn hiệu quả và tích luỹ kinh nghiệm trong kinh doanh hiện nay gia đình chị đã đầu tư để kinh doanh thịt chó. Đây là một món ăn được rất nhiều khách hàng tại địa phương ưa thích và công việc kinh doanh này đã đem lại cho gia đình chị Hương nguồn thu nhập rất ổn định từ 2.500.000 đến 3.500.000đ/ tháng. Ngoài kinh doanh thịt chó gia đình chị còn chăn nuôi thêm lợn, gà vì thế kinh tế gia đình chị ngày càng phát triển, cuộc sống gia đình chị ngày càng được cải thiện hơn. Với mong muốn được vay thêm vốn để đầu tư kinh doanh tăng thu nhập cho gia đình và tạo điều kiện cho các con ăn học, vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ.
texts.en:
Ms. Dinh Thi H. is 37 years of age. At the beginning when she became part of this organization, she invested in doing small businesses. After seeing a success with the loans she borrowed and the business experiences gained, she decided to invest into selling dog meat. This is a specialty meat that a lot of people in her community really enjoy. The business has bought an increase in Ms. H. family’s income from 2.500.000 to 3.500.000d/month. Beside raising and selling dog meat, the family also raises hogs and chickens. The family’s income is growing and their lifestyles have improved. She hopes to borrow more to invest into her business, thus improving the family’s earnings and creating an educational opportunity for her children. This next loan she is requesting an amount of 20.000.000d.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Sokun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokun K., 40, and her husband, Mr. Sokleang Lim, 45, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2000 and have three children, two sons and one daughter. One of their children is in school and the other two are of preschool age.

Mrs. Sokun and her husband have been selling Chinese noodles and coffee for two years, operating the business in the front of their house. This enterprise is doing very well due to its large daily volume of customers, but the restaurant is small, lacking an adequate number of chairs and tables to serve customers. Therefore, Sokun is requesting a loan of $1000 to expand her restaurant and purchase additional tables and chairs.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mrs. San C., 45, and her husband, Mr. Nun C., 50, live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1985 and have three sons. Two of them are fishermen and other one studies in the local school.

Mrs. San and her husband have been farming since they were young. They grow rice, vegetables, and many kinds of crops on the farm not far from their home. Currently the couple needs money to buy a new staircase to replace the old one that is very old and broken. So San is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a new staircase to replace the old one for her house.

loans.use: To purchase one staircase for her house.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Phun

texts.en:
Mrs. Phun Y., 54, and her husband, Mr. Chay Lao, 72, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1967 and have seven children: three daughters and four sons. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home. Another three work in a plywood factory and the youngest one studies at the local school.

Phun and her husband have been raising pigs for three years; additionally, they farm and fish.  The fishing season will soon arrive, but because Phun's fishing material is very old and beyond repair, she is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase new equipment as well as piglets for their other business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise as well as equipment for the fishing business.

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
Mrs. Nary S., 25, is a single mom with one son. She has eight brothers and sisters. Currently she lives with her parents in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Nary has been a hairdresser for one year, a skill she learned from a beauty salon school in Phnom Penh city. After finishing her skills training, she rented one shop near a market in Phnom Penh to operate her business. Her business is running so well because many customers come to her shop. For almost one year, Nary has saved some money to buy her own shop but still lacks part of the amount. Therefore, Nary is requesting a loan of $1200 to add to her own money to buy a beauty salon shop.

loans.use: To add to her own money to buy a beauty shop.

loans.name: Dinh Thi

texts.vi: Chị Đinh Thị Nhương năm nay 58 tuổi. Hai vợ chồng chị đều là cán bộ hưu trí với thu nhập từ lương hưu 3.500.000đ/ tháng. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương gia đình chị đã có một cửa hàng sửa chữa ô tô tại nhà. Chồng chị vốn là sỹ quan quân đội và là thợ sữa chữa xe ô tô lành nghề vì thế sau khi nghỉ hưu gia đình chị đã vay thêm vốn để đầu tư cho chồng chị  mở rộng quy mô xưởng sửa chữa. Hiện nay để phục vụ nhu cầu khách hàng  ngày càng đông nên gia đình chị đã thuê thêm một thợ phụ. Ngoài thu nhập từ lương hưu, sửa chữa xe ô tô gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ chăn nuôi lợn, gà. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm máy móc phục vụ cho việc sửa chữa ô tô.
texts.en:
Ms. Dinh Thi N. is 58 years of age. She and her husband had retired from civil services with a retirement check of 3.500.000d/month. Before becoming a part of this organization, her family ran a small auto repair shop out of their home. Her husband was a soldier in the military, when he wasn’t working he used his time to repair automobiles as a side job at the family’s business. After he had retired, the family had borrowed extra loans to invest in expanding his auto repair shop. To meet the demands of the growing number of customers he presently have, they had to hire an additional worker to help. Beside the retirement income, the family is able to bring in additional revenues from the shop and from raising pigs and chickens. This next loan, she is hoping to borrow 20.000.000d to invest into buying machinery for the auto repair shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: By machines

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhor T. is a 57-year-old widow with seven children (three sons and four daughters). Three of her children are married and live outside the family home; one daughter is a garment factory worker; another daughter is a silk weaver; yet another daughter assists in her mother's business of selling grocery items; and, her youngest son raises cows. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River, approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Nhor has been selling grocery items for two years. She purchases her inventory from the Preak Anchan market in order to later resell such goods from in front of her house. Currently, she would like to expand her business, but lacks the money to do so. Therefore, Nhor is requesting a loan in the amount of $700 to expand her grocery business and to buy silk materials for her daughter's weaving business.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing grocery items for resale and to purchase silk materials for her daughter's weaving business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch P. (shown on the left in the photo with her group members) was selected to be the group leader by the five other members for a loan from Maxima.  The group participants live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

1-Mrs. Touch P., 39, was married in 1990 and has four daughters. She has been selling jasmine flowers for 18 years, while her husband works as a mason. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase jasmine flowers for resale.

2-Mrs. Sokunthea P., 28, married in 2000, has three children, one son and two daughters. She and her husband have been selling jasmine flowers and bananas since 2000, and now Sokunthea is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase jasmine flowers for resale.

3-Mrs. Dany S., 33, was married in 1999 and has three sons. Dany has been selling jasmine flowers since 1997, while her husband has worked in construction since 1999. Dany is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase jasmine flowers for resale.

4-Mrs. Vorn S., 42, was married in 1986 and has five children, three sons and two daughters. Vorn has been selling jasmine flowers for eight years, while her husband farms. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase jasmine flowers for resale.

5-Mrs. Voeun N., 49, is a widow with four children, two sons and two daughters. Voeun has been selling jasmine flowers since 1998 and is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase jasmine flowers for resale.

6-Mr. Phearin N., 21, was married in 2008. Phearin has been selling jasmine flowers since early this year, while his wife is a garment factory worker. Phearin is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase jasmine flowers for resale.

loans.use: To purchase jasmine flowers for resale.

loans.name: Kimlim

texts.en:
Mrs. Kimlim K., 48, and her husband, Mr. Phem Im, 50, who live in a Phnom Penh suburb, married in 1983 and have two daughters. One of them studies in university in Phnom Penh and other one is a garment factory worker.

Mrs. Kimlim has been selling rice pork for four years. Her husband has been a policeman since 1983. Now, Kimlim is requesting a loan of US$ 700 to pay school fees for her daughter.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her daughter

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Mr. Sothea V., 22, and his wife, Mrs. Tun Vannak, 28, who live in a small village about fifteen kilometers south of Phnom Penh, married in 2008.

Mr. Sothea is a blacksmith. He does his work near his village. His wife used to be a garment factory worker but now she wants to create her own business selling clothes in a market in Phnom Penh, but she lacks the money to buy an initial supply of clothes. Therefore, Sothea is requesting a loan of US$ 1200 to purchase more clothes for his wife to sell.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for re-sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Sokhai

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhai C., 35, and her husband, Mr. Soeun Tel, 30, who live on an Island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2003 and have one son. 

Sokhai has been a silk weaver since she was 15, having learned the skill from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then resells them in Phnom Penh, while Soeun buys recyclable materials for resale. 

Sokhai is now requesting a loan of $250 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Youn

texts.en:
Mrs. Youn C. is 37 years old, and her husband, Mr. Yort Yan, is 39 years old. They live along national road number five, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, and they were married in 1987. In addition, they have two sons and one daughter. Her daughter is an employee at a garment factory.

Mrs. Youn has been selling grocery items for almost ten years, while Mr. Yort has been growing rice since 1981. Besides farming, he also does some construction work to further support their family. Now, Youn is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a plowing machine for her husband's farming business.

loans.use: To improve her husband's farming business by purchasing a plowing machine

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Norn

texts.en:
Ms. Norn S., 27, single and living with her parents in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, has four brothers and sisters. One of her sisters is married and lives outside the family home while another is a garment factory worker. Her youngest brother studies at the local school.

Norn has been a silk weaver for 18 years, a skill she learned from a nearby villager. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village who resells them in Phnom Penh. Now Norn is requesting a loan of $350 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Haleema's Group

texts.en:
Haleema baji is the wife of A. M., and she lives in an area of the city of Lahore known as Walton in Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick, which she has lived in for the last 20 years. Moreover, she is the mother of three daughters, all of whom are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Haleema baji's husband is a painter by profession: he paints doors, walls of houses, and big buildings. In fact, he has been in this business for the last 15 years. Haleema baji, meanwhile, is a cook by profession, and she cooks in several houses. She is applying for a loan in order to buy tools (e.g., paint brushes and paints) for her husband's business.

She is joined in her loan group by the following group members: (1) Shamim baji, who seeks a loan to buy furniture for her clinic; (2) Parveen baji, who requests a loan to buy clothes to resell; and (3) Reeta R. baji, who is in need of a loan to buy materials (e.g., cosmetics and face polishes) for her parlor.

This is a group loan. As such, the loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Importantly, the group members mutually guarantee each other's loans; thus, if one member does not repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for the arrears.

loans.use: To expand and improve her husband's painting business by purchasing paints and paint brushes

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Bashiran's Group

texts.en:
Bashiran Baji is the wife of S. M. and lives in an area named Walton, of city Lahore, Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 28 years. She is the mother of one son and his name is Javed. Javed is married and has one son. Bashiran Baji's husband has a food business. Bashiran Baji also has a business of selling rice. She successfully repaid her three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy material (cooking oil, rice, lentils and spices) for her husband's food business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Naseem Baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Mussarat Baji wants a loan to buy vegetables to resell. Shamim Baji wants a loan to buy shoes to resell. Nasreen Baji wants a loan to buy electric colored lights for her lighte decorater business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy utensils for food business

loans.name: Ayesha's Group

texts.en:
Ayesha Baji is a wife of A. M. and lives in an area of named Walton, of city Lahor, Pakistan. She has been living in this area for the last 25 years. She is the mother of four children: two boys and two girls. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Ayesha Baji's husband is a milk seller by profession. Presently her husband has two buffalos at his home. Ayesha Baji is a housewife and also go for cooking in several houses in her community. She successfully repaid her three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy a buffalo to expand her husband's milk business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Parveen Baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart. Bushra Baji wants a loan to buy leather to make more shoes to sell. Martha Baji wants a loan to buy tools for her business of repairing bicycles.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for her milk business

loans.name: Shama's Group

texts.en:
Shama P. A. is the wife of P. A. and lives in the Walton area of Lahore City, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the last ten years. She is the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her eldest son is in 5th standard, while her youngest son is in 2nd standard. Her daughter is in kindergarten. Shama baji's husband works as a school teacher. Shama baji completed her education until 12th standard, and for the past fifteen years she has been running her own beauty parlor. She is applying for a loan to buy materials (cosmetics and a hair drying machine) for her parlor.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Razia A. R. M. wants a loan to buy cigarettes to resell. Razia W. M. wants a loan to buy plants to resell. Cheema G. M. wants a loan to buy bicycle-repairing tools. Riaz B. M. wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and a hair drying machine for her beauty parlor

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 33-year-old entrepreneur. She is married and lives with her 3 children in Likoni, Mombasa. Her husband works as an office assistant at one of the hospitals in Mombasa. Beatrice is a member of the Bridge of Hope group based in Likoni.

She hawks various items such as used clothes, sweets, and sodas along Likoni beach. She desires to find a permanent place where she can settle and sell her merchandise. She has requested US$400 to add more stock and also to pay rent for her place.

loans.use: To add stock of used clothes and pay rent for her new place

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Sarwar's Group

texts.en:
Sarwar N. K. is the wife of N. K. and lives in the Walton area of Lahore City, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the last 25 years. She has one daughter, named Rakhshanda, who runs a beauty parlor. Her husband is a government servant. Sarwar baji works as a maid in several houses. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a second loan to buy materials (cosmetics, creams, machines, etc.) for her daughter's beauty salon.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Anwar S. H. wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motorized vehicle). Salma A. M. wants a loan to buy construction materials (cement, sand, etc.). Tariza S. M. wants a loan to buy candies and sweets to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and supplies for her daughter's beauty parlor

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a 29-year-old married mother of three children. She lives with her family in Likoni Mombasa Kenya. Her husband is employed as a driver in one of the transport firms. Susan sells fresh juice, an activity she initiated in 2007. She plans to expand her business with a loan in the amount of US$ 400 that she is applying for.

loans.use: To expand her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Kisumu Medical & Education Trust (K-MET) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana A. M. is the wife of A. M. and lives in the Walton area of Lahore City, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the last 35 years. She is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Her eldest son is in 9th standard. Her youngest son is in 5th standard. Her eldest daughter is in 7th standard. Her youngest daughter is in 3rd standard. For the past three years, Rehana baji's husband has had a business renting motorbikes, while she works as a cook in several houses. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a second loan to buy another motorbike for her husband’s business so that they may increase their profits.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Razia S. M. wants a loan to buy vegetables to resell. Mumtaz B. M. wants a loan to buy tools for her workshop. Naseem A. M. wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motorized vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike for her husband's motorbike rental business.

loans.name: Carloyne

texts.en: Carolyne is a 28-year-old married mother of 2 children. She lives in Likoni, Mombasa. She is the proprietor of a school and also has a dressmaking/tailoring shop. She started the school in 2007 and currently offers both kindergarten and primary levels. The school has 75 pupils. In her dressmaking shop she makes African clothes for men and ladies and also sells cosmetics. She has applied for US$600 to improve her dressmaking business.

loans.use: To improve her dressmaking business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline is a 36-year-old entrepreneur and the mother of 2 school-aged children. She lives in Likoni, Mombasa, Kenya.  She began her current business of selling new clothes in 1995. She specializes in women's clothing: skirts, dresses, casual clothes, and bed sheets. She periodically travels to Nairobi and Kampala, Uganda, where she is able to purchase a good variety at wholesale prices. The prime location of her business is on a busy street; her 3 years of experience and her friendly interaction with customers have enabled her to establish a good client base. Roseline plans to expand her business with her next loan of US$800.

loans.use: To add a variety of new stock of clothes

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Suraiya's Group

texts.en:
Suraiya G. R. is a wife of G. R. and lives in Kasur city, Pakistan. Kasur city is famous for its sweetmeat and historical places. She has been living in this city for the last 17 years. She is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a local neighborhood school. Suraiya baji's husband is a daily wage laborer, while she has a business selling clothing and bangles. She collects materials from various places and sells them in Kasur. She has been in this profession for the last four years and is applying for a loan to buy additional bangles and clothing to resell.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Zareena R. M. and Najma Z. A. each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. Safia M. Umar wants a loan to buy mason tools for her husband. Zubaida M. Bota wants a loan to buy clothing to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothing and bangles to resell

loans.name: Rose
