Meanwhile, Vanny has worked as a mason ever since they married. At present, Leab transports her flowers to the market by motor taxi, so she wants to buy a motorbike to drive herself to the market. Therefore, she is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase one motorbike to transport her flowers to sell in Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle in order to transport her flowers to the market in Phnom Penh City.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Chet

texts.en:
Mr. Chet Y. is single and lives with his parents in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. He has five brothers and sisters. Two of his sisters were married and live outside the family home, and another two brothers study in school locally. His parents have a farming business. They grow rice and many types of crops in the village. 

Mr. Chet has been selling cows for four years. He bought them from a nearby village for resale to the middleman in a Phnom Penh suburb. Chet wants to expand his business but lacks the money to do so. Thus, he is requesting a loan of $1000 to buy more cows for resale.

loans.use: To purchase cows for resale.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr:
Madame E. Kossiwa est une femme mariée dynamique qui a pour activité, la vente de produits de premières nécessités dans le quartier d’Agoè au nord de Lomé. Elle est née le 09 janvier 1966 et a quatre (4) enfants. 
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de refaire son stock par l’achat de 10 sacs de riz, 05 sacs de sucre, 8 bidons d’huile et 10 cartons de savons. Elle n’aime jamais avoir de rupture de stock, à cet effet, elle se donne toujours les moyens pour le faire.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kossiwa E. is a dynamic married woman who has a business selling staple items in the neighborhood of Agoè in the northern part of Lomé. She was born on January 9, 1966 and has four children.

This first loan that she is requesting will permit her to refurbish her inventory by buying 10 sacks of rice, 5 sacks of sugar, 8 jerry cans of oil, and 10 cases of soap. She doesn't ever like to run out of the products she sells, so she always manages to have the means to keep her inventory up.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of staples for re-sale

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha S., 32, and her husband, Mr. Tha Nao, 36, who live in a small village about fifteen kilometers south of Phnom Penh, married in 1991 and have two children, one son and one daughter.

Mrs. Sokha has been farming for over ten years. She grows rice and vegetables for re-sale at Ta Khmao market and in her village. Her husband has been selling cows for over ten years as well. He buys them from his villagers for re-sale at a nearby village. Therefore, Sokha is requesting a loan of US$ 400 for her husband to use to purchase more cows for re-sale.

loans.use: To purchase cows for re-sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanna C., 30, and her husband, Mr. Vuthy Him, 35, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married for thirteen years and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Three of their children study in a local school. Her husband is a construction worker.

Mrs. Vanna has been a silk weaver for sixteen years, using a skill she learned from one of her relatives. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Vanna is requesting a loan of $50 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Sina Chaum's Group

texts.en:
Miss Sina C. (shown in picture on the left, with her group member) was selected by her group members to be the group leader for a loan from Maxima (Kiva's Field Partner). In the group there are two families including hers. All the group members live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

1-Miss Sina C. (age 27) is single and lives with her parents. Sina has been a silk weaver for thirteen years, using a skill she learned from her village neighbor. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase silk material for weaving.

2-Mrs. Sokhorn S. (age 25) and her husband, Mr. Sros C., 24, were married in 2004 and have one son. Sokhorn has been a silk weaver for fifteen years, using a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband has been a silk weaver for eighteen years as well. Now Sokhor is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Saret

texts.en:
Mr. Saret C., 34, and his wife, Mrs. Seam Put, 34, who live about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2006 and have no children.

Mr. Saret and his wife have been farming for two years. They grow vegetables for selling to the middle man in the village. Currently, the couple is expanding their farm but lacks the money. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a net to sheathe plants from the sun, seeds, fertilizer, and pay the fee for renting one plot of land to plant vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase a net to sheathe plants from the sun, seeds, fertilizer, and pay the fee for renting one plot of land to do farming.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Revendeuse des produits de premières nécessités dans le quartier d’Agoè depuis 1997, madame A. Abla est née le 13 avril 1957 à Akoumapé, l’un des villages du Togo. Mariée à monsieur LIASSIDJI Yao qui exerce l’activité de maçonnerie, elle a quatre (4) enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Compte tenu du revenu irrégulier de son mari, elle l’aide dans les dépenses de la famille avec le revenu qu’elle tire de son commerce.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de faire son stock par l’achat de 17 sacs de riz, 2 cartons de pâtes alimentaires et 2 cartons de poissons fumés.
texts.en:
Mrs. Abla A., who has been selling staples in the Agoè neighborhood since 1997, was born on April 13, 1957 in Akoumapé, a village in Togo. Married to Mr. Yao Liassidji who is a mason, she has 4 children, all of whom attend school. In view of the irregular income of her husband, she helps support the family with the income she gets from her little business.

This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to replenish her inventory by buying 17 sacks of rice, 2 cases of pasta, and 2 cases of smoked fish.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of staples for re-sale

loans.name: Houn

texts.en:
Mr. Houn H., 57, and his wife, Mrs. Lai Lau, 55, who live along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1972 and have nine children: four sons and five daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home. Two daughters are garment factory workers. One son is a wooden house builder and the other three children study in a local school.

Mr. Houn has been a wooden house builder for over thirty years. Beside his construction business, he also does farming and fishing. His wife does farming. Fishing season is coming soon, and Houn needs a boat for fishing. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase wood to build a boat for fishing and use in the family.

loans.use: To purchase wood to build a boat

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Adjowa Djigbodi

texts.fr:
Madame A. Adjowa Djigbodi est née le 23 novembre 1962 à Notsè, localité située à 100km de la ville de Lomé. Elle est célibataire et a ouvert son magasin de vente des produits de premières nécessités dans son quartier de résidence. 
Pour éviter les ruptures les ruptures de stock, elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour faire des achats de 10 sacs de riz, 8 sacs de sucre et 6 bidons d’huile végétale. Avec ce nouveau stock qu’elle aura à constituer, elle pourra servir les clients qui n’arrivent pas à acheter en gros chez lui.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adjowa Djigbodi A. was born on November 23, 1962 in Notsè, which is situated 100 km from the city of Lomé. She is single and she has opened a little store selling staple items in her neighborhood.

To avoid running out of products, she is requesting this first loan to buy 10 sacks of rice, 8 sacks of sugar and 6 jerry cans of vegetable oil. With this replenished stock that she will be able to get together, she will be able to serve the customers who have not managed to buy wholesale from her.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of staple items for re-sale

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.fr:
Frigoriste de profession, monsieur M. Kokouvi est né le 31 décembre 1963 à Togblékopé dans la préfecture de Golfe. Il est marié et père de 6 enfants. Il exerce l’activité de vente de graviers depuis plus de 22 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter du gravier, le laver puis l’exposer pour la vente. Il est le premier à commencer cette activité dans sa localité et à plusieurs clients qui viennent de part et d’autres de la capitale. 
Ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 7 camions de gravier afin de procéder à son lavage pour pouvoir vendre et gagner beaucoup de bénéfice. Avec ce bénéfice il pourra supporter les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Refrigerationist by profession, Mr. Kokouvi M. was born on December 31, 1963 in Togblékopé in the Gulf Prefecture. He is married and the father of 6 children. He has been selling gravel for more than 22 years. His business consists in buying gravel, washing it, then putting it up for sale. He was the first one to begin this business in his area so he has a lot of customers who come from his own locality and others from the capital.

This first loan that he is requesting will allow him to buy 7 truckloads of gravel that he will then wash and sell at a good profit. With this income he will be able to pay the school fees of his children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of gravel for re-sale

loans.name: Koudilatou Afi

texts.fr:
Madame B. Koudilatou Afi est née le 07 juillet 1972 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la vente des produits de beauté et de mèches dans le quartier de Kégué à Lomé. Cette activité qu’elle a commencée depuis 1993 lui procure de bons revenus
Elle désire acquérir de nouveaux produits de beautés afin de diversifier stock et sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 150 boîtes de ultra beauty, 80 boîtes de Dark lovely et 4 sachets de mèches.
texts.en:
Mrs. Koudilatou Afi B. was born on July 7, 1972 in Lomé. She is married and the mother of three children. Her primary business is selling cosmetics and hair extensions in the Kégué neighborhood in Lomé. This business which she began in 1993 brings in good income for her.

She would like to buy some new cosmetics so as to diversify her inventory and so is asking for this, her first loan to buy 150 boxes of Ultra Beauty, 80 boxes of Dark Lovely, and 4 bags of hair extensions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cosmetics for re-sale

loans.name: Dabarassiwè

texts.fr:
Madame THABANA Dabarassiwé est née à Sokodé en 1952. C’est une ville essentiellement commerciale. Elle est donc initiée des son jeune âge puisqu’elle y a grandi. Elle est aujourd’hui mariée et est mère de quatre enfants. Elle vit aujourd’hui à Lomé avec sa famille et pratique le commerce de pagne et de foulard.
Elle les achète en gros au grand marché de Lomé et les revend en détail dans son quartier.
Depuis 2004 jusqu’alors, sa clientèle a augmenté et elle voudrait prendre ce premier crédit pour augmenter son stock par l’achat de 50 pièces de pagne et de 30 foulard.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dabarassiwé T. was born in Sokodé in 1952. This is an essential commercial town, so she took up commerce at a young age since she was born there. Now she is married and is the mother of four children. She now lives in Lomé with her family and sells "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth) and scarves. She buys her merchandise wholesale at the big open-air market in Lomé and retails her goods in her neighborhood.

From 2004 up to today, her clientele has grown and she would like to have this first loan to add to her stock by buying 50 lengths of "pagne" and 30 scarves.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 50 lengths of "pagne" and 30 scarves for re-sale

loans.name: Essotina

texts.fr:
Née à Bafilo une localité assez éloignée de la capitale du TOGO, madame S. est mariée et a deux enfants. C’est une femme vaillante qui a ouvert une boutique de vente des produits cosmétiques dans le marché de son quartier. Ouvert depuis 2006, sa boutique est la principale de son milieu. Pour l’approvisionnement elle ne va pas loin puisqu’elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de la ville de Lomé où elle vit.
Pour ajouter certains articles à ses divers produits elle sollicite ce crédit premier crédit.
texts.en:
Born in Bafilo, a place that is quite distant from the capital of Togo, Mrs. S. is married and has two children. She is a courageous woman who has opened a little store selling cosmetics in the marketplace in her neighborhood. Her store has been open since 2006 and is the principal one in her area. She does not have to travel far to stock her store, since she does her buying in the big market of Lomé where she lives.

In order to add certain articles to her various products, she is requesting this, her first loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cosmetics for re-sale

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is a 33-year-old mother of two school-going children.  She lives in Likoni Mombasa, Kenya. She is the proprietor of a food kiosk which she initiated in 2007. The business is situated along the busy street off to Likoni ferry. She serves over 200 customers a day and makes Kshs 3000 in daily income. She requires US$ 500 to enable her to move to a more spacious location.

loans.use: Business expansion

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Kisumu Medical & Education Trust (K-MET) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is married with 2 children aged 30 and 28 years old. She has been running her own little restaurant since 2005. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Fatma now hopes for a loan to buy more items for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for the expansion of her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Maryam

texts.fr:
Madame F. est née à Kolina dans la préfecture de Tchaoudjo au TOGO. Elle est mariée et est mère de trois enfants. Elle a compris très tôt l’utilité des micro finances et est à son troisième crédit pour financer son activité qui consiste en la vente de pagnes, de sacs de sortie, et de chaussures. Son activité se déroule dans un milieu très animé ce qui est à son avantage.
Elle à besoin de ce troisième crédit pour augmenter son stock de produit.
texts.en:
Mrs. F. was born in Kolina in the Tchaoudjo Prefecture in Togo. She is married and is the mother of three children. She was quick to understand the usefulness of micro-finances and is on her third loan to finance her business which consists in the sale of "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth), handbags, and shoes. Her business is located in a very busy area which is to her advantage.

She needs this third loan to add more merchandise to her inventory.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "pagnes", handbags, and shoes

loans.name: Mtoro's Hatuyumbishwi Group

texts.en:
Mtoro is a 34-year-old married woman with 3 children. One of her children is 12 years old, the next oldest is 9 years old, and the youngest is 9 months old. She has been selling fish since 2002. On a daily basis, she works from 7 am until 5 pm at her business, and by doing so she can earn a monthly profit of approximately $185 from her fish sales.

Previously, Mtoro received a loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business, and she proudly states that she promptly and successfully repaid that prior loan. Currently, she is seeking another loan to expand her business by buying more fish to resell. She will share the loan proceeds with her fellow group members, who have their own businesses selling clothes, shoes, charcoal, and firewood.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying more fish to resell

loans.name: Salha

texts.en:
Salha is 25 years old. She is married with one child who is 5 years old. She has been a charcoal and firewood seller since 2007. Everyday she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Salha now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Sundi's Nia Njema Group

texts.en:
Sundi is 40 years old. She is married with 7 children between the ages of 10 months and 23 years. She has been a food (soup) seller since 2007. Everyday she works from 6am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Sundi now hopes for a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Rehema, who also has her own business, a salon.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a 31-year-old entrepreneur and the mother of 1 school-aged child. She lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She began her current business of selling dressmaking materials in 1999. She frequently travels to Nairobi to purchase stock at wholesale prices. The prime location of her business on a busy street, her 3 years of experience there, and her friendly interaction with customers have all enabled her to establish a good client base. Monica plans to expand her business with her next loan of US$800.

loans.use: For business expansion

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is 34 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 10 and 2 years old. She has been a food (soup and ugali) seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $215 from her sales.

Farida now hopes for a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more timber, materials, and electronics

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 25 years old. She is married with 3 children, 8 and 3 years old and 1 who is only 3 months old. She has sold clothes (khanga: traditional Tanzanian wraps) and firewood since 2004. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Amina now hopes for a loan to buy more firewood and khanga for her business.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and clothes for her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Mwajuma's Tuache Uvivu Group

texts.en:
Mwajuma is 40 years old. She is married with 5 children between the ages of 3 and 18 years old. She has been a bites (snacks) seller since 1993. Everyday she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Mwajuma now requests a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mwaka.

loans.use: To expand her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Froilan Damian

texts.es:
Froilan es productor de leche de vaca, esta es comercializada en la población para la producción de queso. Por dicha actividad percibe un sueldo quincenal con el cual ayuda a su madre y sus hermanos (cubre manutención y estudios), además trabaja como albañil en la misma población ayudando a construir viviendas. 

Tiene vivienda propia en la población de Palomar, la cual también es habitada por su hermano menor quien le ayuda con el cuidado de sus ganados.
 
El crédito lo destinará en la compra de una vaca lechera, Froilán cree que es hora de incrementar sus ventas.
 
Es su primer crédito con Impro, esta calificado para obtener un préstamo.
texts.en:
Froilan is a dairy farmer who sells the milk to the town's cheese makers. He is paid every two weeks, and uses this income to support his mother and help his brothers with their school expenses. Froilan also works as a construction worker in the same town. He has his own home in Palomar. His younger brother lives with him and helps tending the cows. He will use the loan to buy a milk cow. Froilan thinks it is time to increase production and sales. This is Froilan's first loan with Impro; he has been qualified to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying milk cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Mwatima

texts.en:
Mwatima is 29 years old and married. She has been a firewood and spice seller since 2002. Everyday she works from 7am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

In the past, Mwatima has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania (Kiva's Field Partner) to expand her business. Mwatima now requests a loan to expand her business further by adding to her current stock.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding to her current stock.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 22 years old. She is married with 1 child aged 2 years old. She has been a charcoal and firewood seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $30 from her sales.

Mariam is now requesting a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
MwanaJ. is married with 6 children between the ages of 1 and 17 years old. She has been a charcoal seller since 2007. Everyday she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

In the past, MwanaJ. took out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania (Kiva's Field Partner) to expand her business. MwanaJ. now requests a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for the expansion of her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es:
Aydee tiene 26 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Es una joven madre de familia que se esfuerza para conseguir el sustento diario para su familia, lo hace realizando las tareas del campo, hace 6 años que se casó y empezó a compartir este trabajo con su esposo.Cultiva papa, olluco y algunas verduras como la cebolla, esto lo hace generalmente por las tardes, porque en la mañana trabaja en un programa gubernamental llamado “Wawawasi”, es como una labor de niñera, brinda su casa y su tiempo para cuidar a los niños de otras mujeres, cuando estás salen a trabajar y no tienen con quién dejar a sus hijos.En la época de cosecha su trabajo se intensifica, pero vale su esfuerzo, porque luego llevará a la ciudad para comerciar sus productos directamente; mientras espera a ese momento, también realiza actividades ganaderas, criando animales para engordarlos y luego venderlos, de esa manera, espera los 6 meses para la cosecha. 
Aydee se esfuerza constantemente por el bienestar de sus 3 hijos pequeños.
Con este crédito podrá invertir en la compra de un toro, para que pueda seguir adelante con sus cultivos y el crecimiento de su ganado.
texts.en:
Aydee is 26 years old. She lives with her husband and three children. She is a young mother who strives to obtain daily sustenance for her family, and she does so doing farm work. It was six years ago that she got married and began to share this work with her husband. She grows potato, 'olluco' and some vegetables like onion. She generally does this in the afternoons because in the mornings, she works at a government program called "Wawawasi". There, her work is like that of a nanny- she offers her house and her time to take care of children of other women when they are working and don't have a place to leave their children. During harvest time, her work load increases, but her efforts pay off because she is then able to take her products to the city to sell directly. While she waits for this moment, she also devotes her time to other money making activities such as breeding livestock to fatten and then sell. This is how she passes the time during the 6 month wait until harvest. Aydee constantly strives for her well being and that of her children. With this loan, she will be able to purchase a bull, so she can continue succeeding with her crops and livestock.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a bull to increase the number of her livestock

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther tiene 33 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Es una mujer luchadora, trabaja para ayudar en la economía de su hogar, muchas veces el sueldo de su esposo no alcanza para poder cubrir con los gastos, por lo cual decidió hace  6 años dedicarse a la venta de ropa, para ellos, viaja primero a la ciudad de Lima para adquirir la mercadería y luego se va a las ciudades de Cerro y Carhuamayo, y también Junín, por ello sus viajes son constantes, cada fin de semana.Ahora Esther está embarazada, y no puede realizar constantes viajes,   pero en los próximos meses continuará adelante con su trabajo.
Solicita este préstamo para abastecerse de mercadería, a fin de que pueda reiniciar su negocio, ella a futuro desea tener su propia boutique.
texts.en:
Esther is 33 years old and lives with her husband and their four children. She has a fighting spirit, and works to help out with her household's economics. Many times, her husband's salary cannot cover their expenses, and that's why she decided to dedicate herself to selling clothing 6 years ago. To do this, she goes first to the city of Lima to acquire merchandise, then she goes to the cities of Cerro, Carhuamaya and Junín. She travels constantly, every single weekend. Now Esther is pregnant and she can't make these constant trips, but in the months ahead she will continue forward with her business. She is requesting this loan to stock additional merchandise so that she can restart her business. In the future, she hopes to run her own boutique shop.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her quantity of clothing merchandise

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia tiene 22 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos pequeños hijos en casa de su suegra.
Hace 2 años instaló en su casa una criadero de cuyes, para lo que aprendió todas las indicaciones técnicas necesarias para la criaza de estos animalitos, inició con tan solo 10 cuyes, ahora tiene cerca de 200, los alimenta con lo que ella misma cultiva en su campo, alfalfa, lo que le permite ahorrar costos, además tiene campos de cultivo donde siembra cebada, que también comercializa.Está contenta porque en poco tiempo ha visto los frutos y ganancias de su trabajo, es proveedora de un restaurante turístico que requiere de los cuyes que cría, debido a los  cuidados para con sus animalitos, por la calidad de estos, fueron expuestos en una feria agropecuaria y artesanal de prestigio en su zona, como una de las mejores granjas, esto definitivamente la llena de satisfacción.
Patricia esta motivada, porque  ella quiere seguir creciendo en su negocio, y por el bienestar de sus hijos.
Ahora, solicita un préstamo de 1500 soles que invertirá en implementar  y mejorar su granja de cuyes; además de comprar al por mayor cuyes de raza mejorada, que le servirá para el manejo genético de su criadero.
texts.en:
Patricia is 22 years old and lives with her husband and their two small children in her mother in law's house. Two years ago, she set up a place in her home to raise guinea pigs. She learned everything necessary to raise these small animals. Starting with just 10 guinea pigs, she now has more than 200. She feeds them with the crops she grows in her fields, alfalfa, which allows her to save costs. She grows other crops which she sells in the markets. Patricia is content because after a short time she already sees the results and income from her efforts. She provides guinea pigs for one of the tourist restaurants, thanks to the good care she takes with the animals and the quality. She also took part in a prestigious agricultural fair where she was recognized as one of the best providers - this fills her with satisfaction. She is motivated because she wants to continue growing her business and ensure the well being of her children. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business, improve the pens where she raises the animals, as well as purchase the best guinea pigs, which make up the genetic line of her animals.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make improvements to the pens where she raises guinea pigs, as well as purchase the best guinea pigs which make up the genetic line for her animals.

loans.name: Grimalda

texts.es:
Grimalda tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos.  En busca de mejores oportunidades económicas, hace 2 años, junto a su esposo, se asociaron con su cuñada, empezaron a fabricar todo tipo de muebles de metal; tales como camas, sillas, mesas, entre otros muebles para el hogar, la tarea especifica que desempeña Grimalda en este taller, es la de dar el acabado final con los tapizados o forro para cada mueble, se dedica a este trabajo diariamente, excepto los fines de semana, cuando todo la producción se lleva a las principales ferias de la ciudad. Lo difícil es cuando tienen demasiados pedidos, pero no el tiempo para hacerlos todos. 
Grimalda se esfuerza constantemente porque cada día está motivada por sus 2 hijos, que son pequeños todavía, ella quiere todo lo mejor.
Solicita este préstamo, con el que podrá comprar los diversos materiales que necesita para producir estos muebles, como fierros de diferentes tipos, telas para los tapizados, etc.
texts.en:
Grimelda is 31 years old, lives with her husband and 2 children. 2 years ago while searching for the best economic opportunities, along with her husband and sister-in-law, they began to make all kinds of metal furniture such as beds, chairs, tables, and other furniture for the home. The specific task that Grimalda does in this shop is providing the final touches and upholstery or covers to each piece of furniture; she works daily except on the weekends, when she takes the items produced to the city markets. It is difficult when they have many orders but not enough time to make everything. Grimalda constantly works hard because every day she is motivated by her 2 children, who are still small, as she wants the best for them. She is asking for a loan to be able to buy a variety of materials that she needs for production, such as different types of iron, fabrics for upholstery, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials to make furniture

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea tiene 46 años, es viuda y vive con sus 4 hijos. Ha sabido superar muchas situaciones difíciles, tal es así, que ella hace varios años que  su esposo falleció, y adicional a la enorme pena, la circunstancias la obligaron a ser el único sostén de su hogar, con mucha energía comenzó realizando diversos negocios, y hace mas de un año decide asociarse con su cuñada para emprender una fabrica de muebles de diversos diseños en metal, encargándose ella de tapizar todo los días esos muebles.Esta actividad es la única que le permite sostener a su familiar. Cada día disfruta del trabajo que realiza y no considera dificultades las vivencias diarias que son propias de su trabajo.
Andrea realiza estos esfuerzos porque desea seguir adelante, y de esa manera sus hijos sigan superándose.
Solicita un préstamo con el que comprará al por mayor, fierros, pernos y tela, para así aumentar su producción y capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Andrea is 46 years old and lives with her 4 children. She has learned how to overcome many difficult situations, especially since it has been several years since her husband passed away. In addition to the enormous sorrow, circumstances forced her to become the sole breadwinner in her home. She energetically began various businesses, and more than a year ago she decided to be associated with her sister-in-law to undertake the manufacture of various pieces of furniture fashioned in metal, taking charge of upholstering the furniture every day. This is the only activity that allows her to support her family. Every day she enjoys the work she is doing and she doesn't consider the daily tasks that are part of her work difficult.

Andrea makes this effort because she wants to get ahead, so that her children can get even further than her. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy iron, studs, and fabric wholesale in order to increase her production and her working capital.


Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to manufacture furniture, such as iron, studs, and fabric.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa tiene 38 años, vive con 3 de sus 4 hijos y su esposo.  Ella sabe que trabajar en equipo es más loable, por ello, junto a su esposo decidieron abrir un taller de cerrajería desde hace 15 años, el cual les ha servido para poder sostener a sus 4 hijos, realizan todo tipo de fabricaciones metálicas, tanto muebles, como estructuras para el hogar, como ventanas,  puertas, escaleras caracol, techos metálicos, entre otros.Por la calidad de producción, con el paso de los años Elsa y su esposo pueden ver el incremento  de sus clientes, para los cuales a veces es se ha necesario trabajar hasta los días sábados, su esposo se encarga de cortar y soldar, por su parte, Elsa da los acabados de pintando. 
Esta pareja de esposo se esfuerza para mejorar cada día la situación de la familia, para que sus hijos puedan superarse cada día más, a través de la educación que puedan solventar.
Elsa solicita este préstamo con el que podrá adquirir fierros, materia prima básica para  la elaboración de las construcciones metálicas.
texts.en:
Elsa is 38 years old, lives with 3 of her 4 children and her husband. She knows that working in a team is more commendable, and therefore, together with her husband they decided to open an ironworks shop 15 years ago, which has served to support their 4 children. They make all kinds of metal items, such as furniture, items for the home such as windows, doors, spiral stairs, metal roofs, and more. Because of the quality of their production, over the years Elsa and her husband can see the growth of their customers, and at times they have had to even work on Saturdays. Her husband is in charge of cutting and soldering, and Elsa does the finishing touches and painting. This husband and wife strive to improve their family’s situation every day, so that their children may be successful, and through education they can be free of debt. Elsa asks for a loan with which she will be able to acquire iron, the raw material needed to make the metal items.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire iron, the basic material to make furniture and metal structures

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
Georgina de 58 años, es madre de 5 hijos que ya son independientes y de familia. En la actualidad se encuentra junto a su esposo Luis y su nieto, a quien cuida desde muy pequeño.
Se dedica a la venta de comida (caldo de gallina) desde hace 4 años atrás. Ella se levanta muy temprano (3 am)  para preparar el caldo, y luego venderlo al trabajadores del puerto Miguel Grau. A muy tardar, acaba de vender su caldo a las 6 de la mañana, ya es que un plato muy común para comerse muy temprano por la mañana, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos de su buena atención y buena sazón. 
Georogina trabaja para sus gastos diarios y la educación de su nieto.
Quiere mandar a construir un kiosco, ya que atiende a la intemperie, y desde luego dar una  mejor comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Georgina, 58 years old, is the mother of 5 children who now live independently and have families. At present, she lives with her husband and her grandson whom she has cared for since he was small.

She has been in food sales (chicken broth) for the past 4 years. She gets up very early (3 am) to prepare the broth, and later sells it to workers at the port of Miguel Grau. She sells her broth until at least 6:00 as it is a very common dish to eat in the early morning. What she likes about her work is that her clients feel satisfied with her service and with the flavorful food.

Georgina works to cover her daily expenses and the cost of her grandchild’s education.

She wants to have a kiosk built so that she can serve during bad weather which would be a greater convenience to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a kiosk so she will no longer need to sell her food outdoors.

loans.name: Llensi

texts.es:
La señora Llensi, socia del Grupo Mientras Tanto “LUZ Y ESPERANZA”, vive en la región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, golosinas, productos de limpieza. El negocio está dentro de su domicilio, ubicado en el AA. HH nueva esperanza - 14 de enero L-16 donde acuden diariamente a comprar los moradores, transeúntes del lugar.

Se inicia en el negocio porque quería apoyar a su esposo con las necesidades del hogar y educación de sus menores hijos. 
 
Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en sacos, leche, aceite, conservas en cajas,  fideos, detergentes y papel higiénico en paquetes, gaseosas de diversas marcas, tamaños y sabores, entre otros. Quiere surtir bien el negocio para así poder llegar bien a sus clientes y satisfacer sus necesidades.

Llensi tiene 23 años y 2 hijos, los cuales aún dependen de ella. Cuenta con el apoyo del esposo para atender en el negocio. Su meta en el futuro es tener una tienda de abarrotes y poder vender al por mayor y menor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Llensi is a member of the “Light and Hope" Grupo Mientras Tanto, (a "Grupo Mientras Tanto" is an interim group of borrowers not large enough to form a communal bank). She lives in the region and province of San Martín, in the district of Tarapoto and dedicates herself to the sale of groceries, snacks and cleaning products. Her business is in her home, located at AA. HH New Hope-January 14 L-16, where residents and passers-by come to shop daily.

She began her business because she wanted to support her husband with household expenses and the education of their young children.

With the loan of 500 Soles (about $175), to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy staples such as rice, bags of sugar, milk, oil, packaged goods, pasta, detergent, rolls of toilet paper, and sodas of various brands, sizes and flavors. She wants her store to be well-stocked in order to serve her customers well and to satisfy their needs.

Llensi is 23 years old and has 2 children who depend on her. She relies on her husband to help tend the business. Her goal for the future is to have a grocery store and to be able to sell both wholesale and retail to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy staples such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, packaged goods, etc.

loans.name: Jemima

texts.en: Jemima Q. sells fresh eggs at Kotokoraba Market in Cape Coast. Jemima has received a high school education.  She is a widow and has 2 children. Jemima has been selling fresh eggs since 2001. She is responsible for taking care of her aged father and her brothers in addition to her children's financial needs. Demand for groceries has increased. Her loan will be used to buy more eggs and other groceries to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house for her children.

loans.use: To buy more eggs and other groceries to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Toribio Teofilo

texts.es: Toribio A. tiene vivienda propia (ubicada en Llojeta, ciudad de La Paz), esta casado y tiene dos hijos. Su ocupación laboral es en el ramo de la construcción, en cuanto a su esposa, esta trabaja en una tienda de abarrotes de su barrio. La pareja solicitó un préstamo para construir una nueva habitación que ampliará su vivienda (la cual por cierto es muy pequeña e incómoda). Este es el cuarto préstamo que solicitan, nuestro análisis socioeconómico califica favorablemente a Toribio
texts.en:
Toribio A. owns his own home located in Llojeta in the city of LaPaz. He is married and has two children. His occupation is as a laborer in the construction field. As for his wife, she works in a grocery store in their neighborhood. The couple asked for a loan to build a new room to expand their house, which is certainly quite small and uncomfortable. This is the fourth loan they have requested and our socioeconomic analysis favorably qualifies Toribio.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room in his house

loans.name: Loidith

texts.es:
La señora Loidith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “María Auxiliadora”, vive en la Región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de  bebidas como: gaseosas de diferentes marcas, tamaños y sabores, pulpin, chupetes y agua mineral. El negocio está ubicado en su propio domicilio en el AA. HH. 2 de Febrero, Mz F, L-3, donde espera a sus clientes para darles una buena atención.

Se dedica a este negocio más de un año, gracias a su dedicación, las ventas han aumentado ya que es la única que se dedica a este tipo de negocio en su zona.

Con el préstamo de  S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará gaseosas de diferentes marcas tamaños y sabores, pulpin (jugos), agua mineral con gas y sin gas, bolsitas para chupetes, frutas de diferentes variedades, azúcar, vainilla, etc., y todo lo que necesita para surtir el negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.    

La señora Loidth tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Es una mujer muy trabajadora, su meta es crecer en el negocio, tener una bodega grande y bien implementada para dar mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Loidith belongs to the community bank "María Auxiliadora ”. She lives in the region and province of San Martín in the district of Tarapoto. She sells carbonated drinks of various brands, sizes and flavors, juices, “chupetes” (frozen Popsicles), and mineral water. Her business is located in her own home in AA. HH. February 2nd, Mz F, L-3, where she hopes to give good customer service to her clients.

She has worked in this business more than one year and sales have increased, thanks to her dedication and the fact that hers is the only business of its type in the area.

With this loan of 1,000 Soles (about $350), which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy carbonated drinks of various brands, sizes and flavors. Also juices, mineral water (with and without carbonation), bags for “chupetes”, a variety of fruits, sugar, vanilla, and all that is necessary to stock her store so that she can satisfy the needs of her customers.

Loidith is 31 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children. She is a very hardworking woman whose goal is to build her business to have a large, well-stocked general store to offer convenience to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase carbonated drinks, juices, mineral water, fruits, bags for "chupetes", etc.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier P. V. tiene casa propia en la zona de Tacagua, esta casado y tiene dos hijos. Javier trabaja como tramitador independiente en la alcaldía de La Paz (por ejemplo, ayuda a los ancianos haciendo diligencias, consiguiendo documentos, haciendo sellar y revisar tales documentos, etc.). 

El muro frontal de su vivienda sufrió un derrumbe por el deterioro de las paredes de adobe (antiguo, obsoleto y peligroso material por que se remoja fácilmente). Es por eso que necesita el crédito para reconstruir el muro frontal, esta vez con cemento y ladrillo.  Es la quinta vez que confía en nosotros y como siempre, nuestra evaluación indica que es apto para recibir un nuevo préstamo.
texts.en:
Javier P. V. owns his own house in the zone of Tacagua. He is married and has two children. Javier works as an independent “tramitador” (someone who expedites transactions) in the municipality of La Paz. (For example, he helps the elderly with legal procedures, obtains documents, revises and stamps those documents, etc.)

The front of his house suffered a collapse because of the deterioration of the adobe walls (the old, obsolete and dangerous material soaks through easily). That is why he needs credit to rebuild the front wall—this time with concrete and brick. This is the fifth time he has come to us for credit and, as always, our evaluation indicates that he is eligible for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repair

loans.name: Luciola

texts.es:
La señora Luciola, socia del Banco Comunal “LAS FLORCITAS DEL PROGRESO II”, vive en la región y provincia de San Martín, Distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de productos Naturales Omnilife.

Se inició en el negocio por mejorar su salud y su economía, ahora ya tiene muchos clientes porque vende al menudeo dándole facilidades de pago, cuando empezó no era conocida, quienes llegan a su casa y algunas veces ella tiene que salir a captar más clientes.

Con el préstamo de  S/. 800, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará más productos Omnilife en frascos y sobres de Omniplus, Optimus, Teatino, Cafecito y otros productos que son muy requeridos por sus clientes.

La señora Luciola tiene 52 años, vive con su esposo y una hija que está a su cargo. Es una mujer muy responsable, carismática y sobre todo decidida. Su meta es comprar una vitrina donde pueda exhibir sus productos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luciola, member of the Communal Bank "Las Florcitas del Progresso II" (The Flowers of Progress II), lives in the region and province of San Martin, District of Tarapoto. She sells the Omnilife Naturals product line. She started the business to improve her health and finances and now has many clients because she sells retail thus allowing payment ease. When she started she was unknown, but now many come to her house although sometimes she has make an effort and go out to garner new clients. With this loan for $275, which she will pay back in 4 months, she'll buy more Omnilife products in jars and single serving envelopes of Omniplus, Optimus, Teatino, Cafecito, and other products that are in high demand with her clientele. Mrs. Luciola is 52 years old and lives with her husband and daughter. She is a very responsible, charismatic, and above all very determined. Her goal is buy a display case where she can showcase her products.

Translated from Spanish by Liz West, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural products.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima M. is married and has two children. She completed her schooling through senior high school. She is a hairdresser who has owned a beauty salon in Kotokoraba since 2000. Her husband is an electrician.

Salima uses her income to help her husband take care of the family. She will use this loan to purchase more cosmetics and hair products to meet the demands of her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Salima plans to improve the conditions of the salon to attract more customers.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics and hair products for her salon.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Marileth

texts.es:
MARILETH, socia D. Grupo Mientras Tanto “LUZ Y ESPERANZA II”  natural D. departamento y provincia de San Martín,  distrito de Juan Guerra. Se dedica a la venta y el alquiler de CD Y DVD de distintas variedades como películas y músicas, también vende fajas para bajar de peso, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su propio domicilio en el Jr. Santa Eufracia Nº 360.

Se inició como ambulante en las ferias, ahora atiende donde vive. Tiene como clientes a todo tipo de personas, sobre todo a los niños que recurren buscando sus dibujos animados y a sus amigas que buscan mejorar su figura, quienes atiende con mucha amabilidad.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará CD Y DVD de distinta música, películas y dibujos animados, también piensa invertir en fajas para bajar de peso y en algunos pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, para que ellos estén satisfechos y encuentren lo que deseen.

Marileth, tiene 19 años y 1 hija. Está contenta con lo que hace, es muy perseverante, independiente, con ganas de seguir adelante. Uno de sus objetivos es el tener que implementar más el negocio con pelotas, peluches y artículos de regalo, pero en un local fijo y estratégico.
texts.en:
Marileth, member of the Group "Mientras Tanto Luz y Esperanza II" (As Long as There's Light and Hope II), is a native of the department and province of San Martin, district of Juan Guerra. She sells and rents CDs and DVDs of different types of movies of music. She also sells weight loss girdles and her business is located in her own home at Jr. Santa Eufracia Nº 360. She started as a traveling saleswoman in the markets and now does business out of her home. She has many different types of clients that she attends to with great kidness, from children looking for their favorite cartoons to her friends looking to improve their figures. With this loan for $350, which she'll repay in 6 months, she'll buy CDs and DVDs of varying music styles, movies and cartoons, as well as more weight loss girdles. This will fulfill client requests and ensure that they are satisfied and can find what they desire. Marileth is 19 years old and has a daughter. She is happy with her livelihood and is very persistent and independent with desires to get ahead. One of her goals is to expand her business with toys, stuffed animals, and gift items into a permanent and strategic location.

Translated from Spanish by Liz West, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy CDs and DVDs

loans.name: Nuhu

texts.en:
Nuhu M. sells bread that he bakes himself at Ramblers in Cape Coast. Nuhu is married and has one child. He received a senior high school education. His wife is a food seller.

Nuhu has been a baker since 2002. He is responsible for taking care of his family's financial needs. His loan will be used to buy flour, margarine, sugar, and other ingredients for baking. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to build a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy flour, margarine, sugar, and other ingredients for baking.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Magali

texts.es:
La señora Magali, socia del BC “Las Margaritas II”, vive en la Región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo. Se dedica a la venta de anticuchos de carne, de pollo y asados al carbón. Desarrolla el negocio en las afueras de su domicilio, situado en el Jr. San Martin C- 3, del mismo distrito donde vive, lugar donde diariamente acuden su comensales, que son moradores de la propia localidad o transeúntes de lugares cercanos.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará los insumos para la preparación de los alimentos como arroz, azúcar, carnes de res, pollo, y cerdo, también en kilos comprará cecina, chorizo, lo que le permitirá variar los platos que ofertará a sus clientes y atender la petición de sus clientes.
 
Magali es una mujer entusiasta de 28 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo a quien quiere darle un futuro mejor. Su meta es comprar un terreno para construir una casa, porque por ahora vive en la casa de sus padres, también poner un negocio en su propio domicilio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Magali, member of the Communal Bank "Las Margaritas II", lives in the region and province of San Martin, district of La Banda de Shilcayo. She sells meat and chicken kebabs, as well barbecue. The business is located outside her home, located in Jr. San Martin C-3, of the same district. A location that is visited daily by her clientele, people from her own neighborhood or from nearby locations. With this loan for $350, that she'll repay in 4 months, she'll purchase the ingredients for her food preparation business such as rice, sugar, meat, chicken, and pork. She'll also buy cured meat and chorizo buy the kilo which will allow her to vary the plate offerings and satisfy customer requests. Magali is an enthusiastic 28 year old. She lives with her husband and a son that she would like to provide with a better future. Her goal is to buy a piece of land to build a house because they live in her parents house now. She would also like to continue her business in her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Liz West, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as rice, sugar, meat, chicken, and pork for her food preparation business.

location.town: La Banda de Shilcayo - San Martín

texts.es:
La señora Magali, socia del Banco Comunal “Las estrellitas de Jorge Chávez II”, vive en el departamento y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su domicilio ubicado en el Jr. José Saavedra  C-3 MZ B L8. Generar ingresos diarios y las ganas de ayudar económicamente a su esposo para hacer estudiar a sus tres hijos, la motivó a iniciarse en el negocio, además le gusta estar en contacto permanente con sus amigos y clientes. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 600, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará diversos abarrotes como jabón en caja de diferentes marcas (marsella, bolívar, jumbo, etc.), papel higiénico en paquetes, conservas de pescado, aceite por litros, arroz, azúcar, lejía, detergente, leche de diferentes marcas y tamaños para ofertar a sus clientes.

Magali tiene 32 años y 3 hijos, quienes están estudiando. Junto con su esposo comparten la atención en el negocio. Siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer trabajadora y responsable con las labores asumidas. Desea en el futuro ampliar el negocio, llegar a poner cabinas de Internet y fotocopiadora.
texts.en:
Mrs. Magali, member of the Community Bank “The Stars of Jorge Chavez II,” lives in the state of San Martin province, Tarapoto District. She has a small store where she sells groceries , in Jr. Jose Saavedra C-3 MZ B L8. Earning a daily salary and helping her husband financially ensure their three children get an education were motivation for her to start the business, as well as, keep in touch with her friends and clients.

With a loan 600 soles, which will be repaid in 4-months, Mrs. Magali will purchase various groceries, several brands of soaps (Marsella, Bolivar, Jumbo, etcs…), rolls of toilet paper, canned fish, liters of oil, rice, sacks of sugar, bleach, detergent and different brands and sizes of milk to offer customers.

Mrs. Magali is 32-years old, and has three children who are currently studying, who along with her husband help out with the business. Her efforts are highlighted by the hard work and responsibilities she takes on. In the future, she would like to grow the business and set up internet booths and photocopying services.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy general store items (soap, toilet paper, canned fish,bleach, etc.)

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is single. He lives with his parents in Kamenka. However, he earns his own living and even helps his parents financially. Denis's passion has always been woodwork. He learned the skill when he was a young kid. Ever since, he's been experimenting and learning new things. Experience he gained in the process helped him start his own small business manufacturing furniture about 3 years ago. Denis has an individual approach to each client. He always tries to please his customers even when they have very sophisticated taste.

Denis doesn't have to face high competition. However, he always aims at high quality and wants to have all his clients pleased with the result of his work. Denis has been in business for 3 years. Currently, he has about US$ 5000 invested in materials. His income is about US$ 800 a month. Denis is requesting a loan of 3000 Grivnas to purchase additional raw materials to be able to provide his customers with even better quality and trendy furniture pieces.

Denis always has much demand for his products as there are constantly new offices and stores being built. One of Denis's long-term plans is purchase a new workshop facility and a separate one for his office. He believes the current loan brings him one step closer to the fulfillment of his dream. Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in 2 months.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera is a small market vendor from Energodar. She is the mother of two grown daughters, aged 25 and 22.  Vera sells groceries in the local market called "Rainbow". Her business is in a very good location which makes it a favorable shopping spot for her customers. 

Vera started her venture only 6 months ago. She has already invested about $4000 in merchandise and her monthly income is about $600-800. She has had some tough times recently because her son had a bad car accident and his health suffered.  However her business generated enough profit to help him financially and cover all his medical expenses.

Vera would like to see her business grow by purchasing additional equipment to make her enterprise run more efficiently.  She would like to increase her product line to include perishable goods.  The government health care agencies will not issue permission for such a product line unless she purchases a refridgerated stand.  She is seeking a loan of 5000 Grivna ($1075) to purchase the new fridge.   Vera wants to keep her products fresh and healthy and to see more customers attracted to her stand.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerated stand

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Marbelita

texts.es:
La señora Marbelita, socia del Banco Comunal “MARIA AUXILIADORA”, vive en la región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la  venta de artículos de limpieza, sobre todo para utensilios de cocina, en un  puesto de venta que esta situado en el Jr. Andrés Avelino Cáceres C-4, mercadillo Tarapoto.

Se inició en el negocio porque le gusta, poco a poco aprendió el manejo de esta actividad ante la necesidad de generar ingresos para sostener a su familia. Está contenta con lo que ha logrado gracias a este negocio.  

Con el préstamo de S/. 800, el cual pagará en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de productos como escobillas, esponjas de diferentes variedades  para el lavado de los utensilio de cocina y ollas, además quiere implementar el negocio con ollas. Los productos se lo envían de la capital. Quiere surtir bien su negocio porque la clientela son en su mayoría mujeres y muy exigentes .

Marbelita tiene 67 años de edad, es natural de Tarapoto, tiene 6 hijos, todos ya mayores e independientes. Se caracteriza por ser gentil, atenta con sus clientes, tranquila y con plena confianza en lo que hace. En un futuro piensa poner otro negocio en un puesto más grande y sobre todo seguro.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marbelita, member of the Communal Bank "Maria Auxiliadora", lives in the region and province of San Martin, district of Tarapoto. She sells cleaning supplies and kitchen utensils from a stand located on Jr. Andres Aveline Caceres C-4 in the Tarapoto market. She started the business because she enjoys it and has learned little by little to manage the business better in order to generate profits to support her family. She is happy with what she has accomplished thanks to this business. With this loan for $275, which she'll repay in 4 months, she'll purchase products such as brooms and various types of sponges for washing dishes and pans. She also wishes to expand the business by selling pots and pans. Her products are sent from the capital. She wishes to fully stock her business as the majority of her clients are women and very demanding. Marbelita is 67 years old and a native of Tarapoto. She has 6 children, all of whom are adult and independent. She is characterized by her gentleness, customer attentiveness, calmness, and self-confidence. In the near future she would like to expand her business to a larger and secure location.

Translated from Spanish by Liz West, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products such as brooms, sponges, and pots.

loans.name: Dmytryi

texts.en:
Dmytryi and his family live in Kahovka. After Dmytryi resigned from his previous job, he decided to start his own business which would allow him to spend more time with the family. Today, Dmytryi owns a construction supplies business and sells his inventory from a vending wholesaler called Megapolis. The business is the only source of income for his family. Dmytryi works very hard in order to bring in enough income.

Dmytryi has been in this business for 3 years. Currently, his monthly income is about US$ 400. His turnover capital is over $5000. Dmytryi would like to get a loan in the amount of 5000 Grivnas to generate additional profit. One of his long-term plans is to eventually expand his business.

We are confident that the modesty, diligence, and responsibility that have helped Dmytryi develop his venture and gain a good reputation among other entrepreneurs will help him promptly repay this loan and allow him to succeed in his business endeavors.

loans.use: To generate additional profit

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
La señorita Margot, socia del Banco Comunal “Maria Auxiliadora”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de  leña, huevos, carbón y por las noches vende asados a la parrilla. El negocio está ubicado en su domicilio en el AA. HH 2 de febrero Mz L2 , distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, lugar donde acuden los clientes, los cuales son los moradores de su barrio.
  
Con el préstamo de S/ 500, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará leña en gran cantidad, huevos en casilleros, aceite en galón, pollo, condimentos (cominos, pimienta, ajos, etc.), sal, plátanos y otros ingredientes que a diario compra para la preparación de sus asados y de esa manera poder surtir el negocio y asegurar las ventas.

Margot es una mujer joven entusiasta y alegre. Está contenta con lo que hace porque le permite solventar sus gastos de estudio. Desea conseguir más adelante su propio negocio, quiere una bodega bien surtida.
texts.en:
Miss Margo, member of the Communal Bank "Maria Auxiliadora", lives in the San Martin region, province and district of Tarapoto. She sells wood, eggs, charcoal, and grilled items during the evenings. Her business is located in her home at AA. HH 2 de febrero Mz L2, district of Banda de Shilcayo, which is where her clients come, clients that are the residents of her neighborhood. With this loan for $175, which she will pay back in 4 months, she'll buy large quantities of wood, eggs by the case, oil by the gallon, chicken, spices (cumin, pepper, garlic, etc.) salt, plantains, and other ingredients that she purchases daily to prepare her grilled items and thus stock her business and ensure sales. Margot is a young enthusiastic and happy woman. She is content with her work as it allows her to cover the cost of her studies. Later on she would like to have her own small business, a well-stocked grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Liz West, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood, eggs, oil, chicken, spices, plantains, etc.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina sells clothing in one of the local markets in the town of Kahovka, Kherson region. She has been a skillful entrepreneur for 13 years. She started her own venture when she could not financially survive on the salary from her previous job. Her business inventory has grown to the scale of about $2000 in value and her net monthly profit is about $450.

Since divorcing from her husband, she has adjusted to her new lifestyle.  She wants to secure steady sales and income since she is the sole breadwinner for her family.

Valentina is seeking a loan of 5000 Grivnas ($1075) to increase the assortment of merchandise in her kiosk.  She believes that this loan will provide her with enough capital to meet her customers' demands, as well as provide the basic needs of her family.  This would definitely be a win-win situation.

loans.use: To increase assorted merchandise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Viktor

texts.en:
Viktor is married and lives in Kahovka, a town in Kherson region.  He works as a taxi driver. He loves being self-employed and managing his own time. Viktor has a nice car and offers taxi services around his region. He is a workaholic and is always ready to work non-stop, even on the weekend. Viktor has been in this business for 3 years and his monthly profit is about $400. 

Viktor is requesting a loan of 5000 Grivnas ($1075) to cover some of the current vehicle maintenance expenses to keep his taxi in good working order.  This will generate additional profit as he finds more clients. This business is a crucial segment of his life since it is Viktor's opportunity to support his family.

loans.use: To generate additional profit

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Maria Cruz

texts.es:
La Señora Maria Cruz, socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen del Pilar”, vive en la región de San Martín, provincia de Lamas, distrito de Zapatero y caserío de Nuevo Celendin. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, juanes y asados por las tardes. Recién está empezando en la venta de abarrotes, la actividad lo realiza  en su propio domicilio, donde acuden diariamente a comprar los vecinos de su  comunidad.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual pagará en 06 meses, comprará  productos de primera necesidad como sacos de arroz, azúcar, cajas de leche, aceite, conservas, paquetes de fideos, detergente y papel higiénico entre otros, para surtir mejor su negocio y cubrir las necesidades de los clientes.

María vive con su esposo y con su último hijo, el cual todavía depende de ella, ambos la apoyan tanto en la casa como atendiendo a los clientes. Su meta es implementar más su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Cruz, a member of Community Bank “Virgen del Pilar,“ lives in the region of San Martin, Lamas province in the district of Zaptero, village of Nuevo Celendin. She sells groceries, juanes (a typical dish of rice and meat wrapped in a bijao or banana leaf) and roasts in the evenings. Her business is located in her own home, where neighbors come by daily to make purchases.

With a loan of $500 US dollars, which will be repaid in six-months, she will buy basic needs such as sacks of rice, sugar, cartons of milk, oil, preserves, packets of noodles, detergent, rolls of toilet paper and other things. All this to stock her business well and ensure that she meets her customers’ needs.

Maria lives with her husband and youngest son, who still depend on her; they help around the house and attend to the customers. Their goal is to eventually gain more business.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic needs like rice, sugar, milk, bleach, oil, preserves, etc.

loans.name: Maria Amelia

texts.es:
La señora Maria Amelia, socia del Banco Comunal “DORADINAS EN ACCION”, vive en el Departamento de San Martín, provincia de El Dorado, distrito de San José de Sisa. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, menestras y carne de aves en su puesto de venta que ella tiene en el mercado nuevo de la ciudad de sisa. Generar ingresos diarios y las ganas de salir adelante, la motivaron a iniciarse en el negocio, además le gusta estar en contacto permanente con sus amigos y clientes. 

Con el préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará diversos productos como jabón de diferentes marcas y tamaños (marsella, bolívar, jumbo, etc.), papel higiénico en paquetes, conservas de pescado, aceite por litros, arroz, azúcar en sacos, lejía, detergente, leche de diferentes marcas y tamaños, gallinas, maní, papa y diferentes tipos de menestras para ofertar a sus clientes.

Maria Amelia tiene 55 años, 3 hijos, de los cuales 2 ya son independientes, cada uno con su familia. Ahora vive con su esposo y uno de sus hijos que aún está a su cargo y está estudiando, ambos la apoyan en el negocio. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable con las labores asumidas, desea en el futuro ampliar y surtir más el negocio,  quiere vender al por mayor.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Amelia, member of the Community Bank "Doradinas en Acción," lives in the state of San Martín, province of El Dorado, district of San José de Sisa. She has a small store where she sells groceries, dried beans and grains and chicken from her stand in the city of Sisa's new market. Earning a daily salary and getting ahead in life were motivation to start the business, as well as liking the contact with friends and clients. With the $350 loan, to be paid in four months, she will buy a wide variety of products to offer her clients, such as soap of different brands and sizes (Marsella, Bolívar, Jumbo, etc.), packs of toilet paper, canned fish, oil by the liter, rice, sacks of sugar, bleach, detergent, different brands and sizes of milk, hens, peanuts, potatoes and different dried beans and grains. María Amelia is 55 years old with three children, two of which are independent and have their own families. She lives with her husband and her one child that still goes to school. They both help her out with the business. She is a hard-working woman and responsible with the work she takes on. For the future she wants to make her business larger both in size and in amount of products stocked, and she wants to sell wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan Paluck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of products for her store: soap, toilet paper, canned fish, oil, etc.

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Justine Nabanoba's Group

texts.en:
Justine is the leader of a 5-member group. She is a 28-year-old married woman with 2 children aged 6 and 4 years old. Both her children go to school. She owns and resides in a three-roomed house, living with no additional family members. There is no electricity and piped water. The family gets three meals a day.

Justine resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Justine works seven days a week and rents her working place. She deals in household goods and sells to all categories of people, both wholesale and retail. Justine sells to an average of 40 people per day and buys the items from Kasubi. She uses public transport back to her home. Justine has been in this business for the last five years .She is also rearing chickens in her village.

Justine has been with MCDT for one year and is servicing her second loan, working all this time with the same group. Her major challenges are those of damaged goods and transportation costs. She wants to increase stock in her business. She aspires to construct rental houses in the free space near her home. .

loans.use: to increase the inventory of her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Micro Credit Development Trust SACCO (MCDT) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora María, socia del Banco Comunal “LAS FLORCITAS DEL PROGRESO II”, es natural del departamento y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de comida tipo menú. El negocio está ubicado en su domicilio en Jr. Colón sector Atumpampa.

Se inicia en el negocio porque le gusta trabajar y apoyar en los gastos de la educación de sus hijos. Le va muy bien, ya tiene muchos clientes quienes la esperan para comprar su rico menú.

Con el préstamo de S/. 500, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará arroz en saco, aceite en galón, saco de azúcar, condimentos y los insumos que a diario compra en el mercado como carnes, verduras, etc. Quiere satisfacer las exigencias de los clientes que a diario la visitan. 

María tiene 44 años y 4  hijos varones,  pero ahora sólo uno está a su cargo. Se siente feliz porque tiene el apoyo de su esposo y el de su hijo, quienes la ayudan en la preparación de los alimentos a pesar de la edad que tiene. Su meta es implementar y mejorar su domicilio donde pueda dar una buena atención a los clientes y ellos puedan disfrutar de sus ricos preparados.
texts.en:
Señora María, member of the community bank "Las Florcitas del Progreso II," is from the state and province of San Martín, district of Tarapoto. She sells food restaurant-style from her house in the sector of Atumpampa. She started the business because she likes to work and contribute to pay her children's educational expenses. She is doing well; she already has many clients that always buy from her delicious menu. With the $ 175 loan, to be paid in four months, she will buy rice in sacks, oil by the gallon, sacks of sugar, herbs and spices and the daily ingredients such as meat, vegetables, etc. She wants to satisfy what her daily clients expect. María is 44 years old with four boys, and is still taking care of one of the boys. She is content because she has the support of her husband and her son, who help her in the preparation of food despite his age. Her goal is to improve the space in her house so that she can provide better service to her clients and they can enjoy her great food.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan Paluck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy rice, oil, sugar, spices and other ingredients.

loans.name: Maria Ysabel

texts.es:
La Señora Maria, socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen del pilar”, vive en la región de San Martín, provincia de Lamas, distrito de Zapatero y caserío de Nuevo Celendin. Se dedica a la venta de granos como café, cacao y frijoles que cosecha de su chacra, los productos los vende en la ciudad de Tarapoto.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 06 meses, comprará abonos para  asegurar una buena producción, también comprará cerdos para engordar y vender, también pagará la mano de obra de los peones que trabajan en su chacra tanto en el cultivo como en el cuidado de las plantas.

María vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos que todavía dependen de ella. Su familia la apoyan en casa y en las actividades de la chacra para asegurar una buena cosecha. Su meta es cultivar tomate y vender en cantidad.
texts.en:
Señora María, member of the community bank "Virgen del Pilar," lives in the region of San Martín, province of Lamas, district of Zapatero and the neighborhood of Nuevo Celendin. She sells the grains such as coffee, chocolate and beans that is harvested from her farm. She sells in the city of Tatapoto. With her $350 loan, to be paid in six months, she will buy fertilizer to guarantee good production, and will also buy pigs to fatten up and sell. She will also pay the farmhands that work on her land, cultivating and taking care of the plants. María lives with her husband and her four children that still depend on her. Her family helps her out in the house and in the farm's labor to assure a good harvest. Her goal is to grow tomato and sell in large quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan Paluck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy fertilizers and pigs, and pay for labor in her farm.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La señora Marina, socia del Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora D. la Paz”, vive en la región y provincia D. San Martín, distrito D. Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta D. pollos eviscerados. El negocio se ubica en el mercado No 02, lugar donD. tiene un puesto D. venta y donD. acuden a diario a comprar gran cantidad D. clientes, también reparte en las bodegas y pollerías D. la ciudad. 

Con el préstamo D. S/  3,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará pollos en grandes cantidades para luego sacrificarlos y poder proveer a los clientes D. las diferentes bodegas y pollerías D. la ciudad, además comprará  alevinos D. gamitada porque va a comenzar a criar esta especie para luego ponerlo a la venta.

Marina es una mujer entusiasta D. 49 años, se siente contenta D. estar alcanzando sus objetivos propuestos, está creciendo en el negocio, pues tiene asegurada la venta. Su meta es implementar el negocio, poner un criadero D. peces para criar y vender peces y abastecer al mercado local.
texts.en:
Señora Marina, member of the community bank "Nuestra Señora D. la Paz," lives in the region and province of San Martín, district of Tarapoto. She sells cleaned chicken. Her business is located in Market No. 2, where she has a stand where a great number of clients come to buy daily. She also delivers to stores and chicken stands around the city. With the $1,000 loan, to be paid in six months, she will buy chickens in large quantities to later slaughter and be able supply clients at the different groceries and chicken stores throughout the city. She also plans to buy young fish of the type named "Gamitada," because she will begin to raise this species and later sell it. Marina is an enthusiastic 49 year-old woman. She is happy to be fulfilling her planned objectives; her business is growing and her sales are guaranteed. Her goal is to set up the fish farm: sell fish and supply the local market.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan Paluck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy chicken

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La señora Marisol pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Moralinas”, vive en la Región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Morales. Se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de chupetes de frutas regionales y gelatinas de diferentes sabores. El negocio está ubicado en su propio domicilio en Jr. Sucre N° 132, desde donde ella sale a recorrer las calles de la ciudad y lugares donde se realizan diferentes tipos de eventos sociales. 

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,500, el cual pagará en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de frutas, coco, maní, leche, gelatinas y flan en paquetes, azúcar en saco blanca y rubia, bolsas, vasos, cucharitas descartables en millares, para satisfacer el gusto de los clientes. Le va bien gracias a la higiene y el buen trato que da a los clientes. Marisol refiere que en estos últimos tiempos las ventas han aumentado y piensa que se debe al clima caluroso. 

Marisol es una mujer optimista, trabajadora y emprendedora, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos que la apoyan en la preparación y venta de los productos. Su meta es distribuir los chupetes y gelatinas a las bodegas y estudiar repostería.
texts.en:
