Señora Marisol belongs to the community bank "Las Moralinas." She lived in the region and province of San Martín, district of Morales. For ten years she has sold popsicles in regional fruit flavors and gelatin snacks. Her business is located out of her own house on the street Sucre No. 132, where she leaves to sell in the city streets and at places where there are different types of social events. With the $500 loan, to be paid in six months, she will invest in buying fruits, coconuts, peanuts, milk, gelatin and flan in packets, refined and unrefined sugar, bags, cups, plastic spoons in bags of thousands--all to be able to satisfy her clients. She's doing well thanks to the cleanliness and good service that she provides for her clients. Marisol says that lately her sales have increased and she thinks that's due to the heat. Marisol is an optimistic, hard-working and enterprising woman. She lives with her husband and her three children who help her with the preparation and sales of her goods. Her goal is to start distributing the popsicles and gelatin treats to stores and start studying to become a pastry chef.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan Paluck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruit, coconuts, peanuts, milk, gelatin, flan, sugar, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La señora Martha, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Moralinas”, vive en la Región y Provincia San Martín, distrito de Morales. Se dedica desde hace 3 años a la venta de Salchipapas, pollo broster, arroz chaufa y refrescos. Vende frente a la casa de su mamá, ubicado en el Jr. aviación c-3, lugar donde  acuden diariamente los comensales, los cuales son estudiantes de la UNSM, vecinos y amigos. 

Con el préstamo de S/ 800, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar y papas en sacos, aceite en galones, cremas como salsa de tomate (ketchup), mostaza en baldes, carne, verduras, huevos y otros insumos que necesita para la preparación de sus platos, también quiere comprar un licuo extractor, mesas, sillas y contar con lo necesario para aprovechar las fiestas patronales de su comunidad. 

Martha tiene 51 años, es una mujer decidida, alegre y buena administradora. Tiene como meta implementar el negocio con más mesas y sillas porque la clientela va en aumento.
texts.en:
Ms Martha, who belongs to the group "Las Moralinas," lives in the province known as San Martin in the district of Morales. She has been selling Salchipapas ( a dish of sliced beef hot dogs and French fries), fried chicken, and arroz chaufa (a rice dish with chicken, bacon and ham ) as well as various drinks, for three years now. She sells her products in front of her mother's house, located near a local market where they sell daily to many customers, most of whom are students at UNSM (the University), other are neighbors and friends.

With this loan of $275, which will be repaid in a period of 6 months, she will purchase rice, sugar and potato sacks as well as vegetable oil by the gallon and condiments such as ketchup and mustard. She will also purchase meats, vegetables, eggs and other groceries that she needs to prepare her dishes. She also needs to buy a liquid extractor, tables, chairs and plan to stock necessary items for the parties that are held in her community.

Martha is 51 years old, she is dedicated, happy and a good administrator. She would like to meet her goal of seeing her business grow and expand with more tables and chairs to attract more customers.


Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, potatoes, vegetable oil, eggs and vegetables

loans.name: Martita

texts.es:
La señora  Martita pertenece al Banco comunal “LAS AGUERRIDAS II”, vive en la Región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la cerrajería, confecciona duplicados de todo tipo de llaves. El negocio funciona en su propio domicilio situado en el Jr. 3 de octubre Nº 298 del centro poblado 09 de Abril.

Martita se inició en este trabajo ante la necesidad de generar sus ingresos y contribuir en los gastos de su hogar, gracias a dicha iniciativa, ella decide emprender este negocio.
     
Con el préstamo de S/. 800, el cual pagará en 6 meses, invertirá en la compra de una maquina duplicadora moderna para facilitar el trabajo. Gracias a la transparencia, responsabilidad y puntualidad que posee, los clientes siguen confiando en ella.

Tiene 50 años y su meta es implementar el negocio y para ello cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo. Martita es una persona muy optimista, a pesar de  dedicarse poco tiempo a esta actividad ya tiene buenos clientes, pero quiere en el futuro crecer más en el negocio y hacerse más conocida para asegurar los ingresos.
texts.en:
Ms. Martita belongs to the bank group "Las aguerridas II," and lives in the province of San Martin in the district of Tarapoto. She has been running a key-making business, making duplicates of all kinds of keys. She runs her business from her own home. Marta began her business because she needed a second source of income in order to contribute to her home finances. With this loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she will invest in a modern machine to aid her in her work. Thanks to the transparency, responsibility and punctuality she possesses, her customers trust her very much. She is 50 years old and her goal is the see her business grow and in order to do this, she looks to the support of her husband. Martita is an optimistic person, despite only having been in this business for a short time. She already has loyal customers, but she looks to a future in which her business grows and she will be more well known, helping her to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a modern machine to aid her in key-making

loans.name: Merly Benidia

texts.es:
La señora  Merly, socia del BC “LAS MARGARITAS II”, vive en la Región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo. Se dedica a la venta de golosinas de manera ambulatoria en los lugares donde se realizan eventos y hay mayor concentración de personas como en las afueras de los colegios y  recreos turísticos.   

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará galletas de distintas variedades en cajas, chocolates en cajas, chupetines y chicles en bolsas de diferentes marcas y tamaños, caramelos de diferentes marcas y sabores, para tener en stock y luego sacarlos a la venta. 

Merly tiene 45 años de edad, vive con su esposo, quien la apoya en esta actividad. Es una mujer muy perseverante y responsable, con ganas de salir adelante y apoyar a su esposo en la economía de la casa. Desea arreglar su casa y preparar un ambiente propicio para poner un negocio de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Merly, a member of the Community Bank “Las Margaritas II,” lives in the region and province of San Martin, La Banda de Shilcayo District. She sells candy on foot at large outdoor events, local high schools and where tourists are situated.

With a loan of $400 US Dollars, which will be repaid in four months, Mrs. Merly will buy a variety of boxed cookies, chocolates, lollipops and chewing gum in bags of different brands and sizes and candy of different brands and flavors to stock and sell later.

Mrs. Merly is forty-five years old and lives with her husband, who supports her activities. She is a very perservering and responsible woman who is eager to get ahead and support her husband with the finances of their home. She desires to fix their house to eventually build an environment that is conducive to setting up a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various boxed and bagged branded candy items

location.town: La Banda de Shilcayo - San Martín

loans.name: Mery Antonieta

texts.es:
La señora Mery Antonieta, socia del Banco Comunal “DORADINAS EN ACCION”, vive en el Departamento de San Martín, provincia de El Dorado, distrito de San José de Sisa. Se dedica a  la  venta de confecciones, zapatillas,  y plásticos en general, ollas, etc. El negocio está ubicado en el Jr. Comercio s/n cdra 2. Los clientes son las personas de los caseríos y personas que viven en la misma ciudad.

Se inició en el negocio porque le gusta, además se vio en la necesidad de independizarse y generar ingresos para sostener a su familia ya que a su esposo le fue mal. Está contenta con lo logrado hasta la fecha porque su negocio ha crecido bastante.  

Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual pagará en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de ollas, bandejas, zapatillas, botas, mochilas, etc., además comprará ropa para damas como polos, blusas y pedidos que le hacen los clientes y poder satisfacer los requerimientos de los mismos.

Mery tiene 52 años de edad, es natural de sisa, tiene 5 hijos, 2 de ellos todavía están a su cargo, quienes además son su motor para seguir trabajando. Se caracteriza por ser gentil, atenta con los clientes, tranquila y con plena confianza en lo que hace. Más adelante piensa poner otro negocio de venta de abarrotes y mejorar su casita.
texts.en:
Señora Mery Antonieta is a member of the Community Bank "DORADINAS EN ACCION”. She lives in the Department San Martín, in the Province of El Dorado, in the District of San José de Sisa. She works selling candies, shoes, and plastic in general, pots, etc. The business is located at Jr. Comercio s/n cdra 2. The clients are people of the village and people that live in the same city. She began her business because she liked the work, also she saw the necessity of being independent and generating an income in order to sustain her family when her husband went bad. She is happy with what she has achieved to this point, because her business has grown quite a bit. With a loan of S/. 3,000, which she would repay in 4 months, she would invest in the purchase of pots, flags, shoes, boots, backpacks, etc. She would also buy women’s clothing like polo shirts, blouses, and orders that her clients have placed so she could satisfy her client’s requirements. Mery is 52 years old and is a native of Sisa. She has 5 children, 2 of whom are still in her charge. They are also her motivation to keep working. Her character is gentile, attentive to her clients, calm, and with much confidence in what she is doing. In the future, she wants to have another business selling snacks, and to improve her little house.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in pots, flags, shoes, boots, backpacks, etc.

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
La señora MERY, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “LUZ Y ESPERANZA”, vive en la Región y Provincia D. San Martín, distrito D. Tarapoto, se dedica a la venta D. chupetes elaborados a base D. frutas, gelatinas, bebidas D. la región como chicha D. maíz y gaseosas D. diferentes marcas y sabores. Desarrolla el negocio en su propio domicilio ubicado en el Jr. Santa Eufracia Nº 360, lugar  donD. diariamente acuden los clientes, que en su mayoría son vecinos D. su barrio.

Con el préstamo D. S/ 500, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará azúcar, frutas, bolsas para chupetes, vasos descartables, saborisantes para la preparación D. la gelatinas y gaseosas D. diversos tamaños, sabores y marcas,  para atender las exigencias D. los clientes.

Mery es una mujer entusiasta y alegre, cuenta con 39 años y tiene 1hija quien la apoya en el negocio. Hasta la fecha le va bien por el trato que da a los clientes. Desea, más adelante, tener una distribuidora D. chupetes.
texts.en:
Mery is a member of the group called Luz y Esperanza, which means Light and Hope. She lives in San Martin in the district of Tarapoto. Mery has a business selling pacifiers which she makes from fruit and gelatin. She also sells various sodas and local drinks maD. from corn.

Mery started this business from her home at 360 Jr. Santa Eufracia, where she serves her customers every day, many of whom are her neighbors. With the loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy sugar, fruit, bags for the pacifiers, plastic cups, flavoring, and sodas of different flavors and brands to meet the demands of her customers.

Mery is a cheerful and enthusiastic woman, 39 years old with one daughter who helps her with the business. Up until now Mery has done well with her business because of her good customer service. In the future, she would like to have a distributor for the pacifiers to reach a wider market.

La señora MERY, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto "LUZ Y ESPERANZA", vive en la Región y Provincia D. San Martín, distrito D. Tarapoto, se dedica a la venta D. chupetes elaborados a base D. frutas, gelatinas, bebidas D. la región como chicha D. maíz y gaseosas D. diferentes marcas y sabores. Desarrolla el negocio en su propio domicilio ubicado en el Jr. Santa Eufracia Nº 360, lugar donD. diariamente acuden los clientes, que en su mayoría son vecinos D. su barrio. Con el préstamo D. S/ 500, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará azúcar, frutas, bolsas para chupetes, vasos descartables, saborisantes para la preparación D. la gelatinas y gaseosas D. diversos tamaños, sabores y marcas, para atender las exigencias D. los clientes. Mery es una mujer entusiasta y alegre, cuenta con 39 años y tiene 1hija quien la apoya en el negocio. Hasta la fecha le va bien por el trato que da a los clientes. Desea, más adelante, tener una distribuidora D. chupetes.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO PURCHASE SUGAR, FRUIT, BAGS, DISPOSABLE CUPS AND SODAS TO BETTER MEET THE DEMANDS OF HER CUSTOMERS.

loans.name: Neni Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Neni pertenece al Grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto “Luz y Esperanza”, vive en la región y provincia San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de Salchipapas, pollo broster y refrescos y complementa con la venta de cosméticos (Unique). Las ventas la realiza frente a su domicilio, el cual está ubicado en el Jr: Tomas Villacorta Nº 371, lugar donde acuden diariamente los clientes. 

Con el préstamo de S/ 800, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará un carrito salchipapero, cremas como salsa de tomate (ketchup), mostaza en baldes, papas, repollo, hot dog y otros insumos que necesita para la preparación diaria de los platos que oferta a los clientes.

En estos últimos tiempos se incrementaron las ventas gracias al buen trato, higiene y sazón, lo que le llena de mucha satisfacción.

Neni de 28 años, es una mujer decidida, alegre y trabajadora. Tiene como meta implementar su casa para poner una pollería.
texts.en:
Neni is a member of the group called Luz y Esperanza, which means Light and Hope. She lives in San Martin in the district of Tarapoto and she has a business selling sausages, roast chicken and drinks. Neni also sells cosmetics to earn additional money. She runs her business from her home, which is located at 371 Jr. Tomas Villacorta, and each day her customers come to see her there.

With the loan, which she will repay in 5 months, she will buy a small cart for the sausages, condiments such as ketchup and mustard, potatoes, hot dogs and other ingredients she needs to prepare the meals she offers her customers.

Over time, Neni has grown her business thanks to her good customer service and high quality. This success brings her a lot of satisfaction. Neni is 28 years old and a dedicated, hardworking and cheerful woman. One of her goals is to be able to build a hen house for the chickens.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO PURCHASE A SMALL CART FOR THE SAUSAGES SHE SELLS, AS WELL AS CONDIMENTS AND INGREDIENTS FOR THE MEALS SHE OFFERS HER CUSTOMERS.

loans.name: Delia Amanda

texts.es:
hola mi nombre es Delia Amanda M., soy viuda y tengo 4 hijos a los que he tenido que sacar adelante por mi propio trabajo, me dedico a la venta de golosinas como ser tacos, enchiladas, tortillas con quesillo, baleadas, etc. gracias a este negocio no descuido a mis hijos ya que mi producto lo elaboro en mi casa de habitacion. en estos momentos necesito tener mas ventas para tener mas ganancias para poder sustentar mi hogar, darles vestuario, educacion y alimentacion a mis 4 hijos que son lo mas importante en mi vida.
por tal razon solicito ayuda para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Hello, my name is Delia Amanda M.. I'm a widow and have 4 children whom I support. I work selling local snacks such as tacos, enchiladas and tortillas with cheese. Thanks to this business, which I run from my home, I do not have leave my children alone.

I need to increase my sales to be able to maintain my home, and provide food, clothing and education for my children. They are the most important thing in my life and this is the reason I am requesting help.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO PURCHASE TORTILLAS, PORK AND CHICKEN, VEGETABLES, SALSA, OIL, BUTTER, BEANS, CHEESE AND OTHER INGREDIENTS TO PREPARE THE SNACKS SHE SELLS.  AS DELIA IS A WIDOW, THE INCOME FROM THIS BUSINESS IS HER ONLY MEANS OF SUPPORTING HER 4 CHILDREN.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of jewelry to re-sell in her community

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in a lot of ingredients to produce food for her customers

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase chickens for a small poultry shop

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es: Doña Maria habita en el barrio Hialeah II etapa, procreó dos hijos que ya están mayores de edad, los cuales pudo sacar adelante gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo y el de su esposo. El esposo de Maria trabaja brindando servicios de taxi. Ella es cocinera de un comedor para el cual lleva diez año laborando, inició como ayudante para a prender a elaborar los ricos platillo, ahora gracias a su experiencia y dedicación ha logrado escalar y ahora es la cocinera del lugar. El préstamo solicitado es para infraestructura en la construcción de un porche en su vivienda, para tener más comodidad, y tener también mayor seguridad en su vivienda. Apoya en el cuido de dos nietos de sus hijos y espera poder seguir ayudándolos hasta donde pueda. También quiere apoyar a su esposo en la compra de una unidad de taxi nueva que se encuentre en mejores condiciones que el que tiene actualmente.
texts.en:
Maria is lives in the Hialeah II neighborhood of her city and has two children who have already reached adulthood and were able to make headway thanks to the hard work of their mother and father. Maria's husband is a taxi driver, while she is a cook at a diner she has worked at for 10 years. She started out as an assistant to learn how to make the rich dishes, and now thanks to her experience and dedication she was promoted to chef. The loan she is requesting is for building a porch addition to her home, to make it more comfortable and add security. She helps caring for her two grandchildren and hopes to continue doing so for as long as she can. She also wants to help her husband purchase a new taxi unit that's in better condition than their current one.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a porch addition to her home

loans.name: Tomasa Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Tomasa tiene 60 años de edad, habita en el barrio 3-80 de Managua, es soltera, sus hijos son mayores de edad, y apoyan a su madre en los gastos del hogar. Quieren recompensar el gran esfuerzo de Tomasa por sacarlos adelante. Ella se desempeña como conserje desde hace 8 años, y espera continuar por algunos años más. Para Tomasa fue difícil poder mejorar su vivienda ya que como madre soltera le tocó toda la responsabilidad de su familia, pero ahora que sus hijos le ayudan ha pensando en mejorar su casa, y el préstamo será usado en la compra de materiales de construcción para terminar de hacer un muro lateral de su vivienda y así poder tener más segura sus pertenencias, ya que el barrio donde habita se está volviendo peligroso.
texts.en:
Tomasa is 60 years old and lives in the 3-80 neighborhood of Managua. She is single, and her children have already reached adulthood and help her with household expenses, wanting to repay her for her tremendous effort to make headway for them all. She was worked has a caretaker for the past eight years and wishes to continue for some years ahead. For Tomasa, it was difficult to make improvements on her home since as a single mother she had sole responsibility for her family, but now that her children are grown and helping her she has been planning it. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase construction materials to finish building a side wall in her home, so she will have more security since her neighborhood is becoming more dangerous.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish building a side wall in her home

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: Gloria Maria tiene 46 años de edad, habita en el barrio Hialeah de la ciudad de Managua, es viuda, y no tuvo hijos. Gloria Maria es una pequeña comerciante que tiene un cafetín en un hospital de la ciudad de Managua, en su cafetín ofrece diversos productos como gaseosas y golosinas. Hace 5 años puso ese cafetín y a través del tiempo lo ha mejorado tanto en infraestructura como en atención. Este cafetín lo inició con ahorros que ella había hechos por algunos años, y a través de créditos a AFODENIC, ha podido crecer poco a poco. Su sueño siempre fue terminar de construir su casa ya que a ésta le hace falta algunos detalles, como por ejemplo el techo del porche de su vivienda el que instalará con el dinero de este préstamo.
texts.en:
Gloria Maria is 46 years old and lives in the Hialeah neighborhood of Managua. She is a widow and doesn't have any children. She is a small businesswoman, running a snack bar at a local hospital and offering diverse products such as soft drinks and snacks.She has been doing this for five years, and over time has improved its infrastructure and customer service. She started the snack bar with savings she had from a number years, and with loans from Kiva partner AFODENIC, she has been able to make it grow little by little. Her dream always has been to finish building her home, since it still lacks some details, for example the porch roof she plans on building from this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put a roof on her porch

loans.name: Cora Del Socorro

texts.es: Cora habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, tiene 48 años de edad, es soltera y tiene dos hijos de 15 y 19 años, a los que con mucho esfuerzo ha sacado adelante y les ha dado estudios para que éstos sean personas útiles a la sociedad. Desde hace 25 años Cora trabaja como conserje en una empresa de Managua. Ahora mismo sus planes están enfocados en el mejoramiento de la infraestructura de su vivienda, con el crédito solicitado cambiará parte del zinc de su vivienda, ya que éstos son bastantes viejos y se encuentran en muy malas condiciones, el agua de las lluvias se le está filtrando y le causa daños al interior de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Cora lives in the Sandino Memorial neighborhood of Managua. She is 48 years old, single and has children age 15 and 19 for whom she has dedicated a lot of effort to make headway and help with their studies so they become productive members of society. For the past 25 years, Cora has worked as a caretaker for a local business in Managua. Currently, her plans are focused on improving the infrastructure of her home, and with the loan she is requesting she will put new zinc sheets on the roof of her home. The current ones are quite old and are in very bad condition; rain water has been getting through, causing damage to the home's interior.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put new zinc sheets on the roof of her home

loans.name: Isabel Castillo

texts.es: Doña Isabel habita en el barrio Santa Ana, es casada, su esposo es maestro de obra de constucción. El negocio de Doña Isabel es venta de ropa y zapatos, comenzó hace un año con capital propio, la dificultad que encontró fue la falta de financiamiento para surtir más el negocio, que su capital era poco para tener los suficientes productos para satisfacer las demandas de sus clientes. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para infraestructura en mejoras a su techo ya que está en mal estado y necesita comprar zinc, perlines, hierro. Su sueño es ver su casa terminada para así gozar de una vivienda más cómoda y más segura junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
Isabel lives in the Santa Ana neighborhood of her city. She is married, and her husband is a construction foreman. Isabel's business is selling clothing and shoes, which she started a year ago with her own money. The problem she encountered was a lack of financial resources to better stock her business because her funds alone weren't sufficient to meet her customers' demands. The loan she is currently requesting is to make improvements on the roof of her home, which is bad condition and needs new zinc, beams and iron. Her dream is to see her home finished so she can enjoy a more comfortable and secure dwelling with her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replace the roof of her home

loans.name: Helène

texts.fr: Helène A. est tient une boutique de boissons depuis plus de 3 ans à Kpalimé, un village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agée de 32 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants tous à l’école. Hélène souhaite avec ce crédit alimenter sa boutique en achetant des boissons tels que les rhums, les vins, gin pour satisfaire la demande de la clientèle. Ce faisant, elle gagnera plus pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants
texts.en:
Hélène A. has had a beverages shop for over three years in Kpalimé, a city located about 120 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. She is 32 years old, married, and the mother of three children, who are all in school. Hélène would like to use this loan to supply her shop through the purchase of beverages, such as rum, wine, and gin to meet customer demand. By doing this, she will earn more to provide for the needs of her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages, such as rum, wine, gin

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
La señora OLGA, socia del Banco Comunal “LAS MORALINAS”, vive en la región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Morales. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de la marca Esita. Olga vende  visitando las casas de los clientes, los cuales son en su mayoría amistades y personas que trabajan en las diversas entidades de la ciudad. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 800, el cual pagará en 6 meses, invertirá en la compra de productos en oferta como jabones, colonias, desodorantes, esmaltes, shampoo, etc., para tener en stock y surtir la mercadería y poder atender a sus clientes en lo que necesitan, también comprará sábanas para atender los pedidos de los clientes.

Olga tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y sus 02 hijos. Ahora se siente más responsable, decidida  y trabajadora. Tiene como meta seguir creciendo en su negocio, para ello quiere comprar una vitrina para mostrar los productos y retomar con sus estudios y llegar a ser una profesional.
texts.en:
Olba is a membr of the communal bank called Las Moralinas. She lives in San Martin, in the district of Morales. For three years she has worked selling a brand of cosmetics called Esita. Olga sells directly to her clients in their homes. Many of her customers are friends and people who work at different businesses in the city.

With the loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she will invest in promotional products such as soap, deodorant, nail polish, shampoo, etc, so that her business is well stocked and she can better meet the requests of her customers.

Olga is 37 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children. With her business, she feels more responsible, dedicated and hardworking. Her goal is to grow her business and be able to purchase a display case to show her products, as well as return to her studies so that she can further her career as a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO PURCHASE BEAUTY PRODUCTS FOR HER COSMETICS BUSINESS, INCLUDING  SOAP, DEODORANT, NAIL POLISH, SHAMPOO, ETC.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
La señora Olga pertenece al BC “Mujeres trabajando II”, vive en la Región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de refrigerios, como juanes, cutacho, pescado asado, los cuales vende de manera ambulatoria y entrega a los clientes que ya tienen en el mercado y a personas particulares quienes solicitan, sobre todo el cutacho, que es un preparado a base de plátano y no se encuentra con mucha facilidad.
 
En estos últimos meses el negocio se ha mantenido porque da fiado y tanto ella como su esposo toman las decisiones en lo que van a invertir.

Con el préstamo de S/. 500, el cual pagará en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de plátanos, aceite, huevos, pollo, arroz, maní, etc., y otros productos que utilizará en la preparación y así ofrecer a los clientes.

Olga tiene 51 años, es una mujer muy optimista y trabajadora, vive con su esposo y 3 de sus 5 hijos que tiene. Su esposo la apoya en la preparación y en las labores del hogar. Su meta es llegar a tener un negocio en su propia casa para asegurar su vejez.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of Mujeres Trabajando II. She lives in San Martin in the district of Tarapoto. Olga works selling local snacks and grilled fish to customers around the city. The local snack she makes and sells, called Cutacho, which is made with plantains, is particularly hard to find.

In the last few months, business has been good due to sales on credit, and also because both Olga and her husband make decisions on what they want to invest in. With the loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase plantains, oil, eggs, chicken, rice and other ingredients she needs to prepare the snacks she offers to her customers.

Olga is 51 years old and is a very optimistic and hardworking woman. She lives with her husband and 3 of their 5 children. Her husband helps her with the business and with the care of their home. Olga's goal is to be able to run her business from her home, making her more secure when she is older.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO PURCHASE PLANTAINS, OIL, EGGS, CHICKEN, RICE AND OTHER INGREDIENTS SHE NEEDS FOR HER BUSINESS.

loans.name: Paquita

texts.es:
La Señora Paquita, socia del Banco Comunal “LAS BRISAS”, vive en la región D. San Martín, provincia y distrito D. Bellavista. Se dedica a la venta D. pollos eviscerados, venD. en su propio domicilio, ubicado en el Jr. Ica 3er piso, lugar donD. acuden diariamente a comprar los clientes, los cuales son los vecinos D. su barrio y personas particulares.

Paquita se inició con la venta D. abarrotes, pero vio que no obtenía muchas ganancias por lo que deciD. cambiar a esta actividad, la cual si le resulta por que el pollo es una carne D. consumo diario. 

Con el préstamo D. S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará pollos vivos para tenerlos en su casa y así abastecer a los clientes que requieren D. esta carne todos los días. Ella manifiesta que últimamente las ventas se han incrementado gracias a la amabilidad con la que atienD. a los clientes que se acercan a su negocio. 

Paquita, es una mujer trabajadora, carismática, tiene 68 años y muchas ganas D. seguir trabajando. Ella quiere continuar con esta actividad hasta que Dios lo decida y sus fuerzas lo permitan.
texts.en:
Paquita is a member of the communal bank called Las Brisas. She lives in San Martin, in the district of Bellavista and works selling chickens from her home. Each day her customers come to her house, many of them are neighbors or people whom she knows.

Paquita used to sell groceries and household items, but she saw that she didn't generate enough income. She decided to change her business and began selling chickens, as it is a meat that people consume daily. With the loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy more chickens to keep in the house so that she can meet her customers requests. Lately her sales have been growing thanks to her friendly service.

Paquita is a hardworking and charismatic woman. She is 68 years old and has a great desire to continue working. She would like to continue with her business as long as God is willing and she has the strength to do so.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE CHICKENS FOR HER BUSINESS

loans.name: Telma

texts.es:
La señora Telma, socia del Banco Comunal “Nuestra señora D. la Paz, vive en la región y Provincia D. San Martín, distrito D. Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza D. las marcas Oriflame y Unique, debido a que tiene bastante tiempo en esta actividad, el cual lo realiza visitando las casas D. los clientes, que a la fecha cuentan con un buen número D. ellos por su carisma y buen trato.  

Con el préstamo D. S/. 800, el cual pagará en 6 meses, invertirá en la compra D. productos que están en oferta como: jabones, colonias, desodorantes, esmaltes, shampoo, etc. Desea surtir la mercadería y poder atender a los clientes en lo que necesitan.

Telma tiene 55 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo, quienes la apoyan en esta actividad. Ahora se siente segura, optimista y también adquirió la habilidad D. relacionarse con cualquier tipo D. persona. Tiene como meta poner un restaurante en su propia casa.
texts.en:
Telma is a member of the Banco Comunal "Nuestra senora D. la Paz" community bank. She lives in the region and province of San Martin in the district of Tarapoto. She sells beauty products especially from the Oriflame and Unique brand names. Given that she has a great deal of time running this business, one that she runs by visiting her client's home, she can count on a good number of clients because of her charisma and for her great service.

With the loan of S/.800, which will be repaid in a term of 6 months, she will pruchase products that are currently on sale, such as: soaps, colognes, deodorants, nail polish, shampoo etc. She wants to add selection to her merchandise so that she can meet the demands of her clients.

Telma is 55 years old, and she lives with her husband and son, both of whom support her and help her in her business. She feels confident and optimistic now, and she even acquired the ability to connect with every personality type. Her goal is to set up a restaurant in her own home.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products such as soaps, colognes, deodorants, nail polish etc.

loans.name: Telmith

texts.es:
La señora Telmith, socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen del Pilar”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de Lamas, distrito de Zapatero y caserío de Nuevo Celendin. Se dedica a la siembra y venta de verduras y frutas como naranjas. Por las tardes vende juanes y asados en su casa. La venta de las verduras lo realiza en la ciudad de Tarapoto y en su misma comunidad. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 800, el cual pagará en 6 meses lo invertirá en la compra de semillas como culantro y tomate para sembrar en su chacra. También comprará cerdos para engordarlos y luego venderlos.

Telmith tiene 30 años. Es una mujer trabajadora con muchas ganas de seguir creciendo y su meta es comprar un terreno en Tarapoto para poder construir su casa y más adelante vender abarrotes.
texts.en:
Ms. Telmith, member of the Communal Bank "Virgen del Pilar", lives in the Region San Martin, Province of Lamas, district of Zapatero and caserío of Nuevo Celendin. Ms. Telmith sells vegetables and fruits such as oranges. In the afternoons, she sells home made food from her house. Ms. Telmith sales vegetables in the city of Tarapoto which is within her community. With the loan of S/. 800, which she will pay in 6 months, Ms. Telmith will invest in the purchase of seeds such as tomato to plant and grow at her small farm Ms. Telmith will also buy hogs to then sell them. Ms. Telmith is 30 years old, and she is a hard-working woman with many desires to continue to prosper and her goal is to buy land in Tarapoto to be able to build her house and and in the future sell staple food.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds and pigs

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria, socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen del Pilar”, vive en la Región  San Martín, Provincia de Lamas, distrito de Zapatero y caserío de Nuevo Celendin. Se dedica a la venta de comida y el negocio lo realiza en su propio domicilio. Los clientes son los transeúntes que pasan por el lugar.

Las ventas se incrementaron en estos últimos tiempos porque es conocida por su sazón, buen trato e higiene, además siempre recibió el apoyo de su mamá incondicionalmente. 

Con el préstamo de S/  1,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de arroz, azúcar en sacos, fríjol, carnes y verduras, que lo utilizará en la preparación de las comidas y en la reparación del motor de su carro, porque también presta servicio de transporte.

Victoria tiene 35 años, es una mujer segura, decidida y trabajadora con muchas ganas de seguir creciendo. Su meta es implementar más su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs Victoria is and associate of the community bank "Virgen del Pilar", she lives in the San Martin region, province of Lamas, Zapatero district and Nuevo Celendin housing development. She makes a living selling meals and runs her business from her home. The clients are the passers by that go by her place.

The sales have risen lately because she has become known for her flavoring, good service and cleanliness, and regardless, she has always had the unconditional support of her mother.

The proceeds of the loan for USD $ 350, which she will repay in six months, will be invested in the purchase of rice, sacks of sugar, beans, meats and vegetables, which she will use in the preparation of meals, and the repair of her car which she uses to provide transportation services.

Victoria is 35 years old, she is a self-assured, decisive and hard working woman with a great desire to continue advancing. Her goal is to further grow her business.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, beans, meats and vegetables.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La Señora Vilma, socia del Banco Comunal “Las Moralinas”, vive en la región y  provincia de San Martín, distrito de Morales. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, perfumería, pasamanería y artículos de regalos. Ya tiene bastante tiempo en este negocio y le va bien. El negocio está ubicado en su propio domicilio en el Jr. Los Andes Nº 636 donde acuden diariamente a comprar los clientes, los cuales son mayormente los vecinos del su barrio.

Con el préstamo de S/. 800, el cual pagará en 6  meses, comprará  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, leche, aceite, conservas en cajas de diferentes tamaños, juguetes, sandalias entre otros, y de esa manera surtir bien el negocio y que los clientes encuentren lo que buscan. 

Vilma, a sus 38 años, es una mujer trabajadora, carismática y con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando con el negocio porque le gusta lo que hace. Quiere darles una profesión a sus hijos y su meta es comprar una vitrina para poner los productos de regalos y seguir creciendo en el negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vilma, and associate of the community bank "Las Moralinas", lives in the region and province of San Martin, district of Morales. She sells groceries, perfumes, braids and fringes and gifts. She has been in this business for some time and is doing well. The business is located at her residence, Jr. Los Andes No.636, where her customers come shopping daily. most of whom are her neighbors.

With the loan of USD$275, which she will repay in six months, she will buy basic products such as rice, sacks of sugar, milk, oil. preserves in various sized containers, toys, sandals and others, this way she will stock her store well so that her customers can find what they are looking for.

Vilma, at 38 years of age, is a hard working woman, charismatic and with a great desire to continue her work at her business because she likes what she does. She wants to provide for a profession for her children and her goal is to buy a display case to show her gift products and continue to grow her business.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase basic products such as rice, sugar, oil, preserves, etc.

loans.name: Pablo Antonio

texts.es: Don Pablo es un hombre trabajador, desde muy joven aprendió albañilería y también trabada como líder comunitario de barrio, su esposa es ama de casa y actualmente habita en el barrio 3-80. Don Pablo inició como ayudante de albañil y ahora trabaja por su propia cuenta ya que a través de los años adquirió experiencia en como desarrollar su trabajo. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para comprar maquinas que le ayuden en su labor cotidiana, como un taladro y una pulidora.
texts.en:
Pablo is a hard-working man. Ever since he was very young her learned brickwork and also worked as a community leader in his neighborhood. He is married to a housewife and currently lives in the 3-80 neighborhood of his city. Pablo started out working as a bricklayer assistant and now works on his own from all the experience he gained through the years in how to develop his business. The current loan he is requesting is for purchasing machines to help with his daily work, such as a power drill and a polishing machine.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a power drill and a polishing machine

loans.name: Santos Javier

texts.es: Santos Javier tiene 40 años de edad, habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, es casado, su esposa tiene 28 años de edad y es comerciante, tiene una pequeña hija. Desde hace 5 años Santos se dedica al negocio de la ebanistería. Empezó trabajando en una empresa que hace muebles pero con el paso del tiempo logró independizarse y poner él su propio negocio. Santos desea seguir prosperando para darle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida, y también desea que su negocio prospere a través de la captación de más clientes. El préstamo será usado en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de muebles ya que tiene un pedido grande, y desea poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes para así poder conservarlos.
texts.en:
Santos Javier is 40 years old and lives in the Sandino Memorial neighborhood of his city. He is married, and his wife is 28 years old and works as a merchant. They have a small daughter. For the last five years, Santos has dedicated himself to his carpentry business. He started out working for a company that made furniture, but over time he was able to go out on his own and start a business. Santos hopes to keep prospering and improving his family's quality of life, and he also wishes to see his business prosper by being able to take on more clients. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase raw materials (wood) to make furniture since he has a big order and wants to able to meet his customers' demands so he can retain them.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood to make furniture

loans.name: Maikel Steward

texts.es:
El Sr. Maikel tiene 30 años de edad, habita en el barrio el Riguero, es casado y le tienen dos hijos de 11 y 12 años de edad, los cuales están cursando la secundaria, su esposa es maestra da clase en un instituto de alumnos de primaria. El negocio de don Maikel es electricista automotriz tiene doce años de tener su negocio independiente, el inició con capital propio y con sus ahorros ha ido comprando sus herramientas de trabajo  para dar a sus clientes el servicio que se merecen. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para comprar activo para su negocio en una planta eléctrica y alambre embobinado para trabajos.
A futuro es captar más clientes, ofreciendo su servicio domiciliar, poder dar estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Maikel is thirty-years-old and lives in the Riguero neighborhood. He is married and has two children who are eleven and twelve-years-old. His children are in secondary school and his wife is an elementary school teacher. Mr. Maikel is an electrician working in the automotive sector, and for twelve years, he has had his own business that he started with his own money. With his savings, he has been buying tools for his work so that he can give his clients the service they deserve. He would use the requested loan to purchase assets for his business in an electric plant and barbed wire for his daily operations. In the future, he would like to get more clients, offer his services at client’s home addressees, and be able to give his children an education.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of electrical machinery and barbed wire

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
La Sra. Hortencia tiene ya mas de 3 años con su negocio de ventas de artículos escolares esté negocio es la fuente de ingreso de su familia ya que es madre soltera.

La Sra. Hortencia quiere invertir en su negocio en comprar computadoras para rentarlas a los estudiantes ya que en su colonia no hay quien les pueda ayudar con los trabajos que les encargan en la escuela.

Hortencia a tenido ya crédito en fvp su primer crédito que solicito fue para surtir su negocio de mercancía ahora está solicitándole a Kiva un préstamo para la compra de computadoras y así ella tendrá mas ingreso a su negocio y a su familia.

La Sra. Hortencia solicita un préstamo de $1,200.00 para comprar computadoras e invertir a su negocio ya que por el momento no cuenta con suficiente capita.
texts.en:
Ms. Hortencia has been selling school supplies for over three years. This business is the only source of income for her family since she is a single mother. Ms. Hortencia wants to invest in the purchase of computers so she can rent them to students, because there is no one in their district who can help them with their schoolwork. Ms. Hortencia has already been given a loan from the Foundation for Progressive Living to supply her business with merchandise. She is now asking for a loan from Kiva for the purchase the computers, which will provide her with more income for her business and her family. Ms. Hortencia is asking for a loan of $1200 to purchase the computers and invest in her business because at the moment she does not have enough funds to do so.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Computers

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
La Sra. Consuelo tiene ya mas de 3 años con su puesto de tacos este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia.

El negocio es de ventas de tacos por la mañana el puesto está ubicado afuera de la central de autobuses de Nuevo Laredo el negocio lo atiende ella y su esposo el Sr. Amado Díaz.

Ella está solicitando un préstamo de $1,000.00 dlls para remodelar el puesto y comprar silla y mesas para que sus clientes estén más cómodos al consumir sus alimentos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Consuelo and her husband, Mr. Amado Días, have been working for more than three years at their taco stand, their family’s main source of income.

The stand is located outside the bus station in Nuevo Laredo, where it conducts its main business in the mornings. Mrs. Consuelo is requesting a $1,000 loan to remodel her stand. She hopes to buy tables and chairs for her clients so that they will be more comfortable while enjoying their meals

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodeling of the stand, purchase of tables and chairs for the business

loans.name: Karla Estebana

texts.es: Doña Karla tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación de la ciudad de Managua, tiene seis hijos, de los cuales cinco son independiente y uno esta estudiando en la universidad las edades son de 17,19, 20,21, 24, y 26 años de edad. Su esposo es conductor. Doña Karla tiene una pulpería, que inició con fondos propios y  con ayudad de su esposo e hijos, empezó vendiendo pocos productos, ahora la pulpería ha incrementado su inventario, tiene ocho años de tener la pulpería. La solicitud de crédito es para invertir en la pulpería en la compra de productos como granos básicos y productos de limpieza, y así no desmejorar la oferta para sus clientes. La meta de Doña Karla es poder terminar de darle estudios a su hijo menor para prepararlo profesionalmente.
texts.en:
Ms. Karla is forty-six-years-old, married, and lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood in the city of Managua. She has six children, five of whom are independent and one of whom is studying at the university. They are seventeen, nineteen, twenty, twenty-one, twenty-four, and twenty-six-years-old. Her husband is a driver. Ms. Karla has a local store, which she started with her own funds. With the help of her husband and her children, she started selling a few products. Now, she has had the store for eight years, and the inventory of the store has increased. She is requesting a loan to invest in the store and to purchase products such as basic grains and cleaning products. This way, the supply for her clients will not decrease. Mrs. Karla’s goal is to be able to finish giving her youngest child an education to prepare him for a professional career.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic grains and cleansing products for her local store

loans.name: Brenda Patricia

texts.es: Doña Brenda vende ropa y cosmético desde hace ocho años e inició con ahorro propios, su negocio no esta tan surtido debido al poco financiamiento y a veces las ventas son bajas, vende al crédito y al contado. Actualmente  habita en el barrio Los López,  tiene 32 años, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Con la solicitud que está haciendo es para comprar mercadería de zapatos, ropa de mujer y surtir la venta para ofertar a sus clientes sus variados productos. A largo plazo es aumentar sus ventas, y captar más clientes.
texts.en:
Doña Brenda has been selling clothes and cosmetics for eight years, having started with her own savings. Her business is not very well stocked because of lack of financing, and sometimes her sales are low. She sells on one or multiple payments. She currently lives in the neighborhood of Los Lopez, she is 32, single, and has no children. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to buy merchandise, such as shoes, women's clothes, and stock her business to offer a variety of products to her customers. In the long run, she wants to increase her sales and attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying women's shoes and clothing.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: José Luis habita en un barrio Anexo Villa Libertad, es casado, su esposa es ama de casa y tiene dos hijos de 6 y 15 años de edad, que estudian uno en primaria y el otro en secundaria. El trabajo de don José es la soldadura y también es albañil con trece años de experiencia, cuando inició comenzó con su papa y otros amigos pero ahora hace su trabajo independiente.  La solicitud de préstamo es para comprar un soldador de segunda mano para poder hacer sus trabajos y no tener que alquilarlo, y poder ir teniendo sus propias herramientas de trabajo. Sus planes son obtener mejores herramientas para facilitar el trabajo y brindar mejor servicio a sus clientes y también poder ayudar a sus hijos en la superación de sus estudios.
texts.en:
José Luis lives in the Anexo Villa Libertad neighborhood. He is married and has two children of six and fifteen years of age. His wife tends to their home while his children attend primary and secondary school, respectively. He works as a welder and also has thirteen years of experience as a bricklayer. Initially, he worked with his father and a few friends, but he now works independently. He hopes the loan will enable him to buy a second-hand welder so as to eliminate the cost of renting it. His plans are to obtain better tools that both make his work less cumbersome and enable him to serve his clients better. In this way he hopes to help his children succeed in their studies.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a welder

loans.name: Fátima Del Rosario

texts.es: Fátima tiene 31 años de edad, es casada y habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, tiene tres hermosos hijos de 2, 7 y 10 años de edad, es casada, su esposo es albañil. Doña Fátima vende ropa, zapatos, juguetes tiene trece años en las ventas e inició cuando su familia tenia un tramo en el mercado oriental y ahí trabajaba ella, pero luego optó por hacer su negocio sola porque quería convertirse en microempresaria.. Con el préstamo quiere invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de maniquíes de medio cuerpo para lucir sus prendas de vestir a los clientes. A largo plazo es aumentar su inventario y lograr mejores ganancias, así como ayudar a sus hijos a superarse con los estudios.
texts.en:
Fatima is thirty-one years old, married, and lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood. She has three beautiful children who are two, seven, and ten-years old. Her husband is a building worker. Ms. Fatima has worked in retail for thirteen years, selling clothes, shoes, and toys. She started this work when her family had a stand in a market. She worked there until she chose to start her own business because she wanted to become a businesswoman. With the loan, she wants to invest in funds to buy medium-sized mannequins to show off the clothes that she is selling to her clients. In the long term, she hopes to use the loan to increase her inventory and gain more profit so that she can help her children better themselves through their studies.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de maniquíes para exhibición / Purchase of exhibition mannequins

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of materials and products for her small salon

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of beauty products, fuel and meat to operate her small businesses

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a collection of clothing to add to her stock.

loans.name: Lucrecia Nury

texts.es: Doña Lucrecia tiene 55 años de edad,  habita en villa Reconciliación, es soltera y tiene dos hijos mayores de edad de 30 y 33 años de edad. Doña Lucrecia se dedica al comercio, tiene una pequeña tienda en donde ofrece ropa y cosméticos. Este negocio lo ha venido desarrollando hace ya  mucho tiempo, inició solamente con ventas de cosméticos ya que el capital era propio y no contaba con mucho dinero. Con el paso del tiempo su negocio ha ido creciendo y hoy en día tiene una pequeña tienda en donde atiende a sus clientes y vecinos. Anteriormente tenía un negocio de ventas de bloques, pero en busca de mejores condiciones de vida decidió dedicarse a la venta de ropa y cosméticos. El uso del préstamo será para la compra de 4 vitrinas de vidrio, para poder organizar mejor sus productos y tener una mejor exhibición de ellos.
texts.en:
Ms. Lucrecia is 55 years old, lives in Villa Reconciliación, and is single with 2 grown children (ages 30 and 33). Ms. Lucrecia works in the commerce industry. She owns a small store that offers clothing and cosmetics. Her business has been around for a long time. She used her own funds to get her business started and initially only sold cosmetics, because she didn’t have a lot of money. As time passed, her business grew and nowadays her store is frequented by neighbors and clients. Beforehand she had a block business but in search of better living conditions, she decided to dedicate herself to the clothing and cosmetic business. The loan will be used to buy four glass showcases. The showcases will, in turn, allow for better organization and display of her products.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of four glass showcases

loans.name: Magda

texts.es: Magda habita en el barrio Comarca Sabana Grande de Managua tiene 38 años de edad, es casada, y tiene tres hijos de 15,16 y 18 años de edad que están estudiando, su esposo se dedica a la compra y destace de ganado vacuno y porcino. Doña Magda apoya a su esposo en el negocio, ella destaza y vende carne de cerdo en su casa de habitación. Negocio en el cual lleva ya 8 años. La dificultad mayor que ha encontrado ha sido la dificultad para poder trasladar el producto, es por eso que en un futuro espera poder reunir dinero para comprar una camioneta y que se le haga más fácil el traslado del producto. El negocio lo inició con préstamos a AFODENIC y es a través de estos que ha ido mejorando, el uso de este crédito será para la compra de 10 cerdos para engordarlos y luego comercializar la carne a sus clientes y demás personas que requieran de este producto.
texts.en:
Magda lives in the Comarca Sabana Grande neighborhood of Managua. She is thirty-eight years old and is married with three children of fifteen, sixteen, and eighteen years of age. All three children are currently students, and her husband works buying and cutting up cattle and pigs. Mrs. Magda works with her husband in this business, cutting up and selling pork meat from her home. She has been in this business for the past eight years. Her greatest difficulty has been finding a means of transporting these products. She hopes, in the future, to collect the money necessary to buy a small truck so as to facilitate product transfer. Initially, Mr. and Mrs. Magda were able to launch their business thanks to loans from AFODENIC, and through these they have been able to improve their business. If able to obtain this new loan, they hope to buy ten more pigs, which will be raised so that their meat can later be sold to both old and new clients.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ten pigs

loans.name: Ana Aracely

texts.es:
La dama Ana G. G. se dedica con mucho esfuerzo a su actividad económica de venta de joyas ofreciéndolas en su casa de habitación y en ocasiones ambulantemente en lugares específicos. Con este negocio ha logrado mantener a su familia el cual necesita de su apoyo por lo que tiene dos pequeños hijos que mantener en su municipio de San Rafael del sur en Managua.

Ceprodel le ha beneficiado grandemente en al compra de las joyas por lo que le ha brindado créditos que los ha utilizado en la compra de sus productos para comercializarlos. Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel con el único propósito de obtener un nuevo crédito para la compra de estas joyas y así comercializarlas en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
The woman Ana G. G. works very hard at her economic activity of selling jewelry, offering it from her home and occasionally in specific parts of open-air markets. With this business, she has been able to support her family. The family needs her help because there are two small children to maintain in her community of San Rafael del Sur in Managua. CEDPRODEL has hugely assisted her with the purchase of the jewelry because it has provided her with loans that she has used to purchase her products in order to commercialise them. Currently, she has approached CEDPRODEL with this proposition to obtain a new loan for the purchase of this jewelry and so be able to sell it from her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jewelry to sell

loans.name: Jilma Ninoska

texts.es:
La señora Jilma A. se dedica al negocio de pulpería atendido en su casa de habitación en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua. Es una dama que con muchos esfuerzos ha logrado salir adelante y ha beneficiado a su pequeño hijo en edad escolar.

Como todo negocio en desarrollo, la pulpería de la señora Jilma requiere de inversión inmediata en los productos y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la adquisición de dichos productos para ofrecerlos en el negocio. Actualmente se ha caracterizado por ser una fiel cliente habiendo cancelado todos sus anteriores créditos satisfactoriamente.
texts.en:
Ms. Jilma A. runs a local store from her own house, which is located in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur, Managua. She has made a big effort in order to go forward, and this has greatly benefited her school-age son.

Like all developing businesses, Mrs. A.’s business needs immediate investments. In order to acquire the funds that she needs, she has turned to Ceprodel. She wants to obtain a loan that will allow her to acquire the products that she will offer in her business. She is currently considered to be a loyal client, since she has satisfactorily payed off all her previous loans.


Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products to be sold

loans.name: María Ofelia

texts.es:
La señora María Ofelia C. es originaria del municipio de San Rafael del Sur y se dedica con muchísimo esfuerzo a la actividad de costurería en su casa de habitación donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes que requieren el servicio de elaboración de vestidos pantalones, camisas o bien su reparación.

La señora María Ofelia hoy en día ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario con el cual adquirir sus materiales de trabajo como lo son hilos, telas, agujas, etc. Por este motivo espera en que su crédito le será otorgado y de esta forma suplir su necesidad en el negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Ofelia C. comes from the San Rafael del Sur municipality and she works as a seamstress. She works from her house, where she warmly attends the clients who want dresses, pants, and shirts either elaborated or repaired. Mrs. María Ofelia today has gone to Ceprodel to try to get the credit she needs to purchase her work supplies, which include cloth, needles, thread, etc. She hopes that she will be given the credit she needs to fund her business.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de materiales de trabajo/Purchase of sewing work supplies

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación Sur, tiene 32 años, es casada,  su esposo es odontólogo y trabaja en una clínica, tiene dos hijos de 13 y 15 años de edad que están cursando la primaria, Victoria es maestra de primaria tiene cuatro años de trabajar en un instituto, anteriormente trabajaba dando clases en un CDI, ella todavía está estudiando la licenciatura en pedagogía, desea llegar a realizarse como persona y como mujer tanto a nivel personal como profesional. Es por eso que está invirtiendo en la mejora de su vivienda, para darle una mejor vida y más comodidad a su familia. Con la solicitud del préstamo comprará materiales de construcción para hacer un muro en la parte delantera de su vivienda y darle más seguridad. Ya que en el día sus dos hijos se encuentran solos y desea protegerlos de la delincuencia que hay en el barrio.
texts.en:
Vicgtoria lives in the Villa Reconciliacion Sur neighborhood, she is 32 years old and she is married. Her husband is a dentist and he is employed at a clinic. They have two children who are 13 and 15-years old who are in elementary school. Victoria is a elementary school teacher, she has been employed at the same Institute for four years. Previously she was teaching at a CDI school. She is still studying Pedagogy. She wants to be fulfill as a woman and as a human being at the personal level and as well as the professionally.

For this reason she is investing to improve her house to be able to provide a better life and comfort to her family. With the loan she will buy construction materials to build o a wall in the front part of her house in order to be more safe, since during the day her two children are are alone and she wants to protect them from the crime present in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall in the front of her house.

loans.name: Sadai

texts.es:
Sadai G. B. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit. Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families’ incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home.

Sadai es madre soltera tiene dos hijos a los cuales les quiere dejar un patrimonio ya que ellos viven en la casa de su cuñado y quieren tener su propio espacio, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora. Esta Señora tiene un empleo en el cual con el transcurso del tiempo fue acumulando suficientes puntos y así ella busco la forma de poder adquirir una casa, se contacto con una inmobiliaria pero esta le comento que aún así le faltaba una cierta cantidad de dinero. La cantidad que ella requiere es $600 dólares.
texts.en:
Sadai G. B. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit. Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families' incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home. Sadai is a single mother of two. She would like to leave a nest egg to her children. They live with her brother-in-law and they would like to one day own a home. She's a hard worker and very goal-oriented. She has a job where with a lot of time she has been able to accumulate enough points (credit) to purchase a house. She found out through her lender that she still needs to come up with some money. The total amount she needs is $600.


Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a home

loans.name: Leonel

texts.es: Don Leonel tiene 43 años de edad, habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, su esposa trabaja en un comedor como cocinera, tiene tres hijos de 2, 9 y 13 años de edad,  los cuales están cursando la primaria. El Sr. Leonel es responsable de cobrar las ordenes de comida a los clientes ya que él trabaja en un restaurante, en el cual lleva nueve años laborando, aunque es un trabajo cansado pero le genera buenas propinas ya que trabaja desde horas muy tempranas hasta las diez de la noche. La solicitud de préstamo es para hacer mejoras en su vivienda, en la construcción de un muro para el cual necesita comprar piedras, arena, cemento y hierro. A largo plazo es poder seguir haciendo mejoras en su vivienda para su familia , poder ayudar a sus hijos que no le falte nada y también tener la oportunidad de prepararlos con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Don Leonel is 43 years old, he lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood. His wife is employed at a canteen as a cook. They have 3 children who are 2, 9 and 13 years old who are in elementary school. Mr. Leonel is responsible of charging for the meal orders from the clients at the restaurant where he has worked for the past 9 years. Although it's a exhausting job, he gets good tips because he works from very early hours to ten o'clock at night.

He will use the loan to do improvements to his house. He plans to build a wall, so he needs to buy stones, sand, cement and iron. In the long term, he plans to keep on doing improvements his house for his family, he doesn't want his children to lack anything and also he wants them to have the opportunity to go to school.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Start the construction of a wall for his house.

loans.name: Yelba Rosa

texts.es: Yelba habita en el barrio 3-80, es casada y tiene 47 años de edad,  tiene un hijo de 16 años de edad, qué cursa la secundaria, su esposo es comerciante y conductor de taxi de su propiedad. El negocio de Yelba es la venta de nacatamales. Empezó vendiendo sopa los días domingos en su casa de habitación, pero decidió aprovechar el buen sazón que tiene y empezó también hace dos años las ventas de nacatamales. La solicitud del préstamo es para inversión de su negocio, ya que desea mejorar la infraestructura del local donde vende nacatamales y así poder mejorar la atención que ofrece a sus clientes. Espera que con este negocio pueda cumplir el sueño de poder educar a su hijo para que éste sea una persona de bien a la sociedad.
texts.en:
Yelba lives in the 3-80 neighborhood. She is is married and she is 47 years old. She has a 16-year-old son, who is in middle school. Her husband is a merchant and driver of his own taxi. Yelba's business is the sales of nacatamales (Honduran tamales). She started by selling soup on Sundays at her house, but she decided to make good use of her seasoning skills ans she started selling nacatamales two years ago. She plans to use the requested loan in her business, since she wants to improve the infrastructure of the place where she sells the nacatamales and to be able to improve the service to her clients. She hopes that with this business she will be able to her fulfill dream of being able to provide the education to her son so he can be a person of good to society.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve the infrastructure of her business premises.

loans.name: Wendy Yamileth

texts.es: Wendy tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y habita en Las América III de la iglesia católica 1 c arriba, trabaja como enfermera en un centro de salud de Managua desde hace 2 años, sacó un curso de auxiliar de enfermería y ya pronto espera terminar sus estudios universitarios y luego poder sacar una maestría. Wendy vive en la casa de sus padres, la cual es muy pequeña, es por eso que Wendy decidió invertir en la construcción de una habitación para ella, que le pueda dar mayor comodidad tanto a ella como a su familia.
texts.en:
Wendy is 22 years old. She is single and lives in the Las America III neighborhood, one block from the Catholic church. She has been working as a nurse in a health clinic in Managua for the past two years. She took a course in assistant nursing and will soon finish her university studies, after which she will be able to get a masters degree. Wendy lives in her parent’s house, which is very small. That is why Wendy decided to invest in constructing a room for herself, which will make things more comfortable for both herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Iniciar construcción de un cuarto en su vivienda

loans.name: Consuelo De Los Ange

texts.es: La Sra. Consuelo trabaja en Enacal como analista de inventario y activo fijo, con 10 años de servicio, tiene 36 años de edad y está casada con el Sr. José David Montiel conductor de la misma institución, tienen una niña de 3 años.Su horario de trabajo es de 7:30am a 8:00pm de lunes a sábado, está solicitando su 7mo. crédito para mejora de su vivienda (contrucción de un cuarto), ya que su casa solo tiene un dormitorio y su niña está creciendo y quiere darle mayores condiciones y privacidad. Con sus créditos anteriores ha realizado algunas mejoras en su vivienda y ha comprado sus electrodomésticos, ha sido una cliente que ha pagado sus créditos antes de la fecha establecida porque quiere mantener siempre su buen record créditicio.
texts.en:
Consuelo has worked for 10 years in Enacal as an inventory and fixed asset analyst. She is 36 years old and is married to Jose David Montiel, who is the manager of the institution. They have a 3 year-old daughter. Consuelo's work schedule is from 7:30am to 8:00pm, Monday through Friday. She is requesting her seventh loan for the purpose of improving her house (construction of a room), because her house only has one bedroom and her daughter is growing and she wants to give her better conditions and more privacy. With her previous loans she has completed some improvements to her house and has bought household appliances. She has been a client who has paid her loans back before the due date because she wants to always maintain her good credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Contrucción de un cuarto

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.es: El profesor Q. de 36 años de edad, está casado desde hace 10 años con la profesora Karina Castro González quien trabaja en el MINED como supervisora, con 5 años de servicio. El profesor está solicitando su 7mo crédito, el que utilizará para reparar el piso de su casa, sus créditos anteriores los ha utilizado para la construcción de su casa, para él ha sido un reto la construcción de su vivienda pero con esfuerzo propio y la ayuda de los créditos que ha sido lo fundamental pudo lograr su sueño ya que con su salario no hubiera sido posible. Piensa seguir manteniendo su récord crediticio. Su propósito es continuar mejorando la casa en el futuro, hará otros créditos para la pintura y piensa que su vivienda estará lista para cuando lleguen los hijos.
texts.en:
Professor Q., 36 years old, has been married for 10 years to Professor Karina Castro González who has worked for 5 years as a supervisor in MINED. The professor is requesting his seventh loan, which he will use to finish the floor of his house. He has used previous loans to build his house. The construction of his home has been a challenge for him, but his own effort and the help of the loans have been fundamental in achieving his dream, since it would not have been possible on his salary. He intends to continue to maintain his credit history, planning to continue improving the house. He will take another loan for painting, and he expects that his home will be ready when children arrive.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement, to tile the living room floor of his house

loans.name: Larry Luis

texts.es: El Sr. O. de 31 años de edad, casado con Soraya F. García, tiene 1 hija de 7 años estudiando el 1er. Grado, habita en casa de la suegra donde construirá un cuarto para tener más privacidad y condiciones, trabaja como conductor sin horario desde las 6:00am. en el Silais, su esposa se dedica a las labores domesticas de su casa. Está solicitando su 5to crédito, los créditos los ha cancelado con anticipación ganandose el record de categoria "A". Para cumplir con su trabajo se levanta desde muy temprano regresando a su hogar hasta horas muy tarde de la noche.
texts.en:
O. is 31 years old and is married to Soraya F. Garcia. He has a 7 year-old daughter studying in first grade. He lives in his mother-in-law’s house, where he will build a room in order to have more privacy and better conditions. He works as a driver with no regular work schedule starting at 6:00am in Silais. His wife is a homemaker. He is requesting his fifth loan. He has repaid his loans ahead of time and earned a history of category “A”. In order to do his job, he gets up very early and returns home very late.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mejora de vivienda - Construcción de un cuarto

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: La Sra. Cecilia J., soltera, 38 años de edad, con 2 hijos, 1 mujer de 14 años estudiando el 2do.año de secundaria y un varón de 20 años estudiando el 4to.año de universidad de la carrera de administración de empresa, en el turno sabatino. La Sra. J. es una mujer sola, sin ayuda de nadie y con mucho esfuerzo está preparando a sus hijos, trabaja en el hospital Asunción de Juigalpa, como aseadora desde hace 18 años con un horario de 6:00am a 5:00pm también hace turnos nocturnos 3 días al mes de 6:00pm a 5:00am. Esta solicitando su crédito No.7 el que utilizará para comprar piedra cantera y forrar la cocina pues en estos momentos está forrada con tabla y en muy malas condiciones, está haciendo este esfuerzo porque su casa es de un proyecto y no tenía espacio para cocinar, ahora quiere darle mayor seguridad a su cocina y a su casa en general.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cecilia J. is single, 38 years old and has two children: one girl who is fourteen and in her second year of secondary school, and a son who is 20 years old and in his 4th year at the university studying business administration. Mrs. J. is alone, and receives help from no one. With much effort, she has helped to prepare her children for life. She has worked as a room attendant at the Asunción de Juigalpa hospital for the past 18 years, with a schedule of 6:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. She also works night shifts three days per week, from 6:00 p.m. to 5:00 a.m. She is seeking her seventh loan to purchase quarry stone to cover the kitchen which is currently covered by planks and in very bad condition. She is making this effort because her house is in a project and she didn’t have any room to cook. She now wants to provide greater security for her kitchen and for her house in general.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make repairs to her kitchen.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
La Sra. María Antonia y su Esposo José Luis quieren que sus hijos tengo lo mejor para la escuela es por eso que están solicitando un préstamo para comprar les una computadora para que no tengo problemas al realizar los trabajos que les encarga en la escuela. 
La Sra. María es la que se encarga de la familia mientras que el Sr. José trabaja en una compañía que se dedican a la exportación de mercancía en la republica Mexicana el Sr. José esta en el puesta de tramitador y documentados, esté es le ingreso que tiene para sacar a su familia adelante y quiere que sus hijos tengan el mejor estudio para su futoro.
La Sra. María Antonia no cuenta con el dinero para comprar la computadora que necesitan sus hijos es por eso que se acerco a Fvp y a  Kiva para solicitando un préstamo de $475.00 dlls.
texts.en:
Mrs.Maria Antonia and her husband Jose Luis want their children to have the best for school and that is why they are requesting a loan to purchase a computer, so that the children do not have any problems completing the work that is assigned to them at school.

Mrs. Maria is the one that is in charge of the children while Mr. Jose works at a company dedicated to exporting merchandise in Mexico. Mr. Jose has the job of processing documents and this is the income that he has to move the family ahead. He wants his children to have the best education for their future.

Mrs. Maria Antonia does not have the money to buy the computer that her children need, and that is the reason for her turning to Fvp and Kiva to request a loan of USD $475.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a computer for her children.

loans.name: Huon

texts.en:
Mrs Huon M. is a villager in Chek village in Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr Muth Meth, are pig breeders. They now raise 20 pigs and their pigs grow bigger and bigger. Mrs Huon M. does not have enough money to buy more pig food to feed them. Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more pig food and she would use the rest of the loan to fix her piggery.

Mrs Huon M. is 35 years old and the mother of five children, one who is a farmer while the other three are enrolled in school. The youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more pig food and to fix her piggery.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment
